"Schedule?"

"Isn't your room across the hall?" Shani's place was a rented townhouse, with a small garage. On the main floor was the kitchen, living room, and a small dining area, as well as a two-piece bath. Upstairs, where they currently were, was two bedrooms with a three-piece bath directly between them. And, as Chris was about to learn, there was more to the basement then he assumed.

"No, I'm in the basement suite. It's got its own bathroom. This one is all yours."

"Are you planning another room mate for the other bedroom?"

"Nah, I just use it for storage." Shani didn't want to say that it had been Bruce's room before their break-up, and that she had a lot of bad memories in there. After he was out, she'd closed the door, and hadn't looked inside since. "The washer and dryer is in the garage, just beside the deep freeze. It's honestly pretty small, so your truck won't fit."

"That's fine. I can just park 'er out back." There was a line of parking spots just off the back lane, with a spot reserved for each townhouse.

"You're fine driving on a dirt road?"

"My truck's been through worse," Chris said as he rose to his feet. "As much as I'd like to take a shower and collapse right now, I should probably get the rest of my stuff in before it gets too late."

"I'll give you a hand."

Chris thought back to how hard Shani had been breathing from climbing that flight of stairs once, and she hadn't even been carrying anything. Chris thought to himself, "And if she's in that bad of shape..."

"There's no need, Shani. You're already letting me stay here."

"Nonsense. We can just put it in the spare bedroom for now and deal with it tomorrow. With the two of us, it'll be no sweat."

*** *** ***

"Jesus... *pant, gasp* ...fucking... *pant, gasp*... Christ," Shani gasped out between strained breaths.

Her rapid and significant weight gain, coupled with a total lack of even the most minuscule amount of exercise, had left her poor muscles woefully unprepared to handle several flights of stairs period, let alone with a load. The first trip had seen her already panting and sweating, and by the end of the second, she had to sit on the bed and take a break.

Chris had managed two more trips while she was resting, checking up on her both times, and Shani forced herself to her feet afterwards, desperate to avoid forcing him to do all the work. She only managed a single trip this time, collapsing on the bed while he did the final trip alone. It certainly hadn't escaped her notice that his loads had been significantly larger then her own, even had they done an equal number of trips.

"Am I really that out of shape?" Shani thought, her chest heaving as she wiped the sweat from her brow. She didn't notice anything when Bruce was moving out. Of course, as she thought about it, she realized that she'd merely supervised from the ground floor, refusing to help him in the slightest, only climbing those two flights to check afterwards and make sure he hadn't stolen or damaged anything.

Chris, meanwhile, was feeling very conflicted. On the one hand, he was legitimately worried about her. For Shani to be so exhausted after so little work, and still struggling to catch her breath after such a long time, she must be in appalling shape. Her rapid expansion over the short time they'd been friends had also been quite shocking, and despite some of his hopes otherwise, she still seemed to be piling on the pounds even without Bruce in the picture.

On the other, he was entranced by her body. Though he hadn't admitted it publicly to anyone, Chris had always loved fat women, and Shani had firmly entered fat territory. Her pot belly was a fair bit larger then it had been when he last saw her. Divided into two large rolls, it had wobbled magnificently with each heavy step. Her round thighs and enlarged posterior had a significant and flabby bounce that he hadn't failed to notice as he climbed the stairs behind her.

Even as she caught her breath in front of him, he couldn't help but notice her breasts, and what a pair they were. She was unquestionably a D, if not an E. Nothing was left to the imagination in a skin-tight white spaghetti strapped top. It was clear that her bra was too small for her massive mammaries, and their mass was certainly lard, as they rippled like jelly with each shuddering breath.

Matters were made more complicated by his feelings towards her. He'd had a crush on Shani since they'd met, but it always seemed one or the other was taken at the wrong moment. Chris had, by this point, all but settled on just being her friend, but it wasn't easy at a moment like this...

It was only then that he realized that he'd totally missed on Shani saying something. "Sorry, I zoned out. Come again?"

She appeared to have (mostly) caught her breath, and if she'd noticed him staring, she gave no sign. "I said, since we've now got all your stuff inside, what do you want to do now?"
1513112.title: Shani - Blobbing Basement Beauty

15131121.content:
"We could just pop in a film or something. Definitely want to shower first. I've acquired a certain... patina over the last few days."

"You know, I wasn't going to say anything, but..."

"Ouch. You wound me," Chris said while Shani giggled. Deftly trying to avoid noticing the wonderful jiggles her laughter sent through her soft body, he added, "You could grab a couple movies while I knock off a layer of grease. Should only take me about ten minutes or so."

"Works for me," Shani said as she leaned forward to rise. The movement squished her bloated rolls and moved her breasts in some rather enticing ways, and it was with great difficulty that Chris looked away before she looked up. "I'll grab a couple titles and see you down there."

"Sounds good. I'll be down in a just a minute." His eyes were locked on Shani's bouncing rump as she walked out the door. As he shut the door, Chris couldn't help but eye up her thick back rolls, squeezing enticingly around her tight bra strap, and slightly damp with sweat. As the door clicked shut, he rested his head against it.

"Oh. My. God. This cannot end well." Chris couldn't help but kick himself a little. He just couldn't keep his eyes off her.

"This is ridiculous. She's just out of a bad relationship, and doesn't need you drooling over her right now.

"Of course, some compliments would certainly help her ego right now. And she really does deserve them. I mean, the only thing hotter then a fat woman is one that's getting fatter, and she's been gaining so much, so quickly. I wonder how much bigger she's going to get...

"Jesus, man, get it together. This is Shani you're talking about."

Blaming his rather distracted mind on several days of poor sleep, Chris grabbed his towel and shower supplies, and made his way into the bathroom.

*** *** ***

Chris made his way down, smelling and feeling fresh for the first time in a good while. As he reached the bottom of the stairs, he saw Shani was seated upon the couch, remote in hand.

She'd obviously been to her room at some point, as she'd changed out her white top for a well worn pink sweater. Chris did feel a little bad with himself for how disappointed he felt at that fact. Sitting down next to her, he noticed a sweet, rosy smell. "She must have freshened up before getting changed."

He was given a bit of a shock when he sat down, as Shani leaned over and took a deep sniff off his right shoulder. "Ah, that's so much better."

A coy smile crossed his face. "Implying something?"

"Yes. You smelled like a wildebeest in heat."

"Well, that's just rude," Chris said to another giggle. "Did we want to order pizza or something before we start?"

Shani's gaze briefly dropped to her belly, which was currently stretching the knitted yarn of her sweater. "Oh, I don't know. I mean, we did just eat about an hour ago."

"Oh, come on, it's my treat. Just to celebrate my moving in." A soft gurgle came from Shani's stomach, bringing a blush to her cheeks. "It seems like you could use a snack anyway."

"Well, okay," she said as she rubbed her double-rolled belly as discretely as she could. Though she didn't want to admit it aloud, Shani was feeling a bit hungry. She'd gotten very used to eating as much as she wanted, whenever she wanted, and while she wasn't actually dieting, she was a little self-conscious of her recently expanded girth. She grimaced as she said, "not like I need it, though."

"Don't be hard on yourself. You're gorgeous," Chris said as he tapped away on his phone.

Shani's blush got a little darker. She smiled and snuggled into Chris' shoulder. He looked over in surprise at the young woman leaning against him. As he looked at her, he became aware through touch and sight that she wasn't currently wearing a bra, having likely shed it when she put on her sweater.

"Thanks for that."

"D-don't mention it," Chris stammered as he clicked send on the order. "So, w-what did you pick for a movie?"
15131121.title: Watch a movie, and maybe more?

151312.content: So which of our two love birds (or just friends) is gaining some extra pounds and inches?
151312.title: We swear we're just friends

152.content: So you're the woman in this relationship? Very well! Let's begin with our new set of options. What's happening to our couple?
152.title: Boy/Girl, as the Girl. Name your poison.

1521.content: Who's gets to be transformed? For now anyway.
1521.title: TF, but who? (Last set of options).

choices: Cat wakes up slightly 'bigger'...And there are claw marks all over her pillow.
15211.content:
Alex Lenard...Just his name sent shivers down Catherine's spine. He was so popular, and had the good looks to match. Jet black hair, a well toned body, bright blue eyes... But it wasn't just the looks that made him a knock out for Cat. He was kind, always said hello to her whenever he saw her. He knew a fair bit about anime and manga, which Cat worshiped like the geek she was. And he was generally a nice person. He did charity work on the weekends. CHARITY WORK! Who wouldn't like Alex? Everyone in school knew him, and there were few people that had something bad to say about him. He was perfect!

Well, okay, almost perfect...

Cat yelped as a hand smacked her in the back of her head. Unfortunately it belonged to the last person Cat wanted to notice her ogling Alex from her desk...

"What are you looking at there, flat-girl?" It was Marlene, the biggest bitch that ever bitched at a car-full of bitches. Sadly she was also Alex's current girlfriend, much to Cat's constant dismay.

"Nothing...Just doodling as always, Marlene." She answered, Cat hated being called flat-girl due to her features. Or rather, lack of thereof.

Marlene huffed, and released Cat's dyed orange head. "I saw you, you were watching my man again. You chibi-obsessed freak. You do it one more time and I'll cut off all that orange hair of yours."

Cat waited until she was back at her desk before muttering. "Bitch..."

Marlene wasn't exactly a nice person, especially not to Cat. Most people around the school knew her almost as well as they did Alex, though usually not for very good reasons. She had the WORST attitude imaginable. One time she knocked a small kid down and made him cry, just because he accidentally cut in front of her while in line. Who knew why Alex liked her enough to date her. Maybe she threatened him or something.

Then again, there was her body. In comparison to Cat's no curved body, Marlene looked like a stripper. She had hit puberty early, after all. Considering they were all only in their Freshman year of high school, that made Marlene the biggest girl in the grade.

It sucked. Alex was the one for Cat, and she knew it.

Thankfully, the bell for study hall rang. School was over and Cat could get home and drown out her sorrows with some good anime. Just as she was about to leave, she felt a slap on her back.

"Hey Cat! What did Marlene say to you?"

She turned. It was her best friend, and fellow geek, Tandy Birley. Tandy was more of a goth though, and appropriately wore dark attire and make-up. Of course, in truth, she came from a very well-to-do family, though she'd never exploit her money for popularity.

"Oh, nothing Tan. The usual."

"Tsk. You sure I can't hire a hit-man for you? Dad can probably find a good one, real easy."

Cat laughed. "No that's alright. I wouldn't want to get YOU in trouble."

"Tut tut. Assassin's aren't expensive for no reason, but if you're sure."

They made it to the doorway, but Alex got there before them. Being courteous, he motioned for them to go on through first.

"After you, ladies."

Cat blushed but didn't say anything, Tandy answered for her. "Thank Al."

He warmly smiled at them, while Marlene glared at Cat from behind him. Wasn't Cat's fault, Marlene said nothing about Alex HIMSELF speaking to them.

~

The two girls went to Cat's house to work on some homework and watch anime together. Spending time with Tandy usually put her mind off things, the two had been inseparable friends since the beginning of school last fall. But of course, thoughts of Alex and how to win him over always filled Cat's head. No matter what she did.

"Feels good to have everything done at last for the week." Said Tandy as she stretched, having finished their last assignment. "Tomorrow's Friday, right?"

"Yep." Cat was exceptionally more brighter than Tandy, and usually finished before her. "Need help with anything else?"

"Nope. Just gotta do that stupid reading. What was it again?" She did several finger quotes. "Ancient Magical Studies and Relations to Animals. What a load of bull, I say."

Cat laughed a little nervously. She hadn't mentioned it before, but her parents were both druids and into that sort of beliefs. She had just never brought it up with anyone before, the last thing she needed was more ammunition against her when it came to her whole Marlene issue. Of course, she herself had never really looked into the magical beliefs of her parents.

"Well, I'm going."

"Want me to get dad to drive you home?"

"Nah, I'll walk. No one wants to go near anyone who looks like a vampire in the middle of the night anyway. Later Cat."

She left, and the room got depressingly quiet. Leaving Cat alone with her thoughts about Alex again. She looked at the clock, "9:30". A little early for bed, but there was nothing else to do tonight anyway. She went to her bed and noticed that there was something on top of the covers, it appeared to be a small box with a note.

"Huh, what's this?" Cat said to herself, picking up the note to read it. "'Cat. This is a little something from your father and I. It's a lucky coin. For years it's given me tons of luck and something tells me you need that luck right about now. Don't mention it. Mom.'"

Opening the box, Cat found a very small silver coin. It looked really old, like hundreds of year old. But on the face was a very clear indentation of a cat. Hah, funny. Just like her name. And her favorite animal to boot.

She rubbed the cat with her thumb. "Huh, lucky coin? Well I certainly could use a lot of luck right about now. How about you work whatever magic on helping me get noticed by Alex."

Cat half-expected there to be a sudden spark of magic, like in Cinderella. Maybe bring her up a cup side at least, something! Nothing happened though and she sighed, placing the coin on her bed stand.

"Magic? Yeah right, time for bed."
15211.title: The boy, the bitch, and the geek.

choices: During school, Cat decides to show Marlene how much of a bitch she really is
She experiences a craving for milk.
152111.content:
The next morning, Cat awoke feeling great.

She had had a relaxing rest and had some strange dream she couldn't quite recall. Still she did feel different, but this time it was something external.

"Did my breasts grow?" Cat asked herself.

Before she certainly was flat-chested, but now she was in the B cup range.

Not only that, but she seemed to be taller, and her nails were a tad sharper.

"How weird." Cat muttered, "Still, this is great! I can't wait to tell Tandy, and show Alex!"

The nerdy girl was so ecstatic that she didn't notice the mauled remains of her pillows.

After she was changed and ready for school, she noticed her coin was on the table.

'It must've been this charm,' Cat concluded. 'Maybe I could use this...'

Still, Cat didn't realize the price that came with her new found toy, and it'd be awhile before she did.
152111.title: Cat's new charm!

1521111.content:
There was a spring in Cat's step today, a feeling she hadn't had in a long time. Indeed it had been awhile since she was actually looking FORWARD to school instead of dreading its very existence. Either it was the magic of the coin, if there were such a thing, or a late growth spurt. Either way, Cat was noticeably bigger all around. So much so that her clothes were a little tight on her, but still not unwearable.

She hummed her way through breakfast and almost forgot to say goodbye to her parents before taking off to the bus, though her mother seemed to eye her the whole time with both a look of suspicion and amusement.

An hour later, she practically ran towards the school looking for Tandy to tell her the good news. She was in such a hurry that she mistakenly ran into someone, and knocked their books over.

Springing instantly to her feet with an unusual amount of agility, she apologized. "Oh crap! I'm sorry about that! I didn't see you and was in a hurry, my ba-"

She stopped, for it was Alex who she knocked over! He chuckled. "It's alright Cat, no harm done."

Blushing, she tried to give a reply. "U-uh huh. W-well, a-again I'm sorry..."

Alex eyed her curiously. "Say, you look different. Did you get a haircut or something?"

She took a deep breath. "Yesididnowifyouexcusemeireallygottaberunningalexokaysorryagainbye." And in instant she ran for the doors of the school.

Alex blinked several times. "Huh. Well that was sure weird."

~

Tandy laughed at Cat over lunch. "So you ran right into him!? Smooth, girl. Real smooth." She took another sip of her coffee while Cat sat there blushing. "By the way, did you get a haircut or something? You look different."

That's right! The thoughts of the coin had completely slipped her mind the entire day. "Oh right! I forgot to show you."

She reached into her pocket and pulled out the silver coin with a cat on it, gently placing it in Tandy's palm. The goth stared at it, trying to figure it out before saying.

"It's a coin so what?"

"My mom left it on the bed last night. I don't know what's up about it, but when I woke up," She gestured to her chest. "I was 'bigger' for some reason."

Tandy snapped her fingers. "THAT'S it! You look bigger, and not just there. Here stand up for a sec."

Cat obeyed, and was stunned by what she saw. Normally Tandy was a good few inches taller than her. Today, they were exactly the same height, a little more than 5'4 each. Tandy reached up at the top of her head.

"How about that, even exactly. And that's not all! Look at your nails."

Cat hadn't even noticed the sharpened points on her nails all day! They almost looked like... "...Claws?"

Tandy chuckled. "Feeling catty today, Cat?" She held up the coin, the picture of the cat beamed in the reflection of light.

"Okay...Now that I think about it, that's really weird. Do you think...Do you think the coin had anything to do with it?"

Tandy flipped the coin back to Cat. "You know me Cat. I don't believe in that hocus pocus, mumbo jumbo stuff. Still there's always such a thing as a good luck charm. Why not hold onto it and see what happens tomorrow? Who knows? Maybe you're really be a Cat-girl." She grinned.

"Yeah...A Cat-girl..."

~

The bell for gym rang, Cat's least favorite period. Marlene ALWAYS loved to pick on her with a practical joke. One time, she and a few other girls were able to steal her clothes from her locker and toss them in the boy's locker room. Cat was a little too deep in thought to notice that Marlene and a group of sophomores were snickering as she made her way to her locker. She opened the door.

PLUOSH! Someone had jammed a hose through the back of the locker wall and into Cat's locker! Water poured out like a fire hose, getting Cat soaked.

"Gah! Hey! Stoppit!" She cried out to no avail, getting thrown to the floor due to the pressure.

Finally one of the girls in the group had the kindness to turn off the hose, but Cat was still the laughing stock of the locker room. All of her homework and books were completely soaked and ruined. As she coughed out some of the water in her lungs, Marlene walked over to her and sneered. Cat returned a glare. The bitch had gone a little too far this time.

Slowly, a pent up anger rose to a boiling point. A red hot flare filled Cat's head and she stood up to face Marlene. The girl was still a good few inches taller than Cat and didn't feel threatened, returning the glare. Smugness was in her eyes. Cat filled them. She hated everything about that stupid bitch. This was just stepping over the line now.

Without thinking, Cat took a swipe at Marlene's face, expecting only to give her a small scratch.

Instead, blood poured in the air and Marlene cried in pain. Where Cat's fingernails had hit was thee gigantic slash marks going down her right cheek, blood was seeping everywhere. Tears were welling in Marlene's eyes.

"Owww y-you little witch! What the hell did you do that for!? OWW! It hurts! It hurts!"

Their other classmates were rushing to Marlene's aid, the sophomores were all giving Cat some really nasty looks. She got scared, she didn't mean to hurt Marlene! She just snapped, it was an innocent mistake right!? However, the blood all over the floor told a different story. Sensing danger, Cat ran out of the locker room, trying to get away. About this time, she started crying herself.

~

Outside the office was a phone booth, where students could make private calls. It was an ideal hiding spot, especially if you wanted to be alone. Cat sat on the bench, quietly sobbing; she was drenched in wet clothes and had blood on her fingers. She'd be lucky enough not to get expelled after something like this! Everyone saw what happened, Cat attacked Marlene first. No one was going to believe she didn't purposely mean to hurt her.

Today started out great, and now was looking absolutely terrible. So much for showing off to Tandy and Marlene.

As Cat wiped her nose, there was a tap on the glass door that startled her. Someone was outside the phone booth! It was...
1521111.title: Gentle as a Kitten.

15211111.content:
Cat's heart just about stopped. The last person she wanted to have him see her like this, Alex was knocking with a concerned look on his face. Quickly, she tried to wipe the rest of tears from her eyes.

"A-Alex! S-sorry I was just u-using the...p-phone. I'm done though I-I'll get out..."

Her plan to open the door and get out of there as fast as possible. Alex, however, pressed down on the glass preventing her escape.

"Not so fast. First, tell me why you were crying in there Cat." There wasn't a hint of anger in his voice, and judging by what he said he probably didn't know about the incident in the locker room yet.

"I-I wasn't crying...I was j-just...Ummm..."

The conversation couldn't get anymore awkward. It was one of those moments were all the heat in your body went to your head, and you felt like you wanted to die just to end the torture. Alex wasn't giving her any relief though.

"Cat, come on. That's not a good answer. I'm not going to tell anyone, you can trust me." His voice was calm and clear, yet authoritative.

There really was no safe way out of this. Cat felt exactly like in the position she was in, trapped in a small box with no way out. What point was there in hiding this from Alex? He was Marlene's boyfriend. He was going to find out about it sooner or later. Yes, she had to tell him about here and now. Maybe he'd take some pity on her if he heard the story from her perspective first rather than Marlene's.

"P-promise not to get mad, a-alright Alex?"

Sincerity was in his eyes. "Promise."

"W-well...M-Marlene and some girls from the s-sophomore year shoved a h-hose in my gym locker-"

"They shoved a hose in your gym locker?" Asked Alex, clearly confused.

"U-uh huh...Then, when I o-opened the door they turned it o-on. E-everything I had on me got r-ruined including my homework. I s-swear I didn't mean to. I just got SO a-angry with her. I swiped a-at her with my fingernails. I...I think I cut her really badly, t-there was blood everywhere. I-I ran away and..."

Alex was eagerly listening the whole time. He opened his mouth to say something, then closed it as if having second thoughts. Cat was grateful that he didn't look the least bit angry, at least not yet.

"I think..." He finally said. "I'll have to have a talk with her. And the principle, so you don't get in trouble for it."

"The principle!? But I-"

"No, don't worry about it. You snapped." He smiled warmly. "These things happen. Come on, I saw you were under a lot of stress this morning when you ran into me. Right?"

"I-I guess..."

He released the glass door at last. "You just weren't thinking at the time, I mean you got really sharp nails. But it's not like you killed someone, the worst she'll get is a few stitches. She'll be fine."

Opening the door, he reached out a hand which Cat took. He laughed.

"You're completely soaked, you might want to go change."

It was true, everything on her was wet and water logged. Her already tight clothing looked even tighter on her now, especially with the T-shirt around the breast area. Something she wasn't exactly used to. She noticed Alex was staring at her as well. Yelping, she covered her chest.

"Your eyes..." He said.

"Huh?"

"Sorry, I didn't mean to stare. You have really nice eyes is all." He grinned.

"O-oh...thank you...I-I guess..." Little did she realize, her eyes had become cat-like over sleep the last night. A small change she neglected to notice due to not looking properly in a mirror before school.

BRRRRRRRING! The end of class bell went off.

"Whoops! That's the bell, crap. You don't have a lot of time! Better hurry!" He turned to run for class. "See you later Cat!"

Cat was still in her own little world trying to put together what had just happened in the few short minutes she had alone with Alex. She whispered weakly "Um...Okay...Bye...."
15211111.title: The First "Real" Talk.

152111111.content:
By the time Cat was able to put her thoughts together and put on her gym clothes, class was already thirty minutes in. Thankfully it was merely history class, and Professor Fry didn't seem too bothered by her late entrance.

"Miss. Hill?" Asked the fifty year old professor, fixing his glasses. "Do you have your assignment?"

A cold bead of sweat dripped down Cat's back. She reached into her bag and pulled out a soggy wet wad of paper. It looked more like a giant inky spitball after being sprayed by the hose in the locker room. Professor Fry shook his head as she placed in on his desk and took her seat next to Tandy.

"...Very well then. Continuing with the review on Magic and History-"

Cat took a deep breath of relief, despite having everything gone totally wrong in the past hour things weren't turning out too terribly. Tandy took the time to whisper to her, about the usual gossip while Professor Fry was busy with the lesson.

"Psst! What the hell did you do to that girl, Cat!?"

Cat was truthfully hoping to avoid this conversation until Monday, or at least the weekend. Word traveled fast apparently. "I don't know...I just sort of had enough of her. I only meant to swipe at her-"

"Swipe at her!? Some kids are talking about her needing a new FACE! Boy, you stirred up the hive big time Cat. The whole school knows about it already! There was an ambulance here and everything!"

"Look, can we talk about this later? I want to catch up on what I missed." Professor Fry had given her a bit of a glare. She was probably on thin ice as it was already.

"Sure. Sure. I need to talk to you about something anyway. Let's meet at your place after school."

~

Cat had never been so thankful to get out of school. Everywhere she went in the hallway, all she heard was gossiping about her confrontation with Marlene. Some of them were getting so outlandish and insane that she was half tempted to turn around and yell at the people speaking. Seriously, someone said that she had literally bit Marlene's face off!

It was only when Tandy and her were safe and sound on the sidewalk did she finally start talking again.

"I never want to go back to school again. Ever."

Tandy laughed and patted her on the back. "Cheer up. I actually paid attention today in history class."

"Goodie for you."

"It is good, for you as well once you hear what I learned. You'll be glad you actually help me with these homework assignments for once. C'mon."

She grabbed her by the hand and started running for Cat's home. Cat had to be careful not to dig her fingernails into her friend's arm, but could still strangely keep up with her just fine. Cat's parents weren't going to be home till dinner, as usual for a Friday night. Meaning Tandy and her had the whole house to themselves discuss whatever she had discovered. Tandy didn't hesitate to lock the door to Cat's room anyway.

She then reached into her backpack and pulled out the reading meant for history class today. There were several parts highlighted in a hastily manner, it looked like she scrambled to get every down while the teacher was talking. Something Tandy probably wasn't used to, never being one to pay attention in class.

Cat finally answered to the sheet of paper shoved in her face. "So...what? You took notes in class. Well done..."

"Read!" Tandy violently tapped the highlighted bits.

With her usual super-fast reading, Cat skimmed through the page with relative ease. It mentioned a lot about the old druids that existed around the town in the past, but as it went on it got more interesting.

Cat read one bit of it aloud. "...Some of the old druids would worship animal deities. Members of their cults would create symbols like COINS of their respective gods, believing they possessed some MAGICAL proprieties!"

Cat reached into her pocket and pulled out the cat coin. "You got yourself a magically druid coin there, girl." Smirked Tandy.

"But...How...? I mean there's got to be some sort of logical explanation to this-"

"Weren't you the girl who said she always wanted to cast spells and learn magic when she was still in middle school?"

"Well...Yes but-" Cat sat on her bed, she massaged her forehead with her fingers. "Tandy...This is all too much to take in all at once. I mean first the changes, then that thing with Marlene, now this...I'm going to have a nervous breakdown!"

Tandy frowned and tried to crack a joke. "No, me doing my midterm project two hours before it was due was a nervous breakdown. Have you talked to your parents about this yet? Your mom gave you the coin right? Maybe she knows something."

"No, they won't be back till dinner either...I don't think I want to wait for them that long either. I just want to go to bed and sleep through this whole mess..." Cat reached for her pillow, only now noticing it had been torn to shreds.

"Well listen," Said Tandy, patting her nervous friend on the back. "Things will be alright, okay Cat? I made a small 'list' so to speak so you can record any changes the next day."

"Gee, thanks!"

"I'm just trying to help Cat...If you're really not in the mood for this I'll let you get some sleep, alright? I'll just leave this here." Tandy put the notepad on Cat's bed stand. Cat wasn't hearing any of it though, and had the remains of her pillow covering her head.

There was no getting through to her, Tandy quietly gathered her things and let her friend sleep.

The next day...
152111111.title: A Nightly Experiment.

1521111111.content:
Cat was running at an unbelievably fast speed. Rooftops, telephone poles, trees. Simple little obstacles that was able to jump over with ease. Nothing stood in her way, everything was so simple and so fun. It was...invigorating. She felt free, for once. Not trapped, not a geek, just herself.

It had to be dark out, maybe midnight judging by where the moon was in the sky. For some reason, she could see perfectly though. Every star in the sky and every little blade of grass clear as crystal.

The town was virtually empty at this hour, save for a few cars that drove by. Some even spotted her and slowed to a stop, but Cat didn't mind them noticing her. Her figure silhouetted the moon as she sprung into the air and landed in a dark alleyway.

Her stomach rumbled, she was hungry. Thankfully there was a few trashcans nearby, and at this point it didn't make any difference where she got the food. Her furry hands reached out grabbed the lid. Then all of a sudden, someone was shouting something at her. A man with a flashlight and security guard outfit was shining a flashlight at her, he was yelling something she couldn't make out.

"Cat, it's time to wake up."

~

In an instant, Cat sat up from her bed with a start, breathing heavily. She stared at her hands, no difference from yesterday and they even still had the claws. It wasn't like in her dream though, no fur like a cat.

"Cat, it's time to wake up."

There was no one in her room, the door had been closed since after school yesterday when Tandy left. After school... How long had she been asleep!? She couldn't have passed out later than 4 PM! She checked the clock: "9:00 AM".

"Damn..." Cat covered her face. " That's what? Seventeen hours of sleep? I've never been asleep that long be-"

Her hand brushed against something out of place on her head. Suddenly she recalled the changes from last morning. Cat scrambled for her bedroom mirror, she had changed more overnight, she was sure of it!

Reaching the mirror, she sulked her shoulders in depression. Cat ears! Pointy little car ears were poking out of her medium length orange hair. Worse too, Cat was sure she was just a little bit taller than before, if only an inch. Today was already proving to be a terrible, terrible day.

Grabbing a handful of ear in both hands, she pulled down trying to think what to do. How the hell was she supposed to hide something like this? Nails and a little height were one thing, but actual giant cat ears!?

"Just relax Cat..." She tried to talk herself down. "You can find something to hide it...It's no big deal..."

The month being late May, there was little winter clothing she could cover herself up with. Cat spent days begging her parents to let her dye her hair orange, so she hadn't invested in any good hats either. There was one thing she could try though.

Being an absolute fan-girl for the Naruto series, Cat had purchased a large blue lead headband. For cos-play purposes mostly, but there was a fat chance of that happening now. Still the headband would make an ideal thing to hide her ears with. She snatched it and went to her mirror.

Her new ears had the full nervous system of her old ones, and didn't respond too well with being tugged on.

"OW!" Yelled Cat, adjusting her ears so they completely hid from view. Easier said than done though, they felt like they were being twisted around to the point of ripping off. But at least no one could tell from a glance that she had real car hairs.

There was a knock on the door just as Cat finished. It was...
1521111111.title: Cat Nap.

choices: They bump into Alex and Marlene.
They bump into a security guard, who somehow knows Cat.
15211111111.content:
Like an ironic gothic ray of sunshine, Tandy bursted through Cat's bedroom door with a smile on her face.

"Morning sleepy head!" She greeted with a big smile. "Did you just wake up? Man, you slept like a dead person! Say...What's with the headband? Halloween's not for awhile."

Cat clasped the areas where her new cat ears were and lied. "Nothing. Just felt like wearing it"

Tandy wasn't buying it though, and squinted her eyes in suspicion. "Caaaaaat. Come on now, did you change again overnight?"

Cat was slowly backing into the corner of her room. "No! Please Tandy, can't we just drop it?"

"Pff, no that would be the kind and respectful thing to do. Friends get on your case about these things until you want to kill them." She grinned and dove at Cat. "Now give me the headband!"

Cat had trapped herself in the corner so there was no dodging Tandy, the goth girl tugged at her headband while Cat tried to keep it on her head with both hands. Tandy dangled on a loose portion of the cloth, though the strain was getting to the material. Eventually a tearing sound was heard, followed by a SNAP and a THUD!

Tandy was on the floor holding half of the ripped headband. She looked up and saw Cat, closing her eyes with two giant cat ears peaking out of her orange hair. Tandy tired to fight the laugh, but couldn't resist and started cracking up, pounding the floor in laughter.

"Hahahaha! I'm- Haha- Sorry Cat! It's just- Hah- You look ridiculous!"

Cat's ears drooped. "I know...How am I supposed to go outside now though!? I didn't have anything else to cover these things!"

Tandy wiped a few tears from her eyes. "Sorry, *sniff*. Hah! I really needed that laugh...Don't you have a hoodie or a hat? Something more...natural to wear?"

"If I did I wouldn't have worn the headband...Thanks for ripping it to pieces by the way."

Tandy sighed and reached for the clipboard on Cat's nightstand. "Well, tell you what. We'll go shopping and I'll get you a new one. Hell, we might want to go look into new clothing for you anyway. Did you grow again last night?"

Cat looked down, her stomach was visible at the bottom of her shirt. "I think I might have..."

"Huh, so that's cat ears and a little height today..." Tandy mumbled to herself, scribbling something on the board.

"Err...What are you doing?"

"Recording your changes on a daily basis. This might be important, especially if you change completely into a cat-girl. Who knows? Maybe we can estimate how much time you have left being normal."

Cat's ears were drooped again. "Well that's...comforting..." She decided to not tell Tandy about her dream last night.

Tandy grinned to try and cheer her up. "Oh come on, this isn't bad. At the rate you're going I'd say you have a week left. But you can always hide everything, I mean your nails you can cut right? And ears and a tail, if you ever grow one, should be easy enough to hide under clothing. That's why we need to go clothes shopping!"

"I guess..." Cat tugged on her ears again, they certainly were distracting. "How am I supposed to get to the mall like this without a headband though?"

~

"I had to ask..." Muttered Cat. The only thing they could think of to hide her ears was to give her a turban made of some towels from the bathroom. She felt completely ridiculous, and was considering just going through the mall exposing the ears altogether.

"Just relax and ignore the stares." Comforted Tandy. "You're doing great so far. Once we get to the store you can go into a changing booth and I'll grab you a hat to wear."

The mall was a major, major place of gathering for teenagers their age. It had an arcade, a movie theater, and dozens of stores making it the ideal teenage hangout. Of course, there would be tons of kids from their classes around which didn't help Cat's predicament. Thankfully, it was still pretty early in the day but by noon the place would be filled with the Saturday rush crowd.

Just so long as they didn't bump into someone they knew really well, they would be fine.
15211111111.title: Clothes Shopping.

choices: A mugger comes out of nowhere.
A strange man in a robe tells Cat to follow him.
152111111111.content:
Of course, as luck would have it, the moment Tandy and Cat were steps away from the entrance to the clothing store a familiar voice called out to the pair.

"Oh, hey! Cat, Tandy!" It was Alex, Marlene was also with him though she didn't seem as enthusiastic to see the two girls as Alex did. "Just the two people I wanted to see!"

Tandy whispered to Cat. "Just play it cool." Easier said than done.

Tandy greeted the couple first. "Hey Alex. Hello Marlene..." Marlene just sneered. There was a large white medical cloth held together with tape on the right side of her cheek. Cat tried not to make eye contact with the girl, thought she could feel Marlene's eyes glaring holes in her head.

"What's with the the turban?" Alex asked, pointing at the white bath towel wrapped around Cat's head.

"I...Uh...I had a bad hair day..."

"Oh, one of THOSE days huh? Well maybe this will cheer you up." Alex dug into his pockets. "You guys like anime and manga, right?"

Both girls nodded.

Alex smiled and pulled out two white pieces of paper. "You know about the Anime-Con down in Summerset this Monday?"

"Anime-Con!" Cat unexpectedly blurted out. "Those tickets are IMPOSSIBLE to get! Tandy and I tried for weeks and...and..." Cat suddenly realized that everyone was staring at her. "Uh, I mean...uh..."

Alex laughed. "It's alright. I happened to get four free tickets from a friend who didn't want them, and since no one else I know seems interested in the sort of thing I figured you guys, Marlene, and me could go together!" He offered the two tickets to Cat.

But Cat refused. "Well...T-that's nice of you Alex, b-but I don't think-"

Tandy took the tickets for her. "Thank you, Alex. We'll meet you guys Monday. Uh, what time though?"

"It opens at 9 AM, so I'd say around eight would be good. There will probably be an hour long wait to get in though, some people actually camp outside the night before to get in first. Oh, and we'll have to skip school but getting an excuse won't be a problem for you girls, right?"

Tandy rubbed the back of her head. "Well I've skipped too many classes already...But I guess one more day wouldn't hurt."

"What about you, Cat?"

"...I can p-probably make it..."

"Great! We'll stop by your place at eight on Monday then! Oh, and be sure to bring a costume. I hear you get in easier if you go costumed, anything will do. There's going to be every of kind of characters there; anime characters, game characters, heck there might even be cat-girls..." Marlene gave Alex a nasty look. She didn't seem too thrilled about going, and even less about inviting Cat and Tandy to come along.

"Anyway, sorry to interrupt your shopping, see you Tan. Later, Cat."

Marlene tugged Alex by the collar of his polo shirt to lead him away from the two girls as quickly as possible. Cat turned to Tandy in a mad panic.

"Why did you take the tickets!? We can't go with Alex! And with me like this!"

Tandy sighed. "Relax, this is a good time for you to try to make a move on Alex..."

"Tandy!"

"I'm being serious. And don't worry about going there like that. You'll be in costume remember? He won't notice a thing."

"You...already have something for me to wear?"

"No, but I think I have something in mind that will work just perfectly. Tandy gave an evil grin.

~

It was well past noon when Cat and Tandy finally finished their shopping. Cat eventually settled on a large floppy cap that hid her cat ears perfectly, though they still felt squished and uncomfortable. They had also purchased plenty of concealing clothing, which was on sale considering the warmer weather of spring. It made Cat relax a bit that even if she was going to completely turn into a cat-girl, she could at least hide her entire body so no one would notice.

The incoming summer heat though was not something she was looking forward to though. The thought of having to trug around in a winter coat all summer was not a pleasant one, indeed. Tandy had made up for ripping her ninja headband by buying her a new one, as well as several new DVDs.

They were walking down the main street of their town now, there were plenty of alleyways and old buildings. It gave the town a certain old fashion flare to it. Cat almost did a double-take when they passed by the alley she remembered in her dreams, but they quickly moved on. She never said a word about her nightmare to Tandy.

As they neared home...
152111111111.title: What are the odds...?

1521111111111.content:
Cat's house was just a few streets away, they had decided to take a small shortcut through the darker alleyways. The town they were in wasn't known for its crime, exactly. However, every once in awhile there would be some sort of robbery or mugging. Cat's luck had been nothing but terrible today.

Cat heard footsteps behind them when they were halfway down the backstreet, Tandy didn't seem to notice anything. Cat looked behind them and saw nothing.

"What's the matter, Cat?" Asked Tandy.

"Didn't you hear footsteps...or something?" Cat was sure that someone had been walking directly behind them.

Tandy looked nervous, she was the kind of person who scared easily. "Footsteps? Come on now girl, don't scare me today... I still have nightmares about what you did with the tomato sauce..."

"I'm being serious. " Said Cat, scanning behind them one last time. "I think we're being followed..."

"You're creeping me out. Maybe it's just a hobo...or something. Come on, let's get home."

Tandy went on ahead, and Cat slowly followed. She was absolutely positive she heard footsteps tailing them. Maybe it was just because her thumping heartbeat banged like in a drum in her ears, but she couldn't hear the footsteps anymore.

"Look there's the street again...Come on catch up" Said Tandy as she pointed to the light of a nearby street.

Suddenly, a large man in a trench coat jumped from behind the corner, he was armed with a black pistol. Tandy screamed, dropping her bags to the floor. The man violently grabbed her around the mouth and aimed the gun right at her forehead.

"Shut up you stupid bitch." He ripped her purse from her hands and shoved it into one of the pockets of his giant coat. He then pointed the gun at Cat. "You, hand over your purse too or your friend here gets her head blown off."

Cat couldn't move. It was like she was paralyzed with fear. Her tongue felt swollen, she couldn't say a word. Every cell in her body screamed for her to drop the purse and run. But she couldn't get herself to move, her body only shivered.

"Didn't you hear me? You stupid git." He was now aiming the gun directly at Cat. He cocked the gun. "Drop the purse. Now."

Tandy yelled something, but with the giant man's hand over her mouth it only came out in inaudible mumbles. She probably was telling Cat to do what he said, and they'd be alright. Cat still didn't do anything, her eyes were just widened in fear.

"Dumb bitch..." The man pulled the trigger. Cat watched the bullet slowly come out of the muzzle, then slow down...Stopping just a few inches from the front of the gun. In fact, everything had slowed down to stop. Strangely enough, everything had turned a black and white grayish tone as well. Time had frozen itself, though Cat still couldn't move. She held her breath.

"You're pathetic, you know that Cat?" Said a voice, as clear as day. It sounded like someone was whispering in her ear.

"Who...Who said that?" Cat thought to herself.

The voice gave a sigh. "It doesn't matter. Do you want to die?"

"Wh-what?"

"Do you want to die?"

Cat stared at the bullet, frozen in place at the barrel of the gun. It was going to kill her. She looked at the man, there was nothing but coldness in his blank dead eyes. Tandy's eyes had a look of surprise and fear in them, she must have been thinking she was about to see her friend die that very second.

"I...I...I want to live." Cat decided at last.

The voice gave a short laugh. "Then, leave everything to me. It will be over in just a few seconds."

Color was returning to the scene in front of Cat. Time was returning, Cat panicked but put faith in the voice. Her body was no longer in her control.

BOOM! The sound of the bullet being fired finally escaped the gun. Cat very clearly saw it coming right at her, but it was still slow. Like a balloon filled with air floating in space. Cat felt her body drop the bags she was carrying and jump out of the way. The bullet zoomed past the cheek of her face. She had just dodged a bullet.

The man's eyes changed from its blank look to one of complete fear, Cat was charging right at him. She remembered Marlene and how she had cut her face up pretty bad with just a swipe. Confidence returned. She was going to do much worse to this man.

He fired a panicked shot but it didn't even come close to Cat this time. She had been moving at an incredible speed, for she was already a few feet away from the man's face. The claws on her hand were ready to slice. The man was now exhibiting the same eyes Cat had, eyes widened with complete fear.

Cat snarled and ripped into the man's face. Blood was everywhere, again. But this time Cat was smiling. The man released Tandy, dropped his gun, and brought both hands to his face with was oozing crimson liquid. He screamed in pain and slowly backed away.

"Y-you crazy bitch! Gaaah! Arrrgh!"

Cat must have gotten him pretty good, he couldn't even see where he was going as he made a run for it. Cat could move her body again, but instead felt her legs give away and fall to the ground. There was blood everywhere.

"C-Cat?" Asked Tandy. Her legs also did not have the strength to allow her to stand. "Holy...shit..."

Tandy started slowly laughing, repeating "Holy Shit" over and over again. Cat laughed a little too before asking.

"S-should we tell the police?"

"And reveal to them your 'changes'?"

Cat looked at her claws, they were caked in blood again like yesterday. "I...I guess you're right."

Tandy was slowly able to stand up and went over to Cat. "Let's just go home and try to forget this ever happened. I need something to drink..."
1521111111111.title: Cat-Like Reflexes.

choices: Cat has a weird dream again, and awakens to a frightened Tandy.
They awaken in an unfamiliar place.
15211111111111.content:
Cat was still shaking by the time they got back to her house. They made their way to the kitchen and just collapsed on the chairs, not even bothering to take their shoes off. A yellow sticky note on the counter read.

"Catherine. Your father and I went out to visit some old friends for the afternoon. There's some fish in the fridge you can heat up for lunch and dinner. We may not be back until late, don't wait up. -Mom"

"Fish..." Cat repeated the word. "Fish sounds good..."

She got up to obey the hungry demands of her stomach, Cat hadn't eaten anything since yesterday school lunch. Swinging the fridge door open, she scanned around for the tasty treat. Tandy put her head down on the table, still a little freaked out by the attempted mugging.

"There anything to you have to drink in there Cat?"

Cat laid eyes on the tin foiled wrapped salmon and grabbed it before listening to her friend's request. "Let's see. We got soda, fruit punch, orange juice...Ohh..." She paused.

"What? What is it?"

Some rustling and clanging was heard, Tandy looked up to see Cat with a see-through jug filled to the brim with white liquid. "Milk..."

Cat didn't even bother to grab a glass as she torn the cap off. Tandy eyed her friend with concern. "Uh...Cat what are you doing there?"

Without a single bit of proper manner, Cat tilted her head back and started chugging the gallon of milk like a bottle beer. In just a few short seconds, Cat had drank the entire container. She gave the loudest burp Tandy had ever heard and blushed.

"Uh...Opps...Excuse me." She laughed nervously.

Tandy grabbed the empty gallon and turned it upside down. "You pig, you didn't even leave any left for me."

"I'm sorry...Didn't you want something to drink or maybe something to eat?" Cat asked, putting her plate of salmon in the microwave.

"No I'll pass now." Responded Tandy, tongue stuck out in disgust. "You made me lose my appetite...Seriously, how can you drink an ENTIRE gallon of milk without even feeling the least bit nauseated? It's not normal."

"Well," She answered, licking her lips clean of clinging drops of milk. "Maybe it has to do with the changes. I don't know, it felt like taking a big drink of ice cold water after running a marathon. Ohh...Fish is done!"

Tandy almost gave a laugh at her friend who had stuck her face in the plate of cooked fish, perhaps the changes were also affecting her in mannerisms. She shuddered at the thought of having to feed Cat cat food in a bowl on the floor.

"When you're done making a mess of yourself, what do you want to do next?"

~

The girls decided to spend the rest of the day playing video games, watching TV, and doing homework (much to the annoyance of Tandy). Tandy requested to sleep over for the night, in case some majorly bad happened to Cat during her "change time". Cat graciously accepted the offer.

After the incident with the man in the alley, both of them wanted to do nothing else for the remainder of the day. Chances are, after what Cat did to him, he would never try mugging again. Tandy suggested Cat become a superhero and go fight crime. Something which Cat flat out denied. Her life was becoming too complicated as it was, the last thing she needed was to answer a "Cat Signal" in the sky every hour.

Eventually, they had to order pizza for dinner, because Cat had eaten all the salmon. They barricaded themselves in Cat's room for the night. Tandy, however, suggested they talk to Cat's mother about the coin, though Cat didn't want to bother them. There was plenty of time the next day to do that.

They talked the remainder of the night about stuff; more superhero stuff, what sort of costume Tandy was going to wear to the Anime-Con considering she said she had one for Cat already, and other manner of girl topics.

At a little before midnight, they finally went to sleep.
15211111111111.title: An End to an Eventful Day.

152111111111111.content:
Cat was laughing. She had done something really funny, though she couldn't quite remember what. The laughter was passing as she climbed up again on the rooftops of the town, she was free again. The wind whipped across her body, making every itch of her skin feel alive.

It was a beautiful night, there wasn't a cloud in the sky. The moon wasn't full, but it still gave a bright glow lighting the roofs of the buildings cat hopped along. But the fun of running free was becoming dull, Cat felt like a child that was already bored with its new toy. She needed something exciting, maybe something daring, to do. Against better judgment, she stopped at the roof of a nice looking apartment.

It was a colorful yellow building, which made it stand out in the dead of night. Cat could see it housed more than one family, multiple garage doors at the ground level lead into the basement of the apartment. She leaned over the side of the roof, coming face to face with a large bay window.

The inside was a decorated pink color, most likely the room belonged to a girl. Stuffed animals were all over the place, including the small bed in the corner of the room. Under the covers was a sleeping little girl, she couldn't have been older than eight.

Cat's curiosity got the better of her, she quietly cracked the window open and stepped inside.

Sniffing the air, Cat recognized the scent somewhere but she shrugged it off and stood over the sleeping girl. She too seemed familiar in some way, there were certain features on her peaceful face that Cat could have sworn she'd seen somewhere before. Cat leaned in close to try to get a better scent.

The girl opened her eyes, Cat froze. Her chestnut eyes spotted Cat and she spoke softly.

"A...kitty?"

Cat had risked way too much. She bolted back for the windowsill and jumped into the night, she sensed the girl following her to the window.

"Come back kitty!"

~

"Cat!" Said Tandy, violently shaking her friend. "Cat, wake up!"

Cat was back in her bed, sweating and panting for air. She quickly sat up and held her hand to her head. It was a dream again, but it seemed so real like all the others. Tandy was standing over her, she looked completely terrified.

"Is...That you Cat?" She asked with an unusual sense of alarm.

"What do you mean, Tandy? Of course it's me!" Cat looked down to see if she had changed anymore over night. There was no fur on her arms, that was a good sign. But then why did Tandy seem so nervous?

"Oh thank god! I mean...Cat. Don't you remember anything about what happened last night?"

"What do you mean? I remember staying up till midnight...then we went to sleep. What happened?"

Tandy covered her mouth. "Yes, but...after that. About thirty minutes in...You started to make these weird growling noises. I tried to wake you up but then...you changed. And I mean completely changed. Into a cat."

"Wh-what?" Cat stood up and noticed something different right away, there was more weight on her chest area. She had probably gone up another cup size. "Tandy, what do you mean? I was a cat?"

Tandy was trying to visualize it, it must have been a terrifying thing to see your best friend turn into what could be described as a monster right before your eyes. "W-well. Like I said you started growling then...changing. God. You grew fur, bigger claws, a tail...Everything. I tried to wake you up, but you didn't until the changes stopped. You were like another person then, you started laughing then you..." She gulped.

Something was tickling Cat's legs and she turned around, she had sprouted a big bushy yellow tail. She HAD changed more overnight. "Did I...attack you Tandy?"

"I-I don't remember...I passed out when you jumped at me. Then...When I woke up you were back to normal." After nearly getting mugged and attacked by a cat person late last night, Tandy was at the edge of her rope. She huddled in the corner of the room.

Cat's ears drooped. "Tandy, I'm sorry..."

"I-It's not your fault. I'm the one who s-suggested staying here tonight." She cracked a forced smile, but Cat could tell she was really shaken. "I just thought...the real C-Cat was gone for a moment."

Cat sat next to her friend and gently touched her on the shoulder. "Well...Thank you, for staying the night. And again, I'm sorry."

"Thanks Cat..."

The two shared a moment of silence together. It had to be eight in the morning, and already the room was trashed from last night. Pizza boxes and books were everywhere. The window next to Cat's bed was wide open, presumably how her "sleeping self" escaped. Cat began to wonder if those dreams she had been having were really even dreams at all. And that voice that spoke to her yesterday...Cat shivered. The thought of something else living inside of her was just creepy.

Tandy finally noticed Cat's new tail, which flapped around slightly on its own. "You grew a tail..."

"Yeah, a tail. I just hope I never lose myself like I did last night. I-"

Suddenly there was some loud snoring coming from under Cat's bed. Both girls yelped, Cat's new tail got all spiky like an alerted cat's. Something was under the bed!

"W-what the hell is that!?" Asked Tandy.

Cat slowly got up. "I don't know...Stay there I'll check it out..."

Creeping as silently as she could, Cat tiptoed to the cloth covering underneath the darkness of the bed. Her heart was pounding as she lifted the covers. Sleeping there was...
152111111111111.title: A Wild Night.

1521111111111111.content:
For a brief second, Cat thought she was dreaming again. Sleeping under he bed, dressed in pink pajamas complete with a teddy bear, was the little girl Cat remembered in her dreams. The dreams very dreams where she became a full cat-girl and hopped around the roofs of her town. The dreams where during which, she may have attacked Tandy. Cat just stood there trying to put everything together. Her dreams couldn't POSSIBLY be real, could they?

Tandy stood up trying to see what Cat found. "Well, what is it?"

"It's... a girl. I've seen her before too..."

"WHAT!? How the hell did a girl get into your room!? And where have you seen her before!?"

Cat had forgotten that she hadn't yet told Tandy about her dreams over the last few days. "Well, see Tan. I've sort of...Been having these weird dreams lately where I go around town as a cat-girl and-"

"AND YOU WERE GOING TO TELL ME THIS WHEN!?" Tandy was clearly still upset about everything that happened yesterday. "Cat, I almost got goddamn mauled last night!"

"Tandy, I'm sorry alright! I had no idea that anything like this would happen!"

Tandy got up to leave, grabbing her stuff as she went. "No, you're not sorry! So far during this whole thing you've done nothing but whine about Alex! You know what, there are other people you need to worry about too!"

"Th-that's not true!" Or was it? Alex had been on her mind nonstop the past few days, but she cared just as much for Tandy's well-being. Didn't she? "Tandy, please come back!"

She wasn't listening, and seemed pretty close to tears. "Piss off!"

Cat winced as the door slammed, her ears felt like they were touching her cheeks they were drooped so low. In fact she felt like crying herself and she would have gone after her, however, she suddenly remembered that there was a little kid sleeping under her bed. How she was still asleep after all the yelling was anyone's guess.

Cat sighed and poked the girl softly, trying not to prick her with her claws. "Hey come on, up and at 'em..."

The girl shifted in place but didn't even stir. Cat poked harder in her arm.

"Come on...Up..."

Still nothing. Cat sighed and tried once more. Though this time she poked a little too harder, the girl's eyes shot open and she screamed, hitting her head on the bottom springs of Cat's bed.

~

Cat had found some bandages in her desk drawer to patch up the little girl's bleeding head and scratched arm. She was surprisingly taking this very well, considering she had been woken up by a teenager with cat ears and a tail. Cat still wasn't sure if she had kidnapped this girl...or if she had merely followed her home. After she finished patching up the girl's forehead, she finally asked the biggest question on her mind.

"Alright all fixed...Now who are you?"

"Jamie!" The girl smiled, she had two missing teeth in the front.

"Alright, Jamie." Cat said as sweetly as she could. "You mind telling me what you were doing under my bed?"

"Followed you!" Cat mentally sighed in relief. At least this nightly-ego of hers didn't kidnap random children like the monsters in those terrible child stories. She continued prodding the girl for information.

"Followed me? Were you the one I woke up last night?"

Jamie nodded. "Big brother won't let me keep a kitty. But I followed you anyway! It was fun!"

"Fun? You wandered around the streets ALONE in the middle of the night?"

Jamie shook her head. "Nuh uh. Followed YOU, so I was safe. Didn't break any of my brother's rules."

Cat clasped her forehead and closed her eyes. She wasn't sure how to explain to an eight year old that the thing she saw last night wasn't really technically her. Jamie cocked her head, waiting for a reply.

"Look...It's complicated to explain to you right now. But it'd be VERY NICE of you to not tell anyone what you saw last night or about my ears and tail. You're a nice girl, aren't you Jamie?"

Jamie nodded.

"Good, now where do you live exactly? Your parents must be worried sick." Cat was already dreading finding an explanation for this.

"Don't have parents! Just me an' Big Brother! Live in an apartment!"

"Well, do you know the address at least? You know, the street name?" Cat would be able to recognize the apartment again so long as she knew the street.

"Yup!" Jamie's stomach growled. "But hungry now! Can we eat before you take home?"

Cat sighed, she looked around for her hat to cover her ears. "Alright, fair enough."
1521111111111111.title: Dreams Do Come True.

15211111111111111.content:
Cat was able to sneak some breakfast for Jamie without her parents noticing, the two slipped out of Cat's bedroom window which Jamie had climbed through the night before. An eight year old girl that could break into a second story house on her own in the middle of the night, Jamie was something else. Cat felt like Jamie must have been a real headache for "Big Brother" figure.

Cat was wearing her hat again to cover her ears, her new tail was less of a challenge to hide. It was scrunched up in the back of her pants, which of course made walking a real pain. She was suddenly very thankful that Tandy suggested going shopping yesterday, nothing she had would have fit her anymore.

Jamie happily walked along, munching on the poptart she had gotten from Cat's thievery.

"So...Jamie. Why you follow me home last night?"

"You were cute kitty. Brother won't get pet for house. Says lord-land don't want pets. Maybe let you stay though! You are nice kitty!"

Cat sighed. "I'm not a cat though."

"But you has ears like a kitty."

"Well-Yes...But-"

"An'a tail!"

"I do but-"

"Whatur' name anyway, kitty?" Jamie looked up at her with a childlike innocence.

Cat stared into her eyes for a moment before groaning. "...It's Cat..."

Jamie squealed for joy, feeling that she had won their argument. She pointed at Cat, speaking in a much louder volume. "See! Your a kitty! Even your name is kitty!" People walking by were being to stare at them.

Cat tried to calm her down. "Alright, alright! I'm a cat! Just please...Shhh! I don't want people knowing it, okay? Including whoever your big brother is, it's our little secret."

"Why though? Don'tcha like being a cat?"

"It's becoming very tiresome..." Cat was already starting to get a headache just talking to Jamie.

They continued along the streets, Jamie had no idea what the street name for her apartment was but she seemed to know where it is. Taking several shortcuts through back alleys and even the dump, Cat was suddenly grateful this poor girl didn't get kidnapped because of her.

"Jamie, how far away is your house again?" Asked Cat as she pushed her way through some trees, Jamie had led them into what appeared to be a forested area of the town Cat had never been to.

"Across the park!"

"The...park?"

Cat finally broke through the trees and landed right into an open field, Jamie ran past her jumping through the flowers. She pointed at several furry animals running at them.

"Kitty, look!" She smiled.

Cat looked up. "D-dogs...?"

The furry animals were indeed medium sized dogs, one with golden fur and one with brown fur. Cats HATED dogs, even before the changes had occurred. Once when she was a small kid a big one knocked her down and bit her, she was in the hospital for a few weeks after that. Needless to say, the fear of them never left. She whimpered as they playful jumped at her legs.

"Sandy! Zack! Cut it out!" Called a girl running towards them, a sudden streak of realization ran across her face. "Wait, what the-?"

Cat recognized the girl as well, it was Marlene! The white bandage from yesterday still remained on her cheek.

"Well, well, well. If it isn't Cat..."

Cat would have greeted Marlene with her usual 'friendliness', but the dogs were still jumping around her legs. "H-hi...M-Marlene..."

"What are you doing here, you anime-tard. And Jamie, where in the world have you been!? Your brother has been worried sick!"

"Wa-wait...her brother is...?"

Marlene glared at her. "Yes, Alex is her older brother. Didn't you know that? What were you even doing with her anyway?"

"I...found her sleeping under my bed."

Marlene gave Cat a strange look, then looked at Jamie who was giving a big grin. "Something tells me I don't even want to know. You are the STRANGEST girl I've ever seen Jamie, well alright the second strangest girl..." She eyed Cat again.

Cat rolled her eyes. "Look Marlene, I-I didn't come to fight. I wanted to bring Jamie home. C-can you please call off your dogs now? I hate dogs!"

"Whatever. Sandy, Zack, back off." Marlene took out her cellphone as Cat sighed in relief. "I'm calling Alex..."

~

In less than five minutes, Alex made it all the way down to the park. He was wearing his usual polo shirt and jeans, though his brown hair was in mess from rushing to get over here. He gave Jamie a huge hug.

"Oh...Thank god! Jamie, don't you EVER runaway like that again! I mean it this time!"

Jamie rolled her eyes. "Yes big brother..."

"Where did you find her, Marlene?" Asked Alex.

Marlene huffed and pointed at Cat. "Ask her."

"Huh? Oh, hey Cat. Did you find Jamie for me?"

"H-hi Alex...Yeah...She was, uh, under my bed when I woke up..."

"Under your bed....?" He looked at Jamie again. "Jamie...I told you before. Stop breaking into people's houses! One of these days you're going to end up in jail because of that!"

Alex ruffed her hair up a bit, much to the displeasure on Jamie's face. He turned to Cat again.

"Sorry about that Cat, Jamie does that sort of thing sometimes. She takes a little bit too much after our older brother...But that's not important, I should repay you finding her for me."

"Huh, no it's fine! She just scared me and Tandy a little. It's no problem..."

"Nonsense. You want to go into town with us today?" Marlene gave Alex a real nasty look. "It's the least I can do."

"Alex..." Said Marlene. "Come on, you've already Cat and the other one to that Japanese thing for tomorrow...I'd like for this to be just the two of us."

Cat nodded. "I-I really don't want to intrude..."

"Oh don't listen to Marlene." Smiled Alex, completely ignoring Marlene's comment. "You deserve a little something for all the trouble you went through getting her here! Come with us."
15211111111111111.title: At the Park...

152111111111111111.content:
Marlene was giving Cat a look of pure death, Cat had never seen her so angry before in all her life. She had never seen her so angry before...A sly smile grew across Cat's face. She had Marlene right where she wanted her. After a year of torturing her with pranks, name calling, and being a complete bitch, the cards were finally in Cat's favor.

"...I...Guess I'll go with you Alex, if you're sure..." Cat didn't stop looking at Marlene's hilarious distorted face, she had to hold a grin though else Alex would get suspicious.

"Great! Uh, Marlene. You want to go home and put Sandy and Zack in your house?" Asked Alex, completely oblivious to Marlene's obvious discomfort.

Marlene was trembling with absolute rage, but tried to keep a straight voice. "Yes...I'll go...do that..."

Marlene stomped off with the leash of the two dogs in hand, Cat slightly giggled as Alex rubbed his head.

"Huh, wonder what's with her today. Oh well, I hope you don't mind Jamie coming with us as well Cat. I doubt I can find someone to babysit on such short notice."

"Heh...Oh, it's no trouble at all..."

~

A large, overweight bald man in a police uniform sat merrily whistling to himself while reading a dirty magazine. The room he was in was a small basement-like room, there were three cells along the walls. Only one was occupied by a young man with his face buried into his cuffed hands, brown hair covered his eyes. The door in the center of the far wall opened, in stepped a thin black cop leading a large man in an overcoat into the room. The overcoat man was whimpering and muttering crazily to himself.

"Morning Frank." Said the cop leading the guy with the overcoat in.

Frank looked up from his 'reading'. "Hey, Jackson. Whoa, he's a big one."

Frank tried to get a good look at the man, aside from his size and overcoat there was nothing distinctive about him save a long fresh scar going across his face. It looked deep and extremely painful, covered in dirty bandages and tape.

Jackson led the man into his empty cell. "Yeah, his name's Jonny Vale. He's that mugger we've been after for several weeks now. Someone done and cut up his face pretty badly, we found him whimpering to himself in a street corner about giant cats. Captain says we gotta keep him here until his trial."

Frank laughed. "Hah! Think it has anything to do with those phony cat-monster calls we've been getting recently?"

The cop shook his head as he locked the door to the cell. "No idea, can't say I believe in that superstitious junk. Next thing you know we've have our own tourist hot spot, the next Loch Ness Monster."

Jackson noticed the other man in the cell next to Jonny Vale's. He hadn't even made a sound the entire time.

"What's with the spook?"

Frank put his magazine down. "Who? That kid? Some nutcase they're transporting to the insane asylum and they need to keep here until a spot opens up. I think the bugger's name is Maxwell Lenard. Hear what he did?"

"Can't say I have."

"Murdered both of his folks, in cold blood too. Just snapped apparently. Would have killed his siblings as well if our boys didn't get there in time."

"Huh, some people..."

Unknown to both officers who continued their "water cooler chat", the look in Maxwell's eyes changed under his mop of hair.

~

"So where's Tandy today? Haven't seen her?" Asked Alex as the group walked down the main streets of the city. Marlene was trying to keep as close to Alex as possible the entire trip, acting as a shield between him and Cat.

"We sorta...Got into a fight this morning, she got really angry and left."

Alex shook his head. "Huh, what was the argument about?"

"Oh just something stupid..."

Alex gave Cat a concerned look, she tried to think of something to change the subject.

"So...Uh...What are you going as for the Anime-con tomorrow?"

"It's a secret." Grinned Alex, Marlene rolled her eyes. "Let's just I always wanted to go as him. How about you?"

That's right, Cat hadn't even thought of something yet. Tandy said she would come up with something for her, but after their fight... "Err...I haven't decided."

"Well, better hurry, right? Tomorrow's the big day."

"I know, I can't wait to skip school!"

"Heh, don't say that. You're making me regret giving you the tickets in the first place."

While the two continued their conversation with each other, Marlene's face was slowly becoming angrier and redder by the second. But she wouldn't leave and give Cat the chance to jump in and "steal" Alex. Thankfully, Jamie broke up the tension between the two girls by running towards a nearby vendor stand.

"Yay! Hotdogs!" Cried the younger girl, Alex had to chase after her to make sure she didn't go and hurt herself.

Marlene took the opportunity to get a one on one with Cat.

"What the hell do you think you're doing you little witch!?" She jabbed a long finger right in the cat-girl's face.

Cat tried to play dumb. "Wha-? What do you mean?"

"Don't act like even more of an idiot, Cat! I know what you're doing! You even try to steal Alex and I'll shave your head bald!"

Cat returned Marlene's glare. "Sounds like someone's a little jealous..."

"Last warning bitch! You try anything else and you'll be sorry!"

Cat had to admit, Marlene looked royally steamed. She probably really was nearing the point of doing something crazy. Cat huffed and swatted Marlene's finger out of her face.

"You don't scare me...I'm not doing anything wrong..."

Cat walked over to Alex and Jamie, eating hotdogs. Marlene stood there, completely dumbfounded.

"You...you bitch...!"
152111111111111111.title: A Day on the Town With Alex.

choices: She gets into a fight with Marlene.
She doesn't get mad, she gets even.
1521111111111111111.content:
Marlene was seeing red, so to speak. If she was in a cartoon, steam would be blowing out of her ears. No one got in her way when it came to anything, NO ONE! Especially not an anime-obsessed, smart ass, freak of a geek!

She watched with fists trembling as Cat joined in with Alex and Jamie, Marlene's thoughts were going a mile a minute trying to of think way to get back at the geek. You didn't get to be the most recognized, ruthless, and notorious girl in school without knowing how to deal out decent revenge. The thing was, Marlene couldn't think of anything to do to her. Absolutely nothing at all! She knew how to pop an inflated ego of a wanna-be popular girl, she knew how to spoil the reputation of a goodie two-shoes freshman.

She had no idea, however, how to get even with someone who had the gall to go after her man, right in front of her nose!

"Marlene, you want one?" Asked Alex, blissfully unaware of the popular girl's bloodlust.

"Yeah, Marlene." Said Cat, and just to put the icing on the cake she added. "I'll buy one for you."

"No thank you!"

Alex was somewhat taken aback by his girlfriend's loud declination, but shrugged. "Suit yourself then."

~

Now more than ever, Marlene wished she hadn't taken her pets Sandy and Zack home. At least Cat proved to be totally terrified of them. But afraid wasn't the same as sorry, Cat messed with Marlene and she was going to pay the price.

After an hour of thinking quietly to herself, she still couldn't come up with a damn thing to at least stave Cat off of Alex, and boy was Cat growing bolder. The two were becoming inseparable. They'd spend minutes just talking nonstop about the most pointless crap! Anime! Manga! School! Who cared about any of that!?

The entire time Marlene was feeling sick to her stomach, while a hot fog brewed in her mind. It felt like the gap between her and the two of them was slowly but surely widening as they walked along the sidewalk. She had to do something and quick.

"Somethin' a'matter Marly?" Asked Jamie as she walked next to the brooding girl.

Marlene huffed. "It's nothing."

"'Kay."

"Jamie" Called Alex from ahead. "Come here and hold my hand while we cross the street."

Alex tottered up to her brother, but before they could cross a large bus pulled in front of them and stopped to let its passengers out. This blocked off the group from walking along the crosswalk.

Marlene finally caught up to them. Cat was standing awfully close to the bus and didn't seem to be paying attention, still talking away with Alex. She was wearing a pair of jeans with one of those steel chains connected to it. Marlene looked at the bus again, it had plenty of handles on it for gripping or tying things to the bus...That gave her a very evil idea.

As quietly as possible, Marlene walked next to Cat and slowly reached for the chain while she and Alex weren't looking. Slowly, she tried to tie the chain to the bus. She was running out of time, the doors were already closing.

Just as she finished a double-knot, the bus jolted and began to move. Cat was still too busy talking to notice the tug on the side of her pants. The chain extended as the bus pulled away until...

RIIIIIIIIIIIIIPP! The entire side half of Cat's jeans went flying along the side of the bus, the other half crumpled to the ground. Cat yelped and quickly sat down trying to cover her butt while wincing, as if sitting on something painful.

"M-my pants!" Cried Cat as half of them blew in the wind, still connected to the chain attached to the bus. Cat was pulling her pink over-sized t-shirt down, attempting to hide her exposed bottom. Alex looked around for something to help her with, Marlene tried to fight back a laugh.

"Don't just stand there Marlene!" Said Alex. "Help her out!"

"Sorry, I'll get right to that."

She stood over Cat sneering at her before going to Alex to look for some newspaper or something, the anime-girl seemed to get the message and glared right back at her. This was her doing!

Alex handed Cat a jacket some nearby man was generous enough to give up, she used it as a towel and wrapped it around her waist. Thankfully, Marlene and Alex didn't notice Cat's tail which was now safety hidden under the cloth.

"You alright there Cat?" Smirked Marlene. "You gotta be more careful next time."

"It's not funny Marlene, she could have been pulled under the bus and killed!" Retorted Alex, though he seemed to have no idea Marlene had tied Cat's pants to the bus.

Cat slowly got to her feet.
