1521111111111111111.title: Revenge of the Bitch.

15211111111111111111.content:
Dressed in nothing but a large shirt and a jacket to serve for make-shift pants, Cat punching Marlene right across the face would probably only succeed in exposing her hidden cat tail. Still, that did not make the urge to do so any less greater. Cat was FURIOUS.

Alex seemed to sense what Cat was thinking and got between the two girls. "Easy! Take it easy Cat! I'm sure Marlene didn't mean anything by-"

Marlene couldn't keep her gloating to herself any longer. "No, she should have watched what she was doing. It's her own fault Alex."

Cat shuddered, the same pent up rage she felt last Friday had resurfaced and the desire to rip Marlene's over confident mug off her face dribbled into Cat's head. No! She couldn't lose control, not like last time! Cat took a deep breath and tried to clear her thoughts.

"What's the matter? Cat got your tongue?" Grinned Marlene.

"Marlene, that's enough-!" Said Alex, only a little too late. Cat had already jumped on top of Marlene and was proceeding to wind up a punch.

Marlene was completely taken by surprise, she hadn't expected for Cat to literally start a fight with her. Nevertheless, she was prepared enough to catch the punch just in time for Alex to grab Cat from behind.

"Cat! Come on both of you! Stop fighting!"

They were in their own little world though, while Alex was holding Cat back Marlene stood up and rush at the pinned cat-girl. Thankfully, Cat's new form had given decent enough reflexes to be able to kick Marlene back. At this point she could have cared less if her tail got exposed.

One of her kicks landed right in Marlene's nose, she felt something crack and blood oozed from her nostrils. By this time, Cat was able to break free from Alex's hold and pounced at Marlene again.

~

Cat was sitting alone at a counter, she had on a large overcoat Alex had bought her from a street to cover herself with. She was too deep in thought and busy cleaning the three massive cuts going across her face to notice what was going on around her, nor care for the cup of hot coffee the waitress placed next to her.

Overall, Cat was proud of herself. Sure, she had snapped again, but she didn't completely lose control. Any injuries inflicted on Marlene were done by punching and kicking, she didn't use her claws on her at all. Actually, aside the dislocated nose, Marlene had the least number of injuries. Still, she insisted that she be taken to the hospital by the ambulance after the police broke up the fight, probably just to make it look like she was the victim.

There were scratches and bruises all over Cat's body, Alex went to go find some disinfectant for Cat's injuries. He seemed to be taking it well too, besides being utterly embarrassed by associating with the two girls that got into an all out brawl on Main Street. But he still seemed up for spending at least a little time on the town. Cat couldn't help but laugh at the thought of what Tandy would think we she heard about this.

A sudden depression hit Cat as the realization set in, they weren't on speaking terms anymore. She sighed as Alex returned with a box of bandages and a bottle of alcohol. Jamie had already taken a few bandaids and stuck them all over her face.

"You alright Cat?" He asked as he handed her the bottle.

"Yeah...It's just...Sorry about that Alex. I shouldn't have snapped like that, it's the second time in a week with Marlene..."

"Tell me about it." He sat at the counter with his own cup of coffee. "I've never seen two people so high strung with each other, you're like cats and dogs."

Cat laughed slightly, only she knew how true his analogy was. "But that doesn't excuse it...I-I'm sorry...I kinda ruined your date."

Alex glanced over his mug of coffee and looked into Cat's big eyes. He sighed. "Goddamn eyes... Look, don't worry about it. Marlene isn't exactly the nicest person. I know she's been giving you a lot of grief, especially lately."

Cat looked down at the ground. She had been forgiven but she did want some way to make it up to Alex. She mumbled the first idea that came to her head.

"...You...wanna...go...dinner...

"Sorry, I didn't get that?"

Cat took a breath of air and asked louder. "Do you...want to go get dinner?"

Alex blinked several times before laughing. "Sure...I don't think Marlene will mind that."

Jamie had been apparently listening the whole time. "Yay! I wanna come, I wanna come!"
15211111111111111111.title: Cat Fight.

152111111111111111111.content:
Alex had suggested they go to a place he knew off, he said it was pretty cheap and he knew the owner very well. Cat was more than happy to let him decide where to have dinner, and somewhat grateful that it wouldn't cost her a fortune (she was nearly broke after yesterday's shopping at the mall). It sounded like some Italian restaurant, La Vinard. She didn't care, the entire walk there she couldn't refrain from blushing nor keep eye contact with Alex.

Had she been paying attention she would have noticed the "restaurant" was more like a rundown old bar squished between two larger business buildings. The door was coming off its hinges, there was no lighting save for a few candles, and everything from the chairs to the windows had some sort of crack or dent in it. Alex stepped up to the "Please Wait to be Seated Sign" and blew off the dust on the rusty bell before ringing it.

It made a deep clang. "This place sure brings back memories..." He said to himself.

"It looks a little...um...dated..." Replied Cat, admiring the many cobwebs in the ceiling.

"Heh, yeah. I took Marlene here once. She's a complete clean-freak sometimes so she couldn't wait to leave. You don't seem like the kind of person who minds a little dust though."

Heavy footsteps were heard from the back of the bar counter followed by gruff breathing. A loud voice that sounded like a woman who had smoked for forty years bellowed out from the darkness.

"Who's there? Christ, I was just in the middle of a nap!"

Indeed the voice belonged to a woman, large round black haired one. She was wearing a big black t-shirt that probably would seem like a blanket on Cat, it was covered with chalk dust and cigarette burns. Her hair was greasy and done up in a terribly made bun, there was a big brown mole on the center of her right cheek. The only other way Cat could tell it was a woman, besides her giant bosom, was the small skirt she wore. The woman got a look at Alex and smiled with big yellow teeth.

"Alex! Jamie!" She said in a thick Italian accent "How are you two doing, heh!?"

She ran over and gave Alex a big hug, Cat could have sworn she heard bones cracking but the look on Alex's face told her he was used to it by now.

"You two don't come by an' give old Aunt Caria visits much any more!"

"Sorry Aunt Caria, it's been a busy semester." Smiled Alex, finally able to pry himself away from the obese woman's grasp as she turned to pat Jamie on the head.

"Oh, little Jamie! You've grown since I last saw you! I- Wait, whatcha got there?"

Cat turned and saw Jamie grinning ear to ear. In her small hands were wallets, dozens of wallets. She let them go on the floor and they landed with a thud. Alex was the first to react.

"Jamie!"

"I was collecting 'em Aunt Caria. They're for you since I don't have no money, I figgered the nice people on the street would let you have 'em."

"Wait." Said Cat, putting the pieces together. "Did she...pickpocket all those wallets?"

Alex grabbed his forehead and started gathering up the leather wallets on the ground. " I told her a thousand times to stop doing this...What a pain, now I need to call up all these people and explain to them that my little sister got at their wallets again..."

Aunt Caria laughed. "Brings me back to when you were about her age, Alex boy...I remember when I caught you an' your brother trying to break into the safe in the owner's closet 'an-"

Alex was frantically trying to get her to stop talking. He blushed slightly. "Uh, so Aunt Caria! Can we get a table or...?"

"Sure, sure! It'll be my treat. I'd be happy to pay for the couple!"

"The...couple?" Alex and Cat said at the same time.

"Yes! I can tell right from looking, you have matching personalities! Much closer than with that other girl you brought in last time...What was her name again?

They both started blushing hard and continued to speak at the same time. "Err, no! We're not- I'm still dating- It'd be wrong to-What I mean is-"

Aunt Caria just smiled and said in a booming voice with a wink. "Don't worry about it! I didn't mean nothin' by it, here let me take you to the best seat in the house."

~

Caria had taken them to an opening in the ceiling of the bar, through it was a beautifully lit room with dozens of candles and wondrously painted portraits of rolling hills and landscapes. Best of all was the bay window that gave a clear view of the lake just outside the city, the sun was going down just on the horizon.

Jamie had since given up her wallets she stole and went with Caria to the kitchen in promise of some "treats". Caria had also offered all three of them wine but Alex quickly refused, stating she shouldn't be offering alcohol to minors, though she continued to put up a tough argument. They instead settled for simple grape juice in wine glasses, Cat playfully stirred the drink as she stared out the window.

"Some view, huh?" Asked Alex with a grin.

"It's gorgeous. Thanks for recommending coming here..."

"Heh, wait till you taste the food. This place may not look like much but I bet you it's better than anything you've ever had before."

"Alex?"

"Hmm?"

"Sorry about what happened with Marlene..."

"Oh come on, I'm sure she's over it by now, she got you just as good. I don't hold anything against you for it that's for sure." He smiled his usual warm smile.

It was hard to believe that just a few days ago, Cat couldn't even talk to Alex without stammering like an idiot. It seemed so stupid, so childish looking back now. She felt like...she had grown. Grown at an alarmingly rate the past few days. Was it the coin? Was it the changes that brought these newer and unexpected changes to come and pass? Who knew. Cat's thoughts turned to Tandy again...Thinking back, she had been selfish, she hadn't considered her friends feelings in anything. Cat's smiled slowly turned to a frown.

"What's with that look?" Said Alex. "You've had that frown all day, brighten up a bit. I smell the food coming."

Cat knew that already, she had been able to smell the veil being cooked since Caria took it out of the fridge. She had to go apologize to Tandy, as soon as this dinner was over.
152111111111111111111.title: A First Date?

1521111111111111111111.content:
By the time dinner was finished, which was as good as Alex promised, the sun had set. The moon glowed in its place over the glittering lake, all the candles had long gone out leaving the smell of apples and fire lingering in the air.

Alex cleaned his teeth with a toothpick. "Oh man, I haven't eaten anything like that in ages. Sure beats canned ravioli, huh Cat?"

She looked over the empty plates, not a crumb of food had been spared. Suddenly, she felt like a pig as Aunt Caria came and cleaned up the remains.

"Yeah." Blushing slightly.

"Ready to go home?"

"Actually, there's a place I'd rather go to first..."

~

Tandy's home was a mansion. A giant fence with pointed bars prevented anyone from entering the vast green lawn. Her home was a large Victorian styled house, beautifully painted maroon red and maintained daily by a crew of workers. They stopped at the foot of the gate, in between two brick pillars.

"So, going to go have a talk with her are we?" Asked Alex as Cat walked over to the buzzer.

"Mmhm...I...I did some thinking over dinner. I was acting like an idiot. I guess I just...need to apologize."

Alex smiled, but even that wasn't enough to reassure Cat. She breathed out heavily.

"Just nervous..."

"Heh, well don't be. Tandy's a nice girl. She's not the kind of person to hold a grudge."

"I...Hope you're right."

There was a long silence...That is until Jamie started getting bored and took a stick she found on the ground then proceeded to bang it loudly against the iron fence, somewhat ruining the mood. Alex sighed.

"Jamie, you mind waiting QUIETLY over there?"

"Okay, big brother!"

Alex waited until she was out of earshot, she skipped merrily over to the street corner apparently playing hopscotch on the sidewalk. He shook his head.

"I swear, she's going to drive me crazy one of these days."

Cat laughed slightly. "She's cute though. She really cares about you, you know?"

"Yeah..."

Another awkward silence, Cat stared at him again just as he returned the glance. Their eyes met.

"Something on your mind?" He asked bluntly.

A little voice in Cat's head said 'Come on! Do it!'. But she fought back the urge and said. "Oh...No...Nothing..."

He raised an eyebrow. "Oh really now?"

"Yeah...r-really..."

"Come on...out with it. I'm not leaving until you spit it out."

So persistent. Cat opened her mouth to say something but quickly closed it again. She'd been in this position before with him. There was no sense in dragging it out. "It's...it's just...This wasn't a date was it?"

He wasn't taken aback like she thought he would be. He looked straight into her big cat-like eyes. His own light blue eyes seemed to glow in the dark. "I don't think so...Do you?"

Cat didn't know if she should be relieved or heartbroken. "Yeah...I...I guess it wasn't..."

Alex chuckled slightly and smiled his usual grin again.

Then, he did the last thing Cat expected him to do. He leaned in. Cat felt a warm sensation on her right cheek. She closed her eyes, afraid if she opened them she'd wake up from a dream. Alex pulled away and with eyes open she felt where he had kissed her.

"Good night, Catherine." He said, turning to walk away. Alex left to go meet his impatient sister who was yelling something like 'Eww! Cooties!'

Cat fixed her hat to cover her eyes, her face was beat red by now.

She whispered to herself. "...Was it?..."

She stood watching the brother and sister walk away until they disappeared into the night. She waited even longer before returning, at last, to the buzzer to get into Tandy's mansion. Her friend's voice greeted her over the speaker.

"Hello? Who is it?"

"H-Hi Tandy...It's me..."
1521111111111111111111.title: The Cherry on Top.

15211111111111111111111.content:
There was no response on the other end of the speaker, Cat suddenly feared the worst. Though her fears were quickly put to rest when she had a metal clang, the gate was slowly opening into the yard just as Cat heard thunder in the distance. Apparently they were due for a little bit of rain.

"Guess that means...come in..."

The raindrops began to pour down on the ground as Cat slowly made her way to the door. It seemed the weather only got worse and worse with each step. Rain was pounding down on her hat at near golf ball sizes.

Eventually she got to the door and stood under the roof, thankful for the cover from the rain. She knocked slightly on the beautifully coated chestnut door, there was a figure moving behind the small stained glass windows.

The door creaked open. A single painted black eye stared from behind the opening. It seemed really red and puffy, like it had been crying for the entire day.

"Hey...Cat..." Said Tandy, her voice was strong but Cat sensed a strained tone in it.

Cat listened for a moment. A mixture of breathing combined with the drumming of the rain made a surreal orchestra, like the world was creating its own soundtrack for Cat as the tension built between her and her best friend.

"Hey...Tandy."

She knew what she had to say, but no words were coming out. It was like she had prepared for a speech and forgotten her cards that had everything she needed to say on them. How were you supposed to say sorry to someone? Were they just supposed to take your word for it that you truly were sorry? Could words truly mend everything that came between two people? Broken bones, shared tears, countless memories.

Cat was being to feel naive, stupid. Like all life's problems could be solved with words. Words were expressions of humanity, but they could also be tainted. They could be lies. Who's to say Cat wasn't just lying to Tandy, even to herself?

But then Cat remembered what Alex had said just seconds ago before kissing her. His kiss spoke louder than his words. Even if she didn't believe the words she said to Tandy here and now, her actions as a friend would speak the truth of her intent. She'd live by her own example.

"...Tandy...I'm sorry...You were right...I'm...Sorry..."

It was like the dam gave way, Tandy burst into tears and fell through the door, knocking Cat into the rain and embracing her. The water didn't feel as cold and wet anymore as Cat hugged her best friend in the whole wide world under the cloudy sky. She couldn't tell if it was rain or tears that also ran down her face.

This action spoke louder than any word the two girls could ever say to each other.

~

Alex smiled slightly as he closed the door to his sister's room. The rain was really coming down outside, he was thankful they had been able to beat it on the way home. He turned and headed to his own room.

On the way, his posture slowly sunk, matching his feelings on the inside. He was torn.

He entered his room, which was a giant mess. Bills and papers due for schooling and rent were stacked all over his desk, while his cloth were in random clumps all over the floor. In truth, he hadn't even showered the past few days out of fear of running up the water bill. All that water needed to go to Jamie, everything needed to go to her. Food, clothes, and school if need be. She should never have to know the fear of not having enough to pay bills or give up food in order to save money.

His bed was merely a mattress with a single thin sheet, laying flat on the ground. He tossed off his shirt and collapsed in a heap, deep in thought. It wasn't bills or food that was on his mind though.

The mattress was large enough to fit two people on it, albeit the holes in the lining. There was a pillow next to the one his head was laying on, empty and staring out into the darkness. Alex outstretched his arm, as if reaching out to an invisible person sleeping there next to him. It should have been Marlene, his girlfriend, who he imagined sleeping there, but it wasn't.

He shuddered to relieve himself of those thoughts, it wasn't right to be thinking like that. It wasn't fair.

Jamie, his sister, was the only person he could have time for in life. He couldn't love anyone else, not even Marlene. He didn't have time for any other person. He didn't DESERVE another person to care about, nor have that person care for him in return. Alex was a worthless, worthless human being.

And yet, there was a longing, a deep primal urge to want to feel the girl in his thoughts. To have her be there with him. He fantasized what it would be like, life with her. The fun things they could do. The loving, the warm forgotten feeling of caring for more than one person. This feeling seemed to give magic to the apparition of the girl in his thoughts, she smiled and winked at him. Winked with her big beautiful eyes.

He reached for her face...And she was gone, there was only the sound of rain beating like a war drum outside. Thunder rumbled, mocking him in his pit of loneliness. He turned to go to sleep, it was going to be a busy day tomorrow. But not before muttering.

"Hell and damnation..."
15211111111111111111111.title: Heaven and Hell.

choices: Cat doesn't have any dreams that night.
Cat dreams she's alone with Alex at the Anime-Con.
152111111111111111111111.content:
"Jesus Cat you're soaked! Like a drenched dog!" Said Tandy when the two girls were safely inside Tandy's room. She took Cat's hat off, letting her big cat ears bounce into place.

"I thought I was a cat..." Muttered Cat which earned her a slap on the head with her wet cap.

"And what happened to your pants!?" Asked Tandy who noticed Cat's destroyed jeans as Cat unbuttoned her overcoat. "Did you get into a fight with a goddamn weeder whacker or something!?"

"Actually, with Marlene and..."

"You got into ANOTHER fight with Marlene!? Cat what were you-"

Cat put a finger to Tandy's lips. "Calm down. You're getting hysterical..."

"Sorry..."

Sighing, Cat said. "I promise I'll tell you everything once I can get out of these soggy clothes and take a badly need shower. Deal?"

"Deal."

~

Cat was sitting in the middle of Tandy gigantic bedroom, freshened up and in a pink fuzzy bathrobe. Having the chance to look around without getting bombarded with questions, Cat noticed that few things in the room had changed. There were maybe a few new posters of goth bands added to the DOZENS that pasted the walls. Aside from that, same old king-sized bed with black sheets and pillows. Same old creepy Victorian era furniture that looked like it was pulled fresh out of a museum it was so ancient. Same old piles and piles of journals and books, filled with poems and stories written by Tandy.

Cat had to admit, Tandy must have had the good life, even if it was her and her father living alone in this massive house. She handed Cat a warm cup of hot chocolate, just the thing for a cold rainy night.

"Jesus, he kissed you!? Like, really kissed you!?"

Cat's eyes narrowed. "I love how that's the only thing you heard out of the story. But yeah...Only on the cheek."

"He kissed you!" Squealed Tandy, giving her pillow a big hug.

Cat blushed. "Only on the cheek! It was probably just a courteous thing to do!"

"Marlene's gonna haaaaaate you." Tandy continued her taunting.

"I know..." On reflection while her 'progress' with Alex was exciting, Marlene proved to be the biggest obstacle. Actually Cat was beginning to question if having the date with Alex was the right thing to do at all. Was Tandy right? Was she being selfish?

"Hey...Earth to Cat..." Waved Tandy, snapping her friend out of her thoughts.

"Wha-?! I'm awake!"

"Not for long. You remember what tomorrow is right?"

Cat had nearly forgotten already with so much excitement happening so rapidly. "Anime-Con..."

Tandy grinned and gave two thumbs up. "More time to be alone with Alex."

"You know for someone who just made up with me after a fight with me about talking too much about a certain boy, you seem way too interested in this whole thing."

Cat hadn't seen Tandy this happy since a vampire book was assigned to their summer reading. She grinned hugely again. "Sorry Cat...It's just exciting is all...And..."

Cat could tell Tandy was getting serious again. "...Just...I really thought that the fight we had...was going to be the last time we would ever speak to each other."

Cat frowned. She didn't want to say it to Tandy, but she had felt the same way the whole day. "Don't talk like that...We got a lot to do before tomorrow. It's almost eleven! We need to be up by seven to get ready, remember? Do you have a costume?"

Tandy snapped out of her seriousness state. "Huh. Yeah, don't worry about me I'm going as Kanako Urashima!"

"You would...But what about me then?"

Tandy sighed. "Like I said before, I already have something planned out for you..." She winked. "Trust me."

"I'm not going to like this am I?"

"Heeee. Nope!"

"Alright then...How about this then...I guess I'm sleeping over with the weather like it is, if you don't mind anyway. But what are you going to do in case I go feral again?"

Without missing a beat, Tandy reached into her new pocketbook standing on her desk and pulled out a large black pistol. Apparently getting mugged in broad daylight had a crazy effect on her safety beliefs. "I'm well prepared."

"Are you crazy!? You're going to kill me!"

"Hey relaaaax. There's just rubber bullets in here. And they cause broken bones, they don't kill people...usually. I'm only going to aim for your legs."

"That's comforting!"

"It's your feral side or me..." Laughed Tandy. "Ready to get to bed then?"

Cat didn't know how she was going to sleep after being threatened with a PISTOL, but she sighed. "I guess..."

Tandy had a portable/inflatable mattress for Cat to sleep on. Of course, balloons and cats never mixed, so Cat had to be extremely careful not to pop the bed with her claws. The girls watched some anime together before falling asleep before midnight.
152111111111111111111111.title: And As the Raindrops fell...

choices: "You don't even need to hide anything at all." (Go as a cat-girl)
"You were to wear a mask?"(Go disguised)
1521111111111111111111112.content:
"He kissed you!" Echoed Tandy's voice.

Cat couldn't quite tell where she was. There was nothing but complete darkness all around her, black as the night sky. She couldn't even see her own hands in front of her face. Another voice echoed in the darkness, making Cat's heart skip. It was Alex's voice.

"I don't think so...Do you?"

Cat blushed. What was going on? She had to be dreaming, for it felt like she was falling down an endless pit. There was no light. There was no end. Only the echoes of the past whispered words of past deeds to her. Things people had said to her...Things she had done. Stuck in memories.

"You...you bitch!" Yelled Marlene's voice.

And with that, Cat felt herself land hard on something.

~

The blackness faded into a large gymnasium of sorts. The bleachers had been pulled aside to make room for countless tables and displays of famous anime characters and merchandise. It was...the Anime Con. Cat was sure of it. What was odd, however, was that no one was there. Not a single soul besides Cat, standing in the middle of the setups, was around.

Cat looked around. She felt alone, strange, but oddly at peace. She looked at her hands again. Fur and claws, she was definitely dreaming again. By then why was she in control this time? What was this?

"Desire."

The lights went out, surprising Cat at first. Someone was there! Standing in the center of the gym, near what appeared to be a stage. Even with improved nocturnal vision Cat couldn't quite make out their features.

The spotlights over the stage went on, shining on the figure. One, two, three. Cat winced slightly at the new found source of brightness. She practically yelped in shock at who was standing directly in front of her.

It was Alex, clad in a distinct purple samurai outfit, he seemed to be wearing a wig with red hair that went down to a ponytail in the back. There was also an 'X' shaped scar on his left cheek. He appeared to be dressed up as Himura Kenshin from Rurouni Kenshin.

"Hey, Cat!" He said, with his usual trademark smile. "Nice costume."

Cat suddenly remembered she must have looked like a real cat-girl right about now. She felt herself blush, as Alex slowly walked towards her. Cat took a few steps back.

"What do you fear?"

"Cat?" Asked Alex, as his smile crept away from his face. "Something wrong?"

"It's...It...This can't be real!"

"What do you mean?" He reached his hand out. "What's not to believe?"

"This! You can't see me like this...And...I'm...I'm a freak!" She slowly realized that nothing was getting through to him.

"What are you talking about? Ah." Classical music came on from the stage. "Would you care to dance Cat?"

Before she could react, Alex grabbed both of her hands, Cat was too confused to put up much resistance. "But-but...What about Marlene? Why is it just us here?"

"Heh. You're cute when you asked so many questions." Said Alex as he started dancing with her, alone and under the lights.

Cat blushed slightly. She still had no idea what was going on. Was this a dream? All her other dreams so far had proved to be truth and reality. But then where was everyone? Why were they alone together at the Anime Con?

"I told you already...This is desire."

Cat's ears perked up. "Who said that?"

"Who said what?" Asked Alex, continuing to waltz around the floor with Cat.

"That voice! Didn't you hear it!? Alex, please tell me what's going on! Please tell me-"

Alex just sighed and brought his lips to Cat's. She stopped talking. At first she tried to resist somewhat but eventually succumbed to her own desires. He pulled back and smiled at her.

"Cat." A voice called to her.

Alex's form began to fade away.

"Cat!"

Everything was starting to disappear. The floor, the lights, and Alex.

"No...please don't..." Whispered Cat.

Alex's smile was the last thing to fade, like a Cheshire cat. There was nothing left. Cat was all alone again.

"....Go..." She finished.

"CAT!"

~

Cat sat up from her sleeping bag with a jolt. She was breathing and sweating furiously. Another dream. Tandy stood over her friend with a concerned look on her face, pistol in hand.

"D-did I change again?" Asked Cat, looking down to look for any transformations.

"I...don't know. I never woke up after I went to sleep..." Said Tandy, placing the gun down now that she was sure Cat was alright. "You...might want to look in a mirror."

Tandy grabbed the hand mirror she had on her desk. She handed the delicate onyx bauble to Cat who quickly turned it around to gaze into the crystal mirror. She gasped at what she saw.

Indeed she had become even MORE cat-like over night, despite no "late night expedition". Her nose was smaller and cat-shaped while her mouth had the typical "W" shape that all cats had. Even her teeth had become more sharper. She could barely even recognize her face anymore, as she touched it disbelief.

"It's getting worse and worse..." Said Cat. "How am I supposed to go to Anime Con like this Tandy!? Alex is sure to notice something's odd!"

"Hey, hey! Relax! Didn't I say I had a plan for this?" Replied Tandy, hastily recording the changes in a notebook. "I prepared for anything to happen, including this!"

"Tandy what could you possibly have that I can hide my entire face with!? Ears and a tail are one thing...But my face!?"

"Heh, well what if..."
1521111111111111111111112.title: A Dream Within a Dream.

15211111111111111111111121.content:
"...You don't even need to hide anything at all." Grinned Tandy, who slowly started approaching Cat.

"T-Tandy stop! Please! You have that crazed look in your eye..." Cat said when she was backed to the wall of the room. But Tandy just kept leering, with a face like a cat ready to pounce on a cornered mouse.

~

"I....look....ridiculous!" Said Cat, staring at herself with a dumbfound look in the mirror.

"Awww no! I think you look precious Cat! Like a real cat-girl!" Replied Tandy as she marveled at her "creation".

Cat was now wearing a skin tight leotard that amplified every single curve on her body. The leotard also left Cat's arms naked. Of course, the front was cut low to reveal her new impressive cleavage. There was a small hole in the back to allow her tail to swing freely in the air, of course Tandy forced Cat to tie two small golden bells near the tip of her yellow furred appendage. She had also managed to put Cat in thin black high heeled boots, despite much resistance.

For the cherry on top, Tandy tied a black bow to Cat's orange hair just next to her two yellow cat ears. Cat gave an annoyed look to Tandy who was too busy giggling to herself in the corner. She didn't want to yell at her though, as much as Cat didn't want to admit it...She looked hot.

"The bow is way too much!" Spoke Cat as she tried to pry it out of her medium length hair. "Come on! I look like a slut in this."

"A cute slut!" Smirked Tandy, herself dressed up as Kanako Urashima with a long black button shirt and a white vest. "Don't touch the bow! It took me forever to do it!"

She must have used glue or something to hold it in place, because the ribbon wasn't budging an inch. "Grrr....Stupid....Thing...Get...Off...!"

Sighing, Tandy tried to persuade her friend. "Come on, cut it out. You need to help me put on my mascara before Alex and Marlene-"

DING DONG! The gate bell downstairs rang, Cat's ears immediately drooped.

Tandy went over to push the button on her wall to open the outside gate. "Speak of the devil! Cat, can you get the door while I put on my makeup?"

"I am NOT going down there like this!" Cat pointed down to her exposing outfit.

Tandy crossed her arms. "It's a good thing I hid your clothes. Take your pick, you can go down there like this or naked."

"Wh-what!? I'm not-"

"Better hurry or Alex might get tired of waiting and leave."

~

"Let's just go Alex, Tandy's obviously not coming."

"Oh, don't me so impatient Marlene. Let's just give her a minute, she might have just woken up." Said Alex, wearing the same costume as he did in Cat's dreams.

Marlene huffed and crossed her arms. She was dressed up as Jesse of Team Rocket from Pokemon. In truth she knew next to nothing about anime, this was the only half-decent looking character she remembered from the stupid show as a kid. Of course her hair didn't nearly go out as far as the characters, but close enough to get in the convention. There was also a large wrap over her nose.

Having Cat and her spooky goth friend tag along today was even worse then the anime-geek going with her and Alex on their supposed day together on the town. Cat had already tried to make a move on Alex, Marlene was sure something would happen again today. That's why she had put so much effort into her own costume.

"Stop being so worried." Marlene said to herself. "What's the worst old flat chest can do? Alex already complimented you on your costume. There's not way she's be able to outdo you this time!"

The door opened just a crack, but no one appeared. A soft voice squeaked out.

"H-hello?"

Alex seemed to know who it was immediately. "Oh, Cat? So you guys made up, huh? You girls all ready to go?"

"K-kinda...T-Tandy is still putting on make-up..."

"Huh. Can we come in and wait then? It's hot out here."

"....Y-yeah...Hang on..."

~

This was probably the equivalent to going to school without any pants on; opening the door to your crush not only in the most revealing thing you've ever worn but also as a REAL cat girl. With as much courage as she could muster, Cat quickly opened the door. Best to get it out of the way quickly like pulling a bandaid off. She closed her eyes, afraid to see Alex's reaction.

Alex jumped back in surprise at the door suddenly opened, but he then noticed Cat standing there.

"Um...Wow...That's..."

Cat opened her eyes slightly. Alex had a nice blush across his face. Marlene was standing behind him, her jaw agape.

"...That's a really nice costume...Cat..."

Cat returned the blush.

"R-really?"

He rubbed the back of his head and chuckled awkwardly. "Yeah...It's funny too. You're a cat-girl, right? And your name's Cat."

"T-thanks...I-I like your Kenshin costume too...Did you make it yourself?"

Alex suddenly went into complete geek mode. "Yeah! You'd be surprised how much good cloth people are just willing to give away! I'm pretty good at sewing actually so I made the entire thing from scratch! It took me a few days but I'm really happy with it. He's my favorite character, after all!"

"Haha...Cool..." She welcomed them into Tandy's house.

As Marlene walked by her, she glared at Cat. Knowing it'd be best to not start off on the wrong foot with her, especially after the past few days, Cat tried to compliment her.

"I like your costume too Marlene..."

She just huffed again and walked right past her. Alex was busy looking around the house.

"Jesus. I didn't know this place was so big! Does she live here by herself?"

"No...Her dad lives here too. But I don't think he comes home until late, so he's probably still asleep."

"Ah, where is she anyway?"

"Right here!" Said Tandy as she skidded down the stairwell. She looked almost completely like the real Kanako Urashima now with the makeup on.

"Hey Tan." Greeted Alex. "Nice Kanako outfit."

She grinned. "Thanks Battousai. I just had to put the finishing touches on it. We all set to go?"

"Yep. We'll take a cab, I have the guy waiting out there now." Alex checked his watch. "We should hurry though, they'll be opening doors in half an hour."
15211111111111111111111121.title: The Cat Girl.

choices: Cat pulls Tandy aside to tell her about her dream.
Cat gets distracted and doesn't get to tell Tandy.
152111111111111111111111211.content:
Just outside their hometown was the larger city of Summerset. It was across the bridge over the lake that separated the cities, few people went there though other than for shows or major shopping. Summerset had some of the largest buildings in the state, it was easily the biggest metropolis for miles. And, of course, was home to the Anime Con.

Cat had been to Summerset several times with her parents, but this was the first time she would be going alone with her friends. She could feel her tail flopping around the car seat in eagerness as they entered the bridge.

Alex, who was sitting in the back of the cab with her and Tandy, immediately took notice to the sudden movement. "Gah! What is that?"

Cat suddenly remembered she was supposed to be in costume. She grabbed her tail to make it stop moving. "Oh, crap! Sorry Alex! That's my tail...It's...Uh...it's..."

"It's electronic. It moves on it's own." Added Tandy, saving Cat from giving herself away. "Very sophisticated stuff."

"Huh, no fooling." Said Alex, eying Cat's tail. "Its look very realistic. Mind if I feel it Cat?"

"U-uh...Sure..uh..Go ahead."

Alex gently grabbed Cat's tail, but it still felt like someone had dropped an ice cube down her back. A tail on the cat's body was a very sensitive part of its anatomy, for Cat this was no exception. Just Alex stroking it felt like someone was playing the xylophone on her spine. But she bit her lip and tried not to make a sound.

"Really lifelike. Where did you say you got this?"

Cat didn't dare open her mouth in fear of yelping in in discomfort. She turned to Tandy, practically begging for help.

"Oh, it's just something we found on Ebay. Cool, huh?" Winked Tandy.

"Very." Alex at last released Cat's tail, causing her to sigh in relief. "What's the matter Cat?"

"Huh? Oh, it's nothing...It's just...Early." She tried to fake a yawn.

Alex rolled his eyes. "Come on. Technically it's a school day, you should be awake and chipper."

He turned to look out his window. "Maybe this will wake you up. Take a look at that."

Everyone in the cab save the driver moved to get a view of what Alex was pointing at. The Summerset skyline. The buildings rose higher than any of the mountains nearby, nearly blocking out the morning sun. The dull shades of gray now shown brightly in the light, almost making the city seem radiant. Alex pointed at a large, mostly glass based, building closest to the lake.

"That's where the Anime Con is. We should be getting there in five minutes unless we hit traffic on the way in. Hope you guys are as excited as I am."

Cat smiled. She certainly was.

~

"Well, Mr. Vale. Today's the day." Hummed the overweight cop Frank as he merrily swung his keys around his index finger. "By noon we'll be transporting you to court, and then I don't have to see that ugly mug of yours ever again."

Jonny Vale wasn't even listening, he still had his head in his hands, covering the giant scar across his face. In the cell next to his Maxwell Lenard hadn't seemed to move the whole day. Under his bushel of brown hair he was eying the fat policeman as he continued to taunt Jonny.

"Didn't you hear me you silent giant freak? I said by this afternoon you're a dead man. You've got blood on your hands. You'll get the chair."

Jonny still gave no reaction. Frank spat on the ground then looked at Maxwell in the other cell. "Jesus, it's like being in a room with a bunch of ghosts."

As Frank turned away to go to his desk in the corner of the basement, Maxwell muttered under his breath in a raspy monotone voice.

"Vale."

Jonny peaked through his fingers and whispered back. "Lenard?"

"I'm thinking of escaping this place. Do you wish to join me?"

There was a sudden pain in Jonny's scar, it throbbed as it remembering a horrible memory. The giant man's eyes turned blood red.

"Hell yes I do."

Maxwell grinned in a sinister manner. "Be patient. Follow my lead."

~

"It's soooo big!" Yelled Tandy as she shouted at the massive glass covered building with a giant banner that read 'Anime Con: Welcome Geeks and Nerds Alike!'

"Yes, we've certainly found the hallowed halls of nerd-dom." Muttered Marlene as she eyed a pair of cos-players posing for pictures nearby.

"Crap, 9:15. We're running late. No wonder there's no line in front of the place." Alex said as he walked ahead of the girls, eying his watch. "We gotta hurry up if we're going to get to the main event."

"Main event?" Asked Cat.

"Yeah, didn't you hear? Saigô Takeuji is supposed to be coming to announce his new series and sign autographs."

Cat grinned. "Say Tandy, isn't he the guy who wrote your favorite vampire series. You know, Blood Demons?"

Tandy blushed slightly. "I...I don't know what you're talking about Cat..."

Marlene rolled her eyes as Alex cleared his throat. "REGARDLESS. We should still get going before we miss everything fun about the convention. Come on."

They made their way to the front and were quickly granted easy access. They followed the signs to the gymnasium, it wasn't hard to guess where the action was. Crowds of people dressed in famous anime, manga, and video game characters littered the halls. Eventually the group found two large steel doors that seemed to open up into a whole other world.

"Wow! Look at this place!" Said Alex, taking the words out of everyone's mouth.

There were hundreds of stages and booths set up for what seemed like miles, selling various objects and collectibles for different series of genres. There couldn't be less than three thousand people in there. All fans and anime lovers, most dressed in costume.

But the strangest thing was that Cat recognized all of it. Aside the mobs of people, this was the EXACT place she had been in her dream. And on top of Alex dressing up as Kenshin...Everything just seemed too coincidental. Was her dream real? Would something like that really happen today?

"Cat?" Said Tandy. "You okay?"

"Huh!? Uh...Yeah...It's just..." Cat tried to finish.
152111111111111111111111211.title: Cat Con.

choices: Onto the next part of the con!
1521111111111111111111112111.content:
"It's just...Tandy. Can I talk to you alone for a second?" Asked Cat, earnestly.

"Uh...Sure...I guess." Came Tandy's reply before Cat quickly grabbed her by the wrist and pulled her away from Alex and the rest of the crowd.

She eventually settled on a dark spot behind the pulled up bleachers.

As Tandy dusted herself off she gave Cat a somewhat troubled look. "You're starting to scare me a little now, girl. What's on your mind?"

Cat was struggling to get the words out. "Tandy. I saw this all before! Everything! I had another dream last night...Only...It wasn't like all the others! But then everything...now...and then...happened!"

"Whoa, whoa, whoa. Slow down! Tell me what happened from the beginning."

Cat took a deep breath. "Okay...Remember how when I dream, I don't really so much dream as I do sit back and watch stuff happen over night?"

Tandy shuddered slightly, recalling the night Cat nearly attacked her. "Right..."

"Well I dreamed again! Only it wasn't like the last few dreams...I was here in this EXACT place. Every little detail...I...I can remember it! It's like my dreams were predicting the future!"

Tandy thought for a second. "Was it just you in the dream or...?"

Cat blushed. "No...Alex was there too...We sort of...danced then...kissed."

A wicked grin suddenly filled the goth girl's face. "Well that's good right? I mean, it's not like he knows about your little secret. Maybe he actually WILL kiss you today, in front of everyone!"

The cat girl's face somehow turned even more rosy red. "I....I...."

Tandy grabbed her friend's hand and started to pull her out back to the convention. "Don't be such a worrywart. I thought you dreamed something bad like you mauled someone to death...Come on, this is a good thing! Let's get back to Alex."

"I...I guess you're right..." Replied Cat, reluctantly.

As the two best friends went back into the crowd to find Alex, Marlene quietly exited the shadows behind the bleachers, she had remained just out of sight from the two girls the whole time.

She smirked. "Hmm...your little secret...Huh, cat girl?"

~

"Sorry about that Alex." Said Tandy as they finally found the Kenshin cosplayer in front of a large group of people gathered near the stage. "Cat wanted to get a picture of something and we only brought one camera."

"Oh, it's no trouble. Say, have you guys seen Marlene anywhere? She just disappeared after you left."

"Nope, maybe she went to the bathroom or something."

"Huh, oh well. She probably won't understand this stuff anyway."

Just as Alex finished speaking, a loud voice boomed over the audience.

"And now, ladies and gentlemen. Presenting, the master of manga himself, Saigô Takeuji!"

The crowd went wild, including Alex and Tandy. Cat was the only one who didn't seem too thrilled, she was still deep in thought at the meaning behind her dream. Particularly the voice she heard while dreaming. Though her thoughts were soon dispelled as the key speaker entered the stage.

A medium height, spiky haired Asian man with dark glasses and a black suit with a white tie made his way to the podium. After tapping the microphone a few times he said in a some what forced English accent.

"Hello. Sorry for my speech. English is...not my best language." He pulled up a few note cards and read aloud. "Welcome to the tenth annual Anime Con in Summerset."

A loud applause cheered Saigô on. "I suppose most of you know who I am, but just in case. I am Saigô Takeuji and I have the honor of hosting this great event."

As he continued his speech, a woman approached him from behind carrying what appeared to be a book.

"So let's get started. To kick things off, I've decided to hold a little contest. I'm going to pick one of you in the crowd at random and give away a valuable prize."

He held up the book. It was mostly black, the title was written in red. On the cover were two young men with black hair, standing back to back. The art was beautifully done. Below all that was a signature in gold.

"This is my latest unreleased work, Blood Brothers. It hasn't even been released in Japan yet. One of you will walk with this. So...Who wants it?"

It was like the audience had been waiting all day for him to say that, hundreds of hands shot up in the air. People were frantically waving to get the artist's attention. Alex and Tandy were practically jumping out of their costumes while Cat just stood there and sort of laughed nervously.

"Hmm...Let's see here..." Saigô said to himself as he eyed the convention. He eyes eventually landed on Cat, squashed in between Tandy and Alex.

"How about that cat girl there? Come on up young lady."

"What!? Me!?" Cat yelled. Her only reply was a quick shove on the back from Tandy, pushing her friend onto the stage.

Cat eventually fought her way through the crowds of people and stepped up on the stage. Saigô Takeuji went up to her and shook her hand (of course, she had to be careful not to cut him with her claws). Staring out into the audience made her ears droop. There was never a time where she had stood before so MANY people in one room.

Saigô took the book and gently handed it to Cat. "You'll really enjoy it, it's probably my best work yet." He said with a wink.

"T-thank you sir!"

"What's your name, young lady?"

"U-uh...It's Cat...sir. Catherine Hill."

He laughed slightly. "Fitting name for a cat girl. That's an excellent costume by the way, if I do say so myself. Let's hear it for Cat, audience!"

Again, the audience clapped insanely. Cat just blushed. Again, dumb luck had granted her something she'd probably never be able to forget. But who was she to question it. Lifting the book up triumphantly, she smiled while looking straight at Alex.

He smiled back and gave her a wink.
1521111111111111111111112111.title: Celebrity.

15211111111111111111111121111.content:
The door leading into the basement swung open. Jackson stepped into the dank cell room, eying Frank heavily sleeping the corner with his usual "material" propped on his big belly, slowly going up and down as he snored. The more competent cop sighed and walked over to his partner to give him a nudge.

"Up Frank. Come on, this isn't break time yet. I can't cover your ass four times a week."

The fat man grumbled and slowly sat up. "Was'sat? M-morning already?"

"It's noon. Time to transport mister giant over there. C'mon I need your help."

In a grumpy bearlike manner, Frank stood shakily on his two feet as both cops made their way to cell door containing Jonny Vale. The giant man still hadn't moved all morning. Jackson reached into his pocket and pulled out a large set of silver keys.

"You really had to wake me up for this?" Mumbled Frank.

"You know damn well this routine. Two cops for one prisoner. Captain wants no problems transporting this guy to court." Jackson snapped back.

"Yeah...yeah...yeah.."

Suddenly, Maxwell Lenard in the other cell began to start coughing violently, surprising the policemen since they hadn't even seen him move the entire time the mental patient had been in the cell. Blood was coming out of the sickly young man's mouth.

"P-please..." He muttered. "M-m-my meds...I-I *COUGH* N-need...my..."

"Shit!" Swore Jackson, he momentarily forgot about unlocking Jonny Vale's cell and proceeded to unlock Maxwell's. "Frank, get some paramedics down here! Quick!"

Frank, still dazed from just waking up, nodded and bumbled to the door leading upstairs just as Jackson finished unlocking the cell. Frank heard the shuffling of footsteps, followed by a brief sound of grunting and struggling behind him. He turned to ask what was going on to his partner, but was greeted by two loud gunshots. Then everything went black.

Maxwell had Jackson in a throttling position with one hand and the policeman's smoking gun aimed at Frank's corpse on the other side of the room in the other. He wiped the blood from his mouth off his chin and sighed.

"I never did like that man..."

Before Jackson could respond, Maxwell bashed the black cop's head hard into the cell wall. The policeman was instantly knocked out and Maxwell quickly grabbed his keys before he landed on the ground.

"You made that look easy...Didn't even need me...Clever with the coughing up blood, did you bite your own tongue?" Muttered Jonny Vale, as he looked up at the scene.

"Mmm, my brother and I have been in similar situations in our youth...This certainly does bring back memories." Smiled Maxwell as he continued to speak in a monotone voice.

The skinny man left the cell and slammed the door shut before locking it again. He then turned to Frank's body and propped it again the basement door. With his tasks complete, Maxwell returned to Vale's cage and held up the silver key Jackson was going to use to open his cell.

"I fancy a stroll around town. How about you Vale?"

With the jagged scar down his face, Jonny Vale looked like a monster when he grinned back. "Like I have a choice."

~

Tandy was still squealing with joy, even at lunch, over the book Cat won and had given her. She hugged it close to her chest as she thanked Cat a hundredth time.

"Ohhhh...Thank you again Cat! I can't believe you even won this! I love Saigô's works!"

"It's no problem Tandy, really..." Cat rolled her eyes as she finished her milkshake.

The group of four had found a table at the indoor cafe for the convention. The rest of the morning had been spent looking through the merchandise and wares people had brought in for sale. Cat spotted a few things that caught her interest, but nothing she desperately needed to have. Tandy, on the other hand, had gone just a little bit nuts with spending when they came across a Twilight booth.

Alex had continually offered to buy the girls things but never actually bought anything for himself. Marlene seemed more interested in the movie stuff, though Cat caught a glimpse of her buying a Twilight figure as well when Alex and Tandy were busy loading all of Tandy's purchases in a bag.

Cat stared contently across the table at Marlene, who also seemed mildly amused about something like that.

She tried to be friendly again. "You seem to be in a good mood today, Marlene."

Marlene did her usual huff and replied. "Do I? Well let's just say, I feel like the cat that caught the canary."

Cat raised her eyes in suspicion but her thoughts were quickly interrupted by Alex, returning from throwing the group's garage in the trash can. He threw a map on the table, labeled with points of interest at the convention.

"Alright guys. The convention's not even half over so we still got a ton of stuff we can do."

"Oooh." Said Tandy, pointing to one section of the map. "There's a horror novel area..."

"Please, no more creepy gothic stuff..." Replied Marlene, pointing to another part of the map. "I say we check out the movie area, there's some guest stars that will be appearing."

"How about the manga workshops?" Asked Alex, earnestly. "I've always wanted to learn how to draw like the artists do."

All those things seemed interesting to Cat, especially Alex's suggestion. But in truth there was one place she really wanted to check out. It was the...
15211111111111111111111121111.title: Midday.

152111111111111111111111211111.content:
Cat poked directly at the center of the map. "What's happening here right now, Alex?"

"Huh? The main hall? Let's see..." He pulled out a paper schedule from the folds of his purple gi. "It's 12:30 so...There should actually be a dance party going on there right now."

"A dance party?" Asked Tandy, winking slyly at Cat. "That sounds pretty fun."

Marlene, however, shot a glare across the table at Cat. She didn't say a word though.

"Dancing...Hmm. I guess I'm game for it." Said Alex.

Perfect. Cat had hoped that she would get the chance to see if her dream was actually a prediction of the future. The dancing and the kiss were all the proof she'd need. Cat smirked at Marlene's angry contorted face before replying. "Me too."

"So it's settled then. Come on, if we hurry we can make it before it begins." Alex said as he stood up to collect the papers.

Everyone in the group but Marlene got up to leave for the dance hall. She sat with arms crossed and swore to herself.

"Try anything funny cat-girl and I swear, you're going to need more the nine lives after I get through with you."

With that, she stood up to join the others.

~

The convention workers had pushed aside all the booths surrounding the stage where Saigô had given Cat his new book. Strobe lights and fog machines lined around in the cleared square area, which would obviously serve as the dance floor. On the stage, a band was setting up their instruments while crowded onlookers readied themselves and were chatting profusely.

"Cool, they're having a live band play here. This should be awesome." Yelled Alex over the roaring crowd.

Cat nodded in agreement but had to fight the urge to cover her delicate ears. All this noise was no good for someone with cat-like hearing. Every little detail, every breath someone in the crowd took, every word they said, she could hear as if they were standing next to her ears.

It was becoming a little difficult to hear Alex talk, even though he was standing right in front of her. There were so many voices, it was a challenge to separate his from the inaudible mess that played in Cat's head like a bad recording.

"What?" Asked Cat as Alex mouthed something to her.

He seemed to be trying to explain things to her again, but her hearing was only getting worse as the audience grew louder and rowdier. Cat felt a grab on her shoulder. Tandy was pointing to a sign above the stage.

"Oh." Said Cat, reading the sign out loud. "Couple's dance. Pair up, compete, and win a prize."

Just as she finished speaking, the loud screech of the microphone on stage filled the air causing Cat and several other people to cover their ears. A loud booming voice rippled over the audience's murmurs.

"Hey guys! Thanks for joining us for the third annual Anime Con dance!" Said the announcer, he appeared to be a young and slightly inexperienced guy with red hair.

"Uh, the band is still setting up but we should done in 5 minutes. Remember this is a couple's dance. You need to pair up with someone in order to participate. Step on the floor if you're playing and I'll explain the rules."

In an instant, Marlene grabbed Alex around the arm. Looks like she had picked up on Cat's little plan right from the start. Unfortunately, Cat was a bit too preoccupied with the volume level to care too much anymore. Tandy was more than willing to dance with Cat anyway, after all the rules didn't say the dancers had to be actual couples. The four of them assembled with the other couples in the center of the floor.

"Great!" Continued the announcer. "So, uh, let me explain how things will go. Basically the first round will be a fast paced sort of techno tango round. You'll dance with your partner for a bit, then switch randomly to someone else's partner each time the music stops. So in other words, you may end up with a partner that isn't even your own by the end."

Cat could at least hear that bit. In other words, she had a small chance to end up with Alex, and Marlene wouldn't be able to do anything about it.

"We'll stop the music three times during round one. Once round two starts, the real dance competition begins! You'll stick with the partner you have until the end. The winning pair gets the prize. So...You guys ready?"

The dancers shouted in agreement, Cat clamped her ears shut to drown out some of the noise.

"Good. Alright guys, start 'er up!" The red head motioned to the band behind him.

Cat sighed in relief once the music started playing, it was far more soothing than the barrage of hundreds of voices. She and Tandy began to dance to the rapid techno beat the band. Though Cat was hardly a good dancer she could at least keep up with Tandy, who seemed overly into the music.

"And we're off!" Narrated the announced, pacing around the stage eying all the dancers. "Jeesh, you guys really need to step up your game. We'll only give out this prize to the best dancers!"

Cat was too busy trying to keep a steady pace to care, Tandy, however, started dancing harder, if that was possible. It took Cat awhile but eventually she started getting into the flow of the beat. It had a certain rhythm to it, like the waves in an ocean. Then all of a sudden...

"STOP AND SWAP!" Shouted the announcer as the music came to an abrupt end.

Like a swarm of bees, all the dancers scrambled around like maniacs to find a new partner. Cat was left confused in the middle of the dance floor and looked desperately around for another partner. Alex was no where to be seen.

She was eventually paired with an overweight teen dressed in a Batman costume, he breathed really loudly and heavily.

"Hi..." He said. "I...Like your costume..."

"Um, thank you..."

Again. The techno beat started up. Cat's new partner had two left feet and just wiggled around really awkwardly. She tried to ignore him and looked around for Alex among the crowd.

"STOP!" Yelled the announcer again. Once more, people zoomed by Cat to find new dance partners.

The next partner Cat "found" was a tall and skinny guy in Vash's suit from Trigun. He at least wasn't as socially awkward as the last guy, however, he was much more quieter.

"Pleased to dance with you." Said Cat with a forced smile.

He just sighed, and the music began again. Cat still couldn't see Alex anywhere. This was her last chance too. After what seemed like an eternity, the rapid dance beat was laid to rest for a third and final time. This was it, her last chance to pair up with Alex.

Cat pushed her way through the crowd trying to find her Kenshin dressed crush...
152111111111111111111111211111.title: Dance Hall Drug.

1521111111111111111111112111111.content:
There were way too many people on the dance floor, knocking and crowding their way through the tiny gaps of the other dancers. Hope was slowly and coldly fleeting of Cat ever finding Alex in this ground. What had she been thinking? There had to be over a hundred people here, how the hell was she going to find Alex out of all these cos-players?

Cat stopped to sulk slightly but then jumped when a hand touched her on her right shoulder.

"Need a partner, Cat?" Came an all too familiar voice.

Her ears perked up. Cat turned around to see...,"...Alex?"

Alex smiled at her. "Heh, I couldn't find Marlene anywhere. You were the easiest person to spot in the crowd. So...What do you say?"

"Yes!" Cat yelled back at once. "I-I mean...If you want to..."

Alex didn't answer but instead laughed slightly and grabbed both of Cat's hands. The cat girl, again, had to be careful not to dig into his hands out of pure eagerness.

She finally asked. "Wh-what are you...?"

"They want us to waltz, look around." Replied Alex, gesturing to the other dancers.

Everyone had partnered up again and took the same position as Cat and Alex. This was real partner dancing, like the kind in love movies. Comically, Cat saw that Marlene had the misfortune to get paired with Tandy. Her best friend was trying her best to hold back Marlene, who looked ready to run over to Cat and punch her.

"Oh boy, Marlene's pissed." Muttered Alex. "She's going to give me hell later on..."

"Sorry...It's my fault..." Cat's ears drooped a little.

He looked into her ears. "Nah. You have nothing to do with this. In fact...I'm kinda-"

But before Alex could finish, the microphone of the announcer screeched as the red haired man again took the stage to explain the next part of the dance.

"Alright, so I see all you guys know what's next. Now we're moving onto the real fun part of the contest. This is going to be real partner dancing..." He was greeted by several boos from the dancers. "Yes fella's, that means you actually have to TOUCH the other person. We'll be going around, pointing out partners who get eliminated. So dance your best!"

A sudden jolt of fear ran down Cat's spine. "Alex, I just remembered! I don't know how to dance like this!"

He just laughed again. "Relax. It isn't that hard. Here, I'll lead and you follow. Just try to...sort of go with flow. I know it sounds corny but trust me. I know what I'm doing."

The music changed from a fast paced techno beat to a more slow quiet classical tune. In an instant, Alex pushed Cat forward until she was nearly on the balls of her feet. She thanked god that the coin had given such good balance, she wasn't sure she would ever be able to dance like this without it.

Alex seemed so confident though. Every step he took was strong, precise, and focused. He spun her around like a top and quickly caught her with his other hand before bringing her in close.

"Now extend your right arm." He said with a smile. "That's it."

They slowly and carefully side stepped down the dance floor, Alex was sure not to rush Cat in case she tripped, but she was dancing just fine.

"Say, you're pretty good for a first timer." He grinned.

"T-thanks..."

Cat was slowly feeling it. The movement of the symphony playing. The feel of dancing. It was just like before, only this was somewhat different. Cat felt safer. Warmer. She was enjoying herself, of course, but there was something that being this close to Alex did.

Alex broke up her brief thoughts. "Want to go faster?"

"Sure." Cat replied without thinking properly.

"Excellent."

With that, Alex really stepped it up into high gear. The motions and dance moves were becoming quicker and more...sensual. All around them, other dancers were getting called out left and right. Unknown to the dancing pair, they were nearly exactly in the center of the dance floor. Crowds of people were gathering around them to watch, many of them were cheering Cat and Alex on.

Of course, Cat didn't even seem to notice. Her head was too wrapped up with keeping up with Alex's dancing

Alex, on the other hand, had time to crack a small joke. "If only we had a rose."

Eventually there were only three pairs left; including the swordsman and the cat girl. The competition was really starting to get intense, and yet still Cat remained in her own little world.

She kept getting closer and closer to Alex...
1521111111111111111111112111111.title: The Swordsman and the Cat.

choices: The lights go out in the convention.
Meanwhile back at Aunt Carla's place...
15211111111111111111111121111111.content:
While the other dancers struggled to keep up, the two continued to dance away. More and more, the rhythm got faster and faster. Closer and closer Cat was getting to Alex's face. Closer to his lips.

He didn't seem to be rejecting her approach either. It was a mutual feeling, a strong hopeful feeling shared between the both of them. In fact, he seemed to be getting closer himself. Their feet and arms were moving by themselves, though quietly slowing down in speed.

They were going to kiss. For real this time. Not a peak on a cheek in the rain, but a lip to lip kiss. Was Marlene watching? Oh man, everyone had to be watching. The whole audience staring them down.

But something funny happened. Cat didn't care. To hell with everyone, she was in complete bliss. This was meant to be, she was sure of it. Nothing was going to stop her. She closed her eyes and...

"AND WE HAVE OUR WINNERS!" Yelled the announcer, jolting both Cat and Alex back to reality.

Cat looked around. She and Alex were both alone in the center of the dance floor, all the other dancers had been eliminated. Blushing, she suddenly realized just how MANY people were watching them.

The red haired announcer stepped off the stage and approached them with a big golden trophy. "Congratulations you two! I haven't seen dancing like that in years!"

The audience was also starting to approach the pair, security had apparently been unable to hold them back any longer. Cat and Alex were suddenly under attack by a volley of questions, hand shakes, and pats on the back. It was beginning to feel extremely crowded and loud.

Cat tried to stay as near to Alex as she could, he whispered in her ear. "Want to go someplace more...quiet?"

She nodded, grabbing her tail as someone tried to pull it.

"Alright take my hand Cat, and duck down."

She obeyed and they both dove under the heads of the crowd, escaping from their newly-found publicity.

~

Eventually, both of them were able to get to the same dark spot behind the bleachers Cat and Tandy had been at earlier, without anyone even noticing that they had disappeared. Alex still had the trophy they had won in his hand and was completely out of breath.

He turned to Cat and said between gulps of air. "And...You said...That was...Your FIRST time dancing?"

Cat was also catching her breath. "Well...Yeah..."

Alex took a big sigh of relief and leaned against the wall, placing the trophy on the ground. "Jesus, I thought we'd never get out of there. You okay?"

"Yeah, I'm fine..."

They stared at each other, laughing nervously. But they were only fooling themselves, they both knew what was on their mind near the end of the dance. How close they had came to kissing each other.

Alex blushed. "So, uh, you okay?"

Cat returned his blush with her own red hue. "You already asked me that..."

He rubbed the back of his head. "Oh right, uh..."

Silence filled the dark corner behind the bleachers. The two were dying to ask each other the same question. But like a battle between two generals that reached a stalemate; neither of the two wanted to make the first move.

The memory of last night's dream flashed before Cat's eyes, she had to know.

"Did we almost...You know..." She tried to finish.

"...Kiss?" Asked Alex.

Cat could feel her heartbeat quicken. "Y-yeah..."

Alex didn't reply, but instead gave her a distinct look. It wasn't a "You're crazy" look. This was sincere though somewhat guilty, it was a look of acknowledgment.

Cat slowly brought her hand to her mouth. "S-sorry...I shouldn't have a-asked...I-I mean..."

She turned to leave but Alex said. "No...Wait."

Cat's heart was beating like a machine gun at this point. Alex grabbed her gently by the hands. She wasn't lost in the moment of dancing like before, and she wasn't dreaming.

"Alex..."

"Shhh..." He whispered, coming in closer and closer.

Cat just wanted to close her eyes and kiss him. But there was that nagging little doubt. It felt like in the cartoons, where the little angel and demon were on opposite shoulders.

"Go on! Kiss him!" Snarled the devil.

"This isn't right though! Alex is Marlene's boyfriend, as much as you hate her this isn't you!" Replied the angel.

"Don't be a coward. This is what you want!"

"Not like this! Give it time!"

"Kiss him!"

"Stop this!"

Cat reacted just as Alex was mere inches from her own face. She broke free of his hold and yelled.

"No!"

Alex looked taken aback for a few brief moments then somewhat hurt.

"What is it, Cat?"

Cat was just struggling to get the words out. She didn't know what to think. "It's...it...Oh, Alex. I'm sorry! This...this just doesn't feel right! With Marlene...And...and..."

She was expecting him to be to angry with her, that would seem to be the typical response. But Alex didn't look angry, not with her anyway. Rather it was almost like he was angry with himself.

"Alex...I'm sorry." Repeated Cat.

"No, don't be...I'm such an idiot...I should, apologize Cat. I was being selfish is all."

"Selfish?" Asked Cat. "But I'm the one who-"

"No, never mind. You won't understand. I just...I think I need some time to think, alone."

Alex started pacing under the darkness of the bleachers. Cat was free to leave at anytime, but she was now really worried about Alex. She had never seen him look so distraught before.

"You can go." He said, sternly.

"Alex....Really, I am sorry..." She tried once more.

"Just-!" Alex almost yelled in return. "Just...just go. Please go...I'll be fine."

Cat was near tears at this point, but held them back. The last thing she wanted to be doing was to be caught crying in front of him. She watched him pace, stare off into space, and begin painfully pulling at his hair occasionally.

As Cat turned to leave, what sounded like the fire alarm went off. A loud voice blared over the intercom.

"Attention all attendees of the Anime Con! This is a red alert, we've just been informed that two dangerous criminals have escaped from a local prison and might possibly be in the area. Police are outside and are ordering us to evacuate the premises while they search the building. Please exit quietly and calmly out of the nearest fire escape."

Cat peaked out from the cracks of the bleachers to see people and cos-players all line up, murmuring about the sudden change of events. Alex approached her from behind to take a look as well.

"Alex? What's going on?"

He had a look of seriousness of his face that Cat had never seen before. "Nothing good, not doubt. Stay close to me. I have a bad feeling about this..."
15211111111111111111111121111111.title: Winners and Losers.

152111111111111111111111211111111.content:
Suddenly the electricity went out, for at least several blocks around. Cat reflexively squeezed Alex's arm, leaving Alex in further consternation about how he would treat this whole situation. Maybe there was some way to ease the tension between Cat and Marlene. Why did everything have to be so hard.

~

"Let go of me, you brute!" Marlene shrieked to Tandy.

Tandy had bodily led her away from the crowd to put the odds in favor of Cat and Alex. Naturally, Marlene was not pleased with this.

"You're in no position to call anyone else a brute. You're just a bully with a sense of entitlement, and nobody likes you Marlene, except Alex for some reason. I don't know what kind of black magic is responsible for that, but it's more than you deserve, and you know what else? It's not going to last. It wasn't going to last anyway. Some day he would have figured you out for what you are, and he'd have left you anyway. And you're not good for him either, he deserves better than you, and Cat deserves some happiness too. So I want to give my friend a shot with him." Tandy was close to running out of patience with Marlene.

"You psycho goth bitch, you don't know anything!" Marlene said with a tremble.

"Oh my god, you're actually crying, aren't you?" Tandy was grinning. Tan was intent to show Marlene the queen bitch as much mercy as she had shown her own targets over time.

"Shut up! Shut up you manipulative bitch, who, hick, who are you to... hick.... conspire with that, that catgirl to try to take my huuuu.... my Alex away fr... from me! Huuu huuu!!" She couldn't hold back the tears now. She was convulsing with tears that wouldn't stop flowing now and on her hands and knees.

"Well now I'm starting to feel bad. I just wanted to knock you off your high horse, not crush you, Marlene. The thought never crossed my mind that you might be this fragile." Tandy helped her up. Marlene continued to cry. Tandy hugged her, and Marlene literally cried into her shoulder. "Look Marlene, Cat's a good girl, life's too short to waste it on being jealous on things like this, give her a chance and I think you might come to like her a lot instead of seeing her as some kind of enemy or obstacle. Is it even the end of the world if both of you were Alex's girlfriends?"

Marlene continued crying and tried to say something, but was interrupted by a figure slowly stepping out of the shadows. Why was it so dark? All the lights had gone out after some announcement they couldn't make out, apparently the power was out. They got some light from the solitary street lamp overhanging the sidewalk they were on just outside the convention center. Apparently it must have a different power system.

"Pardon me for interrupting this truly touching scene, but I couldn't help but overhear you talking about Alex this, Alex that. You wouldn't be talking about Alex Lenard by any chance, would you?" the figure said. His voice sounded similar to Alex's, but he wasn't Alex. As he stepped into the light, he was rather pale.

"Y..yes, h..he's my b-boyfriend," Marlene squeezed out, the crying fits starting to subside now.

"Interesting. Quite a bit of luck is on our side, I'd say," the young man said.

Another man, a much bigger man, a dangerous looking mountain of a figure, stayed in the shadows, and said "I'd like to get a crack at that other one, Max. We know each other. We have some unfinished business."

Tandy knew that voice. "Y...you. No, it can't be!" She was terrified, as the man with the wound across his face stepped into the light, the mugger from before, a pistol in his hand, leveled at her. His hand did not waver. He was calm, and would not be apt to make a mistake.

"It's a pity your other friend, that freak, isn't here, I'd really like to put her away. But she's not here to save you this time."

"Don't count on it," said a voice behind them.

Jonny Vale's heart almost stopped in his chest. He swung his large frame around to see the source of the voice. He saw two glowing cat's eyes gleaming at him, further back into the shadows. He reflexively retreated back and into the light, as if a live cockroach had just jumped out at him from his dinner he was eating.

He tried to aim his gun at her, but she was fast. SO fast, just like before. He fired at her and she seemed to either dodge the bullet or at least move out of the way with such reaction time that she was safe by the time he finished pulling the trigger. He instead almost hit Max, who ducked and jumped down and to the side, "hey, watch it!" Max said in an even tone.

Cat stepped into full view of the streetlamp, and Jonny's once calm grip on the gun was trembling now. He fired another shot which ricocheted off of a brick wall and into the darkness, and she had her hand, or her paw, on the gun and had twisted it away from him and out of his fiercely strong grip in just one moment of weakness, much like being slammed by surprise in an arm-wrestling competition. He took a frantic swing at her, and it connected! "Maybe I have a chance after all", he thought. He reached into his pocket and took the pocket knife he had taken from that cop, and opened it. If the bitch reached down to grab the gun, he'd slice her open. She had a bleeding nose and mouth already. She bled red at least. Whatever the hell she was.

Jonny took a swing at Cat, who deftly dodged it. He tried it again and she so narrowly ducked away from it that the tip of the blade struck one of the bells decorating her tail and maybe sliced off a few hairs from it. But when it happened, the most absurd thing happened. She grabbed the knife away from him. WITH her tail!

Having suddenly been disarmed, looking first at his empty hands, then looking at the creature before him, the beautiful young woman with the tail, who was holding the knife in her tail, after a second or two of stunned silence, yelled out "WHAT THE FFFFF!!!!!!" before having the wind knocked out of him from a fierce punch to his gut from that girl.

Maxwell slinked into the darkness and ran off.

"You saved me again. Are you sure you don't want to reconsider being a superhero Cat?" Tandy said, smiling. "Unfortunately, Catwoman is already taken so you'll have to come up with a different name I think."

"Har de har har," replied Cat. She looked to Marlene, who was staring at her silently. The cat was out of the bag. She transferred the knife to her hand. "The funny thing is, this thing isn't really very prehensile, I was only weakly holding onto it and couldn't have used it as a weapon and only got it because he let go of it at the right hand and it was just in the right position by chance. Marlene, uh, please, um..."

"Thh...thank you," Marlene squeaked.

"Uh, you're welcome? Um, Marlene, the answer is probably no, but by any chance, would you be able to, uh, not tell anyone about this? About me?"

"I... I kind of already figured it out already. I was spying on you a little bit. I won't tell anyone, how could I possibly, after this, but, but what the hell is this?"

Cat sighed and explained about the coin and what was happening to her and that the odds were high that she wouldn't even be a romantic rival for Alex anyway because by the time it was done, she might be all the way a cat or some sort of monster, but much to Marlene's surprise, she apologized to Marlene for trying to woo him right in front of her anyway.

"You were really cool tonight though Cat," winked Tan.

"A little too cool if you ask me," pouted Marlene. "Could you maybe not all the way take away Alex from me? I'm sorry for the things I've done to you."

"How about I have him a LITTLE bit. Just sometimes. Don't think of it as having lost him, think of it as having gained me?"

Marlene laughed and cried. They called the police, and Jonny Vale was back in custody. Max Lenard however remained at large.

That night, Marlene was thinking about all this. Darnit, Cat was pretty cool, why couldn't she have lightened up on her a little bit on her own. Marlene had done some awful things to her. She closed her eyes and went to sleep.

~

"Marlene, did you finish your homework assignment?" Marlene looked behind her. There was Cat, on her way to school, but without any apparent concern for hiding her feline features! Her ears were out, no hat or hoodie or anything, and her tail waved behind her.

"What are you doing Cat, someone's going to see you! You can't just be happy-go-lucky parading around like this!"
