"Aww, I can't hide it forever. I don't think I'm going to change back. Either people accept me like this, or I have to hide in darkness and under a heavy layer of clothing like the invisible man for the rest of my life."

"That's true, I guess," Marlene pondered. "But are you sure you are ready for this?"

"I won't know unless I try," Cat replied. "Maybe everyone will be really cool with this and it will increase my popularity."

"That's a distinct possibility," Marlene admitted.

"Plus, I have the people I love all around me to help me through it if it gets rough, I have you, and Tan, and Alex!"

"Alex knows?" Marlene asked.

"Not yet. But I'm sure he'll be accepting. He's a saint."

"That he is," Marlene sighed. "But don't go around telling people you love me though, it's embarrassing."

"Awwww, but I DO love you. And you love me too!" Cat said in a catty tone.

"You cut that out! My feelings for you are, that I have a moderately high opinion of you now."

"You loooooooovvveee me!" Cat mocked. Marlene rolled her eyes. "And I love you too! I love you I love you I love you"

And then Cat did something astonishing. She roughly grabbed Marlene's shoulders, pulled her in and kissed her passionately. Marlene was shocked. She pulled away to say "Cat, what are you doing?!"
152111111111111111111111211111111.title: The lights go out in the convention.

choices: Turns out the catgirl transformation is contageous and transmitted with a kiss
Remember Maxwell Lenard? He's still at large. The plot thickens, with him
1521111111111111111111112111111111.content:
"I'm kissy kissy with the girl that I love!" Cat said, and then kissed Marlene again. And then much to her own horror, Marlene felt horribly deeply sexually aroused. The sort of feelings she couldn't resist. And she kissed back.

And then she woke up.

"Oh my god!" she screamed, sitting up in bed. "I LOVE her?" What a dream. But could it be true?

~

The real Cat awoke that morning to be changed still more, and opposite to Marlene's little dream about her, was not eager to show it to the world. In fact, she had locked herself in her room. After another disturbing dream of her own, she found herself fully furry. Was it done? Were paws next? Her intelligect? Would she completely turn into a cat? No, that didn't make sense. She was getting taller and more buxom. Neither would make any sense if she was turning into a housecat. Maybe the taller part if she was turning into a tiger. That could still be a concern.

There was a knock at the door.

"Who's there?" asked Cat. At least her voice was the same. Hopefully she wouldn't soon be reduced to meows and hisses. She briefly tried to purr before, and couldn't. Or didn't know how to.

"It's Marlene." That was a surprise.

"Uh, hi Marlene."

"Could you open the door?"

"I'd rather not," Cat replied. "I changed more."

"Oh. Sorry to hear that." But this wasn't the thing that concerned Marlene. What really concerned her was her heart going pitter-patter. She was genuinely excited about seeing Cat. "I'm sure you're beautiful! I mean, that it's not too bad. You at least got a nice figure out of the deal."

"True, but my figure is all that's human. Please, I really don't want to see anyone now. I don't know what to do with myself."

"All right. But I'll be back later. Ok?"

"Ok." What was going on with Marlene? Sure, she had arguably saved her life yesterday, but a complete change in personality? She sat in bed for a while. Another knock at the door. This time it was Alex.

~

It was still pretty early in the morning. Marlene called Alex, who was groggy and surprised about the early visit.

Alex yawned, still wearing his pajamas, and said "Hi Marlene. You seem upset."

"I wanted to talk to you about Cat. And us."

"Oh. Look Marlene, I would be lying if I said I didn't like her, but"

"Quiet! I wanted to tell you it's ok with me if you, you know."

"What?" He genuinely didn't know.

"have her as a girlfriend too."

"..... whoa. Wow. I didn't. Oh, I'd never, imagined, no, I'd never do that to you!"

"I'm saying I wouldn't mind it at all. I like her now. Something kind of happened last night, and I'm kind of thinking it would be nice if all three of us were together."

"Oh, holy, wow, ok. Then, then maybe, if that's what you want," he stammered.

"Talk to her. Right now. She's going through something and she needs support from people who lov... like, who support her."

Marlene walked Alex to Cat's place. Maybe this would atone for some of the things she did to Cat.

Inside, he knocked on the door.

"Cat, it's Alex. Can we talk?"

"Can we talk through the door? I'm, uh, having a bad hair day."

"I'd really like to speak to you face to face, I'm sure you're too hard on yourself."

"It's worse than you think, unless Marlene told you," Cat said, looking down at herself. Yeah. A whole-body bad hair day.

"Fine. Marlene did tell me something, she said you were going through something tough, but that's all she said. I'm also here because she thinks um, you're not going to believe this, but she thinks it's ok if you and I were to go out. She wants me to two-time you."

"That doesn't sound like Marlene. Are you sure you didn't misunderstand something?"

"No, she was pretty clear. Something happened between you two and she has completely changed her opinion of you somehow. Now please let me in, we need to talk about this."

Fighting that guy really must have made an impression. It didn't seem like it should have been that much to Marlene though.

"Look, Alex, the truth is, that there is something going on with me, and it's worse than a bad hair day, and I don't think you would accept it. It's something I don't want you to know about it. Can you trust me about this?"

"Whatever this is, I can take it Cat. Come on, how low an opinion of me do you have?"

The door unlocked. It opened a crack, and with a breeze, it drifted open more. Alex pushed it open and approached Alex from behind. She was sitting in a chair, and still wearing the costume. Except now instead of her naked arms, she had apparently added to the costume.

"What's going on, Cat?" Alex said.

"Are you sure?" she answered.

"Yes, come on, what's the big deal here?"

She turned around and faced him.

"Wow, that's really cool. I wasn't expecting you to be still in your costume, and you've added to it. I don't know what you were talking about with the bad hair day before, not only does it look good, but you're adorable. This must have taken hours of preparation."

Cat had been silent through this. "Alex, it's not a costume. I'm really a catgirl, some magic ancient druid cat coin did this, is doing this. It's not a prank. It's real. I'm a monster."

He was stunned. "So all this time, you've hidden this from me."

"Yes."

"But you told Tandy."

"Well, yeah..."

"Why not me?"

"Because, well..."

"I don't believe this! You think I'm such a terrible person, that you can't tell the truth to, have to hide something like that from me! What, you think I would just kick you to the curb because you think I'm some kind of shallow bigot?"

"Wait a minute, I didn't say..." He wasn't rejecting her for the reason Cat was expecting.

"I have to think for a while. I don't know what to think about this for now." Alex bounded away, leaving Cat ambivalent about what to do. She looked at the floor, at her fuzzy feet, when she was surprised to hear Marlene say "Hi." Cat twitched in surprise. It's not easy to sneak up on a cat. But this one was a bit out of sorts.

"Hi Marlene. I guess you heard that. I just, I don't, oh, my life is falling apart!" Cat started crying. And Marlene tried to cuddle her like Tandy had her the night before.

"Shhhhhhh, don't be sad little kitty," Marlene said as she rocked Cat side to side like they were in a slow dance. "Things will work out, after all, you're surrounded by people who love you."

"Well, love, is going a bit far, I think," Cat sobbed.

Little did Cat know, Marlene was practically going crazy. How could Cat not feel her heartbeat? It must be 200 beats a minute! She couldn't take any more of this. She didn't know what was wrong with her, she didn't know why, or how, but she was feeling head-over-heels for Cat.

"Yes Cat, we love you! Especially me!" And Marlene seized a stunned Cat and kissed her furry face right on her mouth passionately. It was deeply exciting to Marlene in a way she didn't know was even possible for her, and deeply astonishing to Cat.

"I'll see you later Cat!" Marlene squeaked giddily, and then gave Cat another quick peck on the mouth.

Cat spent the next 2 minutes staring into silence. Then she phoned Tandy.

"Tandy, could you come over?"

"Sure. Any more, you know, changes?"

"Yeah. I've gone Chewbacca."

"Oh. Sorry to hear that. I wonder if that's the last of it, or if paws are next."

"You're not helping. Just come over here, would you? I have something I need to ask you about."

5 minutes later, Tandy was there.

"It really doesn't look so bad. You're way, way more adorable than Chewy."

"Tan, I have something else to ask you about though."

"Shoot."

"I'll shoot all right, it's a shot out of left field. All right, here goes. Tan, hypothetically could you like another girl as more than friends, and what would you do if another girl liked you, would you be completely against it?"

There was an awkward silence between them. "Cat, I need you to be dead serious right now. Is this a silly hypothetical situation, or are you talking about yourself?"

"I'm talking about a real situation. Yes, about myself."

And then Tandy started crying. This was shaping up to be a weird morning.

And then Tandy said the last thing Cat was expecting. "I didn't think it was possible, I had already given up hope and didn't know how to bring it up, and didn't think I had a chance in hell, what with you just being so into Alex, Alex this, Alex that. But yes! I LOVE YOU TOO!"

Tandy then gave a further shocked Cat a quick peck on the lips, and shouted back "we'll talk later!" and ran from the room all excited. Well, that was two.

Not knowing what to do about the increasingly complicated situation, after 5 minutes, without warning, Alex walked back in through the door.

"Alex!" Cat gasped.

"Listen Cat, just listen. Let me say, I was wrong. I've given it some thought, and I was too quick to judge. Here you've been going through this scary thing, of course you would feel like you need to hide it from everyone. Anyone would try to hide it. And you know what?" Alex got closer to Cat, and stole a kiss, right on her mouth. Not a deep, passionate one like Marlene, or a quick peck like Tandy, but a normal no-tongues medium level one. Cat was frozen in place by this. "I love you! I've got to go, but we'll talk about it all later." He trotted out of the room, leaving Cat once again in stunned silence.

Depending on how she looked at it, this was either a very good day for Cat, or a very bad one.
1521111111111111111111112111111111.title: Love blossoming in unexpected places

152111111111111111111111211111112.content:
"Oi, Jamie. Be a good little girl and go upstairs until lunch's ready, eh?" Shooed Aunt Caria.

Jamie had been up to her usual shenanigans in the old Italian restaurant. Alex had asked Caria to babysit her while he was out at the Anime Con. Of course, Aunt Caria jumped at the chance to spend more time with the young pickpocket. But even she was starting to have her limits of how much she could stand.

Anything that was somewhat valuable in the building was now either broken or at least cracked. Sure Caria didn't own much, but Jamie was proving to be a handful for the old tired woman.

"Okay, Aunt Caria!" Replied Jamie sweetly, perfectly masking the destructible demon within.

With that, the little girl stampeded her way up the stairs in the hole of the ceiling. The fancy table from when Alex and Cat were on their "date" had long been moved out, and the painting had been hidden so Jamie couldn't get at them.

To save herself from utter boredom, Jamie had brought several dolls from home which she happily took out of her backpack and began playing with. While she merrily hummed to herself, she failed to notice a dark figure slowly approaching the bay window; someone was climbing on the ledge just outside.

The man gently tapped the window to get Jamie's attention. She looked up and giggled slightly. The pale young man gestured to open the window, which Jamie happily obliged to.

"Heya mister!" She yelled with a toothless grin. "What'cha doing out here?"

The man answered in a monotone voice. "Just going for a climb. You seem bored little girl, would you care to join me?"

~

"Huh." Muttered Caria to herself as she started kneading some pizza dough. "Kid's been quiet for almost fifteen minutes..."

With an experienced flair, she tossed the slimy dough into the air and promptly caught it before it hit the ground. A knock on the door suddenly got her attention and she yelled to the guest.

"Sorry! Come on in! My hands are full at the moment!"

"Certainly..." Replied a voice as the door was suddenly kicked opened.

Two men in trench coats clomped into the room, one much taller than the other. The smaller one spoke up, removing the fedora covering his eyes.

"Evening, Aunt Caria..."

Instantly, Caria dropped the pizza dough on the floor as her eyes opened up with a hint of fear.

"M-Maxwell...!"

"I take it you're surprised to see me out of the asylum then...How's Alex doing?"

Caria slowly backed up to the counter where several sharpened knives were placed. "You have a lot of nerve showing up here of all places! Get outta here before I call the cops!"

She slowly reached for the closest knife behind her back. Maxwell caught onto her plot and pulled out a pistol from his trench coat, aiming it directly at Caria's head.

"Not another move. I'd rather not kill you, call it a weakness..."

She glared right at him. "You didn't seem to have trouble killing your parents..."

"That was different...Something you or my brother wouldn't understand. Besides, there's nothing you can do to stop us anyway."

Caria suddenly remembered that Jamie was upstairs, she'd just have to distract him long enough...Maybe Jamie would be able to get away.

"I remember when I caught you boys trying to rob in the middle of the night...You sure have changed for the worse, at least Alex had the sense to give up that life." She spat.

"Indeed. He could never do what needed to be done. But I didn't come here to chat Aunt Caria. In fact I already have what I really came here for."

A shudder of fear ran down her spine. "J-Jamie?"

"In the van, playing with her dolls." Smiled Maxwell. "She reminds me of Alex when he was younger, so naive and carefree. Actually there's only one reason I'm even talking to you."

"And what's that!?" Snarled Caria.

Maxwell aimed his gun right at Caria's lower stomach and fired. She doubted over, cursing in pain and fell on the ground. Blood was everywhere.

"I-I thought you said you weren't going to k-kill me!?"

"I didn't hit anything vital, you'll live for a few hours. But with a broken spine, I don't think you'll be getting up anytime soon." The look in Maxwell's eyes changed to a serious glare. "Now you're going to tell Alex something or I really will kill you..."

He bent over the bleeding woman and grabbed her by the throat.

~

"Are we through with your chores?" Asked Jonny Vale as the two drove down the street in their stolen police van.

"Yes, thank you for your assistance. You're free to do whatever you wish now."

"Mmm, I'll take my chances with you. I have a feeling if I stick around, I'll be able to get my own revenge. I'd just rather not spend my time kidnapping little girls, who is she anyway?" Asked Vale, staring in the back at Jamie who continued to play with her dolls.

"My sister..."

"Heh." Chuckled Vale, gently rubbing his scar. "Sounds like a little family feud."

"Something like that..."
152111111111111111111111211111112.title: A Cheerful Visit...

1521111111111111111111112111111121.content:
In little under an hour, the entire convention had been emptied out and the police proceeded to scout through the entire building. Many of the celebrities there received armed escorts on helicopters while the rest of the attendees were gathered out in front with the local SWAT team. They were all waiting on either the all clear or a formal dismal of the convention.

Cat and the others picked a shady spot under the tree, it had gotten awfully hot over the day. Tandy was busy playing with Cat's tail, much to her annoyance, while Marlene sat as far away from the girls as possible. Alex stood arms crossed brooding. He hadn't said a word to anyone since he and Cat had their "encounter" under the bleachers.

All of a sudden a short bald police officer stood in front of the crowd with a megaphone.

"Attention! Due to the possible threat of any escaping convicts, we regret to inform you all that this convention will have to be closed until said escapees are caught." He was greeted with several 'Awws' from the groups. "We're sorry, it's just too dangerous to have a mass of people here while some killers are on the loose. We're ordering cabs to take people home free of charge. Thank you."

The officer put down the device and sighed, turning to a taller and thinner blond officer.

"How's Jackson doing?"

The policeman replied with a forced smile. "Well, he just woke up chief. But he doesn't remember anything about where they may be going. Says that the mental patient was able to pin him down and kill Frank."

The chief spat. "Pah. I don't buy that. That kid was a stick, there's no way he'd be able to take out a trained officer with no problems."

The chief then crossed his arms and thought for a second. "We evacuated town hall and the shopping mall. This convention was the last place we would think they could be. And this kid...What's his name again, Smithson?"

"Maxwell sir, Maxwell Lenard." Smithson handed the chief a clipboard.

"Huh, killed his parents when he was a kid...But still I doubt he's the one behind this. That other guy, Jonny Vale...He was a gorilla. Killed someone as well a week ago. He's definitely behind this, I don't care what Jackson says."

The chief looked up from the papers. "Did either of them have any family members?"

"Err...Vale had a wife, but she's in the hospital for some serious injuries. We have a unit protecting her. As for Maxwell...This might interest you sir. He had a brother and sister. In fact, his brother is at this convention according to the registry."

"Oh? Well that certainly IS interesting..."

~

Tandy had been complaining nonstop since the announcement.

"Figures! We get into Anime Con and then some freaking psychopaths break out of prison and then they close it!"

Cat grabbed her ears. "Tan...You mind not yelling so loud?"

"Seriously, you're giving me a headache." Added Marlene. "It's just a stupid convention, what's the big deal?"

Oh boy. Those were fighting words for Tandy. She immediately exploded. "It's not a stupid convention! You saw how many people were there! That's the biggest thing for anime lovers for the whole year!"

"Girls, come on now..." Said Alex, with a slightly less happy tone of voice than usual. "Let's just get into the cab and go home..."

A free yellow cab pulled up to the side of the street to take the group home, but before they could even enter the car the bald officer who announced the convention closing walked up to them. He gestured to Alex.

"Hello there, you wouldn't happen to be Alex Lenard would you?"

"You!" Shouted Tandy, she nearly charged at the man. Cat had to hold her back. "You're the one who closed the convention! I'll kill you! I'll-"

Everyone sighed but the policeman sighed, they just stared at the insane goth girl screaming at them. Alex finally answered "Yeah, I am. What about it?"

"Apologizes sir, but we've been asked to escort you and your party home for extra protection."

Alex blinked several times. "Extra protection? Wha-"

"We're not supposed to answer any questions sir. We'll be tailing your taxi and following you to make sure you make it home safely."

Alex just shrugged. "Well that's alright I guess, better safe than sorry. Right?"

~

The ride home was uneventful, Alex was still lost and thought while Tandy continued to complain about the convention's closing. And of course, no car ride would be complete without Marlene glaring at Cat the entire time.

Truth to be told, Cat was glad she was going home now anyway. Despite a lot of good stuff happening, the convention had ended in mostly disappointment. Cat couldn't stop thinking about what had happened under the bleachers. What if she really had gone through with it. And more importantly, why didn't she kiss him?

The policemen were following the cab closely behind, but no one in the car gave them much thought. Cat assumed that maybe they were escorting them because they had won the dance contest, but that really didn't make any sense.

Oh well. No sense in letting it trouble her, there was already enough on Cat's mind.

Alex needed to make a stop at Aunt Caria's restaurant to pick up Jamie. As the cab rolled to a stop, the police car behind them pulled over too.

The bald man tapped on the window. "I'd like to follow you in, if you don't mind son."

"Not at all." Replied Alex as he stepped out of the car.

Cat watched as both of them slowly walked up to the door and disappeared inside. Yesterday night she had even gone on a supposed date with Alex. Why'd she chicken out on kissing him? It just didn't make sense.

The door to the restaurant then kicked open. The bald man ran out with a very distressed and concerned look on his face. He was yelling something to the officer still in the police car. Car could barely make it out.

"Shit! Smithson! Call an ambulance! Call a goddamn ambulance! The owner has been shot!"
1521111111111111111111112111111121.title: The Finding.

choices: Marlene caves and lets her in.
Marlene refuses, Cat goes exploring around the hospital more.
15211111111111111111111121111111211.content:
Cat played the past hour over and over in her head. After the police officer, who had apparently been the police chief, had found Aunt Caria lying unconscious and shot on the floor of her restaurant, an ambulance was called and all four of them were forced to head straight to the emergency room with the poor woman.

Thankfully, the gunshot was not a mortal wound though Caria did almost bleed to death. The bullet had entered through her lower stomach and shattered her lower spine. Doctors had been working ceaselessly in the ER to mend Caria's spine to the best of their abilities. However, Cat and the others had had from passing surgeons that the chance of improvement was grimly low.

Cat's parents had been called and Tandy had already texted her dad so that they wouldn't worry as to where they were. Alex had been spending his time sitting next to Caria nonstop, Marlene had seemingly vanished after the group checked in at the hospital. Outside the building, dozens of newscasts were clawing over each other to get the latest scoop on the attempted murder. The police chief and the officer called Smithson promised that the cameras and press wouldn't bother the group and barricaded the waiting room.

Jamie was no where to be found at the scene of the crime, though the police hadn't announced it publicly she had indeed been kidnapped. Alex did not take the news well and created a giant hole in the wall of Caria's restaurant after the police had searched the place. He didn't say a word on the ambulance ride over here.

And yet, Cat still couldn't shake the flashbacks of the "almost kiss" she had had with Alex not two hours ago.

Tandy huffed and flipped her phone closed. "No reply. Dad must be in a meeting."

Cat frowned slightly. "How could he not know about those killers lose? I mean the entire city has to know by now?"

The goth just laughed slightly. "He's just doing business..."

Cat could almost hear in mind Tandy add "Like always" to the end of the sentence, but sensing an uncomfortable topic of conversation she decided to quickly change the subject.

"So...Um...You know where Marlene went?"

"Nope. Lost her after we sat down here."

"Hmm...That's odd..."

"Tell me about it, you'd think a girl like her would use an opportunity like this to comfort Alex and get close. In fact I'm surprised you're not in there with him now."

Cat blushed slightly. "I...I just want to give him some space. Aunt Caria was a really important person to him, I don't want to bother him at a time like this. Plus with his little sister kidnapped..."

"Heh, that's probably a good idea. I mean the way he was cursing and screaming when they dragged him out of the restaurant. Your boyfriend has quite the colorful vocabulary."

"Tandy..."

She grinned. "Just trying to lighten the mood a bit Cat. So what do you want to do?"

"I don't know. Find Marlene?"

~

Cat always hated hospitals. Not because she was a sadist or misanthrope, she thought it was wonderful what people were willing to do to save other people's lives. It was the smell that got to her. Sickness, depression, death all wrapped up into one foul odor that permeated the walls. Having a high power nose didn't help with this at all either.

All around them were people in wheel chairs getting rolled around by nurses or stiff walking patients in hospital gowns. It depressed Cat that some of them were kids her own age.

Tandy pulled aside a mid aged looking nurse with brown hair for some information.

"Excuse me, miss? You see a girl about our age walk by in Team Rocket Jesse costume?"

The woman blinked several times. "A what?"

Sighing, Tandy tried to explain it better. "Long red hair waxed to the side with a white and black outfit with a ridiculous looking red 'R' on the chest."

"Oh...Uh, I believe I saw some girl dressed like that head over to room 218."

"Thank you."

Tandy motioned to Cat. "Come on, this way."

Again, they continued walking through the sick smelling hallway. The stares Cat was getting made her feel more and more uncomfortable. Tandy had been kind enough to keep her own costume on to relieve some of the tension.

"Wonder why Miss.Bitchy decided to explore the hospital on her own."

~

Marlene awkwardly fidgeted around on her feet, eying the person who appeared asleep on the hospital bed in front of her. It was a woman, probably in her 50's. She had a thinning head of hair, red as Marlene's.

"Hey mom..." Said Marlene, a tone of discomfort in her voice.

Her mother didn't answer. She didn't even move to react.

"How are you doing? I haven't seen you in awhile..."

Again, no response. Marlene turned her eyes over to the flowers on the stand next to the bed. They were once beautiful red roses. Now they had withered into an ugly brown corpse.

"Dad says to say....Hi....He's been doing well in business. Still sends a check every week..."

Marlene took a good look at her mother's face. In a way, it looked like a mummy's. Dried up, withered, forgotten. Just like the flowers next her bed. All except her eyes, which were the same faded blue/gray color Marlene always remembered them being.

"Sandy and Zack are doing fine...Both of them are all grown up and healthy now. Isn't that something? Seems like yesterday when you, me, and dad went to get them at the farm."

Marlene laughed slightly. She hated her mother's eyes. They always had the same look of disappointment on them. It was even worse when she looked at Marlene. Thankfully today she was either too lazy or too weak to look at her. Marlene could never tell.

"I'm here because...Well...Actually it's a funny story. One of my friends, well okay he's more then a friend, guardian got shot. She's actually over in the other end of the hospital. She got shot by some escaped convict, you hear about that at all on the TV?"

Looking at the big black screen and judging by the dust surrounding it, Marlene could wager it hadn't been touched in months.

"I guess not, well. It's really exciting out there. Maybe when you get better we can go take a walk through the park like we used to. Sandy and Zack probably won't even recognize you."

The silence in the room was deafening. Marlene just wanted to say she missed her mom. Say that she missed her and wanted her to come home. The doctor said the illness was all in her head, but she still couldn't snap out of it. Not since dad left her.

Suddenly, there was a knock on the door.

~

"You sure this is the right door?" Asked Cat.

"Yep, room 218. See? Says here it belongs to Mrs. Wolfe. Wonder what that's about?"

Maybe it was the smell of the hospital again, but Cat really didn't want to go into the room. She felt a little sick to her stomach as the door opened a crack. A familiar angry eye looked down at the two girls.

"What do you want?" Asked Marlene, somewhat annoyed.

"Nothing. Just came to see your cheery face Marlene." Replied Tandy with a stupid grin.

"Go away."

"Hey, we came to find where you were. You don't have to be so angry Marlene-"

Cat interrupted Tandy. "Tan, please. That's enough. Are you alright in there Marlene?"

"I'm fine. Now, please, go away. I'll go back to the waiting room when I finish with some stuff here."

Cat frowned slightly. "Are you sur-"

"Yes! Please!"

Cats ears drooped slightly. Marlene wasn't angry with Cat this time, she recognized that tone after an entire year of dealing with her bullying. Something else was bothering her.

"Tandy, you mind waiting back at the waiting room?"

"What? You sure Cat?"

"Yeah."

Shrugging Tandy headed back. "Okay, boss. See you back there."

Cat waited until Tandy was far enough down the hallway to not hear them. "Come on Marlene, what's wrong? Tan's gone. It'd just be the two of us, can you let me in?"
15211111111111111111111121111111211.title: The ER.

152111111111111111111111211111112111.content:
"For the last time Cat-girl, go away." Replied Marlene as she proceeded to slam the door shut.

Reacting quickly, Cat stomped her foot in the door and painfully caught it before it completely closed. She bit lip to prevent herself from yelping, clearly Marlene did not want her to be there. Still she persisted on asking.

"Why don't you want to talk Marlene? I promise I won't make fun of you. Who's in this room?"

"Like I'd want to talk to you."

"I'm not leaving until you let me in."

"Cat...Why the hell are you being so difficult? You're the last person I want to talk about this with, or have you forgotten our relationship already?"

Memories of all the pranks Marlene had done to her over the year pinged through Cat's head. From the simple unscrewing the salt shaker to stuffing her locker with porn magazines. She had done everything in her power to make the Freshman year in high school so very difficult for Cat. Yet, strangely enough, despite all that Cat felt an odd attachment to Marlene.

"Now do you get it?" Choked Marlene, Cat could tell she had started to cry slightly. "Just go away...Please..."

"I get it...But I want to help you Marlene..."

Even though Cat was looking at a plain white door with a sign on it, she felt as if she was looking directly into the ginger girl's eyes.

"I remember all that...High school so far has been terrible...You did your share to make it hard for me, but...I just can't explain it, I don't hate you for it. Not now at least....I want to help you..."

Cat continued to stare through the door, wondering the sort of reaction Marlene had to that statement. She wasn't like Tandy, who Cat could read like a book.

The door opened, taking Cat by surprise. She was greeted by Marlene's real face, tear stained but somewhat relieved looking.

"You're...so...stubborn...Have it your way."

~

Alex had been sitting in the same spot for what felt like hours. Had it been hours? Maybe it had been a day. The hunger in his stomach seem to support that motion. He had just been sitting there, looking at Aunt Caria slowly breathing with the slow beeps of the heart monitor being the only thing to let him know time hadn't frozen.

The doctors said there was probably no way Caria would be able to walk again. Maybe it was being selfish, but wasn't Caria who was on Alex's mind right now. At least she was alive, after the last time his brother had aimed a gun at someone...

Alex felt himself closing his eyes. A strong and clear memory came into the focus of his mind's eye.

~

He was six again. Maxwell was with him too, he, however, was eight. They were doing their usual nightly ritual of robbing the riches of the upper class homes, it had to be only eight at night. The home they were in almost seemed like a palace compared to the rundown shop he and his brother were forced to live with their "parents".

The family of the home were gathered around the television, they were happily watching the Disney movie Aladdin. Alex had never seen a movie before, at least not the colorful animations of a Disney movie. Naturally, being six he was enraptured by the movie much to the annoyance of his brother.

Maxwell continually tried to pry his brother away from watching the television over the balcony, whispering that they had to leave before the family noticed them. But eventually, he too sat down and watched the show. They sat there for a good hour until the father of the family sat up to go to the bathroom. Of course, he saw the two boys leering upstairs at the family and yelled something angrily at them and grabbed a nearby weapon to chase them. They barely got out with any swag from the home at all.

Maxwell yelled at Alex and smacked over the head for getting them into trouble, but Alex was quickly able to avoid a blown out fist fight by changing the subject back to the movie. That movie was the first Disney movie for both boys after all. They stayed up all night discussing the rare treat the night of thievery had given them.

Max loved Aladdin, saying that he was brave and strong, exactly what he wanted to grow up to be. Alex had to admit Aladdin was cool, but the character he liked the most was Jasmine. Sure, she was beautiful and all that, but there was something that drew him to her. She lived a life of riches and wonders, everything Alex and Maxwell aspired to be, and yet she felt trapped.

That word, trapped, continually played through Alex's head the whole night. How could someone like that feel trapped? She was a princess, she should love the life she had. But, when Alex looked at her eyes in the movie, he could tell she wasn't exaggerating. She had the same eyes he had every morning when he looked in the mirror. Eyes that were trapped in a world beyond their control. Alex loved those eyes. They were strong eyes. Eyes that could persevere. Eyes that could rise above the world around them.

Of course, Max hit him over the head for liking the princess of the movie.

~

Another memory flashed into Alex's head.

He was recalling the first day of high school. It was a beautiful and sunny day out in the bleacher where the principle was welcoming all the new students with the traditional speech. There had to be a total of a thousand people on the field, students and teachers alike. All the kids were nervous about starting their high school career, Alex couldn't lie that he was nervous as well.

After about an hour, the speech ended and the students were all excused to start their first class of the semester. That's when she slipped and feel over the bleacher. Alex could recognize her features immediately.

She was wearing a large over sized black t-shirt with some anime characters on it. Instead of pants, she had a large black skirt which had caught the edge of the bleachers and ripped. The most distinguished feature she had was a mess of medium length dyed orange hair that gleamed in the sunlight.

The poor girl's skirt had been torn in half, when she landed she literally mooned the entire Freshman class. Everyone exploded in laughter, except Alex.

He and a few other teachers went over to help the girl up as the Freshman class continued to pound the bleachers laughing. In truth, Alex had expected the girl to be crying. After all, mooning everyone on the first day of class probably had to be the worst, he couldn't even imagine it.

But instead, as he gave her his hand to help her up, he saw that she was laughing herself. There wasn't a tear in her eye. That's when it hit him, they were the same eyes as Jasmines. The same strong beautiful eyes.
152111111111111111111111211111112111.title: The ER: Part 2.

1521111111111111111111112111111121111.content:
"They just left her there." Said Maxwell as he looked over the basket their parents had left in the middle of the rundown shop.

The two boys, both a year older now, were puzzled at what exactly they should do with their new "gift". Their parents had left them with a newborn child, she was completely naked and rolling around in the dirty clothes that covered her, giggling.

Max said something that finding food was getting hard enough, feeding another mouth would be too difficult. But Alex intervened, saying that he was acting no better then their parents. Truth was, they were both scared. No child at their age should have had to deal with the responsibilities of taking care of a younger sibling. But their parents were nowhere to be found, as usual. They were probably out begging on the street corners.

Alex volunteered to take care of the little girl, Max responded better then expected. He said that Alex would have to pay for food from his own stolen stash. Alex shrugged and picked up the happy bundle of joy as she playful pulled at his hair. He took a good look at her.

At first he wanted to name her Jasmine, but then he realized he couldn't even spell her name. So he compromised with the closest name he could spell, Jamie.

~

Alex was picking up Jamie from the hospital, his sister had decided to try tree climbing again and broke her leg. Currently, he was waiting in line for insurance information as Jamie playing doodled over the hard exo-skeleton.

A girl his age stepped up behind him, she had a beautiful head of red hair. What was odd was she looked like she had been crying. Being kind Alex asked her.

"Is everything alright?"

~

High school had been gone by reasonably well. Alex had made plenty of new friends and even started dating a girl named Marlene that he had met at the hospital. Everyone seemed to know who he was, even the upper classmen. Needless to say, he was enjoying himself so far though one thing bothered him. He never got to really talk to that girl who had fallen off the bleachers in the beginning of the year, despite really wanting to. He did know her name though, Catherine Hill. Or Cat as she was called around her friends.

It was between periods and Alex had asked to step out of class to go to the bathroom. As he passed the main office and the phone booths outside them, he heard a strange noise. It sounded almost like crying. He looked at the booth and saw that it was Cat who was crying.

Cat, the girl who mooned the entire class and laughed about it. Cat, the girl he never worked up the courage to talk to. Her strong and beautiful eyes were now filled with tears.

Alex wanted to do nothing more then to open the door and comfort her. He too had felt trapped in an inescapable world, but he had freed himself. He wanted to hug her and tell her everything was going to be alright. He wanted to make her stop crying. But he was too much of a coward.

He merely knocked on the door, and Cat looked up at him with her big beautiful eyes.

~

As Alex continued to sit there in the hospital over Aunt Caria, he grabbed a handful of his hair. He wanted to think about Cat, but whenever he did he started thinking about Jamie. And whenever he thought about Jamie, he started to think about Cat.

What the hell was wrong with him? Why did he feel this way?

But the biggest question he asked himself was why did Maxwell kidnap Jamie? Was he really that cruel? What was he going to do to her? The very thought sickened Alex.

Suddenly, as if his questions were answered by an angel Aunt Caria stirred from her sleep. She blinked her eyes open slowly and looked at Alex.

"Alex...Maxwell t-told to t-tell you something..."
1521111111111111111111112111111121111.title: The ER: Part 3.

15211111111111111111111121111111211111.content:
Time ticked away like sands in an hourglass. The darkened hospital room housing Mrs.Wolfe was only a slight upgrade to the noisy and depressing outside halls. Still, everywhere Cat looked, she found a crevice or an object filled with pain and tears of the past. It was like everything in the room had been frozen in time, dust covered and stained with bile. Marlene lead her over to a table next to the bed with flowers on it; the flowers in the pot were withered and decayed.

Cat felt the urge to look over at who was sleeping in the bed. Whoever they were, they gave no real sign of life. Even though the tickling curiosity inside her head begged her to take a peak, she fought the desire and quietly sat down with her legs crossed.

"I'm going to go to the bathroom." Said Marlene as she wiped her nose.

Cat gave a forced smiled and nodded, turning her attention to the flowers on the table. She waited until she heard the room door open and close before reaching out to touch the petals. One of the leaves fluttered off the stem and into the water pitcher, dead and rotted.

Sighing, Cat stared absentmindedly at the ceiling instead. She was still trying desperately to not gawk at the woman in the bed, who she was assuming was Marlene's mother. So she distracted herself by counting the ceiling panels. Then all of a sudden.

"Who....You..." Muttered a weak voice coming from the bed.

Cat blinked several times and looked down. The woman on the bed was staring right at her, a look of sadness in her gray eyes. Judging by the slight twitch in her face, it was a strain for her to even look in Cat's direction.

Immediately, Cat stood up. "O-oh! Please! Don't hurt yourself madam! Sorry, I didn't even know you were awake!"

The woman gave a hacking noise which sounded somewhat like a cough. Her voice sounded like a dozen bull frogs croaking at once.

"Oh...Don't mind me child...It would be...Impolite to not at least look my guest in the eyes..."

"I-If you're sure...I don't mean to be a bother..."

"No. Not at all...It's nice to have...Visitors for once..."

Cat scanned around the room again. Nearly everything had been untouched, it looked like not even the nurses bothered to visit the room. The image of the flower petal dropping into the pitcher flashed into Cat's mind.

"...So.You're Marlene's mother. Right?"

"Yes...You must be one of her...Friends, yes?"

Cat paused for a moment. "Well...Yeah, we're...Friends."

Marlene's mother's withered face smiled for what seemed to be the first time in a good while, all the wrinkles from smiling that had nearly disappeared on her face instantly showed themselves again.

"It's good...I'm happy...That she has a normal...Life...At least..."

"Normal life...?"

The woman frowned. "She...never told you.?..."

Cat realized the carelessness of her statement and tried to retract it. "S-sorry! I didn't mean to-!"

"Heh...No...It's alright child...Marlene's a good girl...She tried to...Get me up on my feet after...Well that doesn't matter..."

"I u-understand madam, please! I'm sorry! I didn't want to bring up something painful like that!"

Marlene's mother laughed slightly, though it sounded like a cough. "She's a good girl...Marlene...Always used to visit me..."

Cat raised her eyebrow slightly.

"Sorry..." Replied Marlene's mother. "It's rude of me...To start talking about this to you...Sorry...I didn't catch the name..."

"It's Cat. Well actually, it's Catherine. But my friends all call me Cat. And, I don't mind listening. Please, go ahead."

Marlene's mother smiled again. "You have...No idea how lonely...You get with yourself here...How there's no one to listen to you...No way to get what's on your mind out...Bless you, Catherine...Bless you..."

She sighed. "I know...The way I worded it...It must have sounded like...Marlene stopped visiting out of embarrassment...No...I told her to stop coming...Told her to move on with her...Life...Told her to never come back..."

"But, why?"

"Because...She couldn't spend her life...Waiting for me to sort out my own..."

Cranking her head slowly up, Marlene's mother continued. "My husband...Left me awhile back...Never said why...Broke my heart...Marlene was just ten then...She didn't understand either...I got sick...Couldn't get out of bed..."

"I'm an...Old woman now...I should be spending my time...Here in the hospital...It's best if everyone just forgot about me..."

Before she could catch herself, Cat uttered the words. "You're wrong."

"...Beg your pardon?"

Shocked by her own outburst, Cat tried to mend everything as best as she could. "I...I...I mean...Marlene had mentioned you..."

She looked at Marlene's mother, judging her reaction. "She...misses you..."

There was no reaction still, just silence. Cat couldn't get a proper understanding at what was going through the older woman's head, possibly due to her own lack of maturity. But before Marlene's mother could get a response out, Marlene herself opened the room door.

"Alright Cat. What did you want?"

Marlene had cleaned herself up well enough, though her eyes were still a little red. Cat yelped slightly as she realized she was still standing up, quickly she sat back down.

"W-well...Marlene...It looked like you wanted to talk was all..."

Arms crossed, Marlene walked over to the other chair on the table and sat down. She never stopped facing Cat the entire time. "And?"

Cat looked at her right in the eye. "Don't you..?"

"I...Might..."

She sighed once and closed her eyes longer then a typical blink.

"I don't want to see you around Alex again Cat."

"I totally agree with you..."

Marlene opened her eyes in shock.

"What?"

"I...I agree with you...I was acting like an idiot. You guys are boyfriend and girlfriend, while I'm...I just don't think it's fair for me to come between you two. I was acting like a complete idiot...And I'm sorry."

Marlene was still processing what Cat had just said. It was like nothing she had spoken had any sense at all. The natural order had been disturbed. Was Cat lying? But there was a distinct tone of seriousness in her voice.

"And I...I'm sorry too."

Now it was Cat's turn to act surprised.

"I know words like that mean nothing after the entirety of freshman year, but I'm sorry for all the pranks. I guess I was just..."

Marlene paused but couldn't finish the words to end the sentence. They were like poison on her tongue. There was a growing silence between the two girls, but each of them seemed to have a deeper appreciation of each other. It was almost like...They had become friends.

"Well..." Spoke up Cat. "Wow...I-I mean...Thanks Marlene."

"Yeah..." Said Marlene as she stood up. "There is one more thing though..."

Without any warning, Marlene reached for the top of Cat's head and tugged hard on one of her cat ears. Cat yelled painfully but covered her mouth only just realizing that she had given herself away. Marlene grinned.

"Heh. I knew it."

Panicking now, Cat dropped to her knees holding both of her ears. "I-It's just glued on! They aren't real! I swear! Oh, please tell don't anyone Marlene! Please-"

"Relax. I just wanted to know for sure. I won't tell anyone. I promise. I was just curious was all."

"How...How did you even know!?"

"Oh, I was eavesdropping on a conversation between you and Tandy at the convention. It wasn't hard to put two and two together."

Cat grimaced slightly, shuddering at just how quickly and easily her furry secret got revealed. "You won't tell anyone...?"

"I told you already...I promise...Now get off the floor, it's embarrassing."

Cat quickly obeyed, slowly relaxing her grip on her ears. Marlene's wasn't lying. As the flower petals in the jar on the table wilted away, they revealed a single living rose in the center of the arrangement. Still lush and beautiful.

"I...I....Thank you...Marlene...Thank you."

She just grinned. "Well, I think we're done trading apologizes for the day. Want to go back to the waiting room?"

"S-sure..."

But before either of them could make it to the door, it was suddenly pounded by an array of violent knocks. Tandy's voice on the other side called out to the girls.

"Cat! Get out here! It's Alex! He's gone!"
15211111111111111111111121111111211111.title: Of Flowers and Friends.

152111111111111111111111211111112111111.content:
It had been a simple matter of tying several of Aunt Caria's unused bedsheets together and climbing out the five story window of the hospital emergency wing for Alex to evade the patrolling policemen. For a normal person such a feat would seem insane, but for Alex...Some habits died hard. Particularly habits he'd much rather forget about.

Still, his days of thieving had proved handy over the years. He and his brother had been quite the little acrobats back in their youth. His brother...

Alex paused as he crouched low in the bushes to avoid two chatting policemen. He was recollecting his thoughts on what exactly Caria had told him just moments ago.

"...He wants to...Meet with you...Alex! Talk with you...!" Coughed Aunt Caria.

"Wh-What!?" Yelled Alex. "That bastard kidnaps Jamie and expects to just talk about it!? What did he say about Jamie!? Did he say where he was taking her!?"

Caria blinked away a few tears. "N-no...He just said to meet in the usual place by midnight tonight...S-said that she'd be fine so long as you complied..."

Alex slammed his fist onto the table next to the bed. "The bastard...!"

The usual spot...The usual spot...There was only one real usual spot that the two brother shared. Home, or rather what had once been their home. The little rundown shop on the corner of the downtown main street. It was the very place they had wanted to escape as kids, funny that they would meet there of all places.

The two policemen turned and continued on their patrol around the hospital. Alex bolted for the street.

~

Both Cat and Marlene ripped the door open, shouting at Tandy at the same time.

"What!? He's gone!?"

They looked each other, both girls had a mixture of pain and deep concern on their face. Marlene crossed her arms while Cat put a hand to her head. Cat was the first to speak again.

"Where...Where did he go Tandy? Did they say?"

"No...The officers just entered the room and he was gone! No notes, nothing. That woman that was shot, Caria, isn't telling the police anything!"

Marlene gritted her teeth. "This isn't good...He's probably going after Jamie."

"Yeah, you're probably right..." Muttered Cat. She looked down at her feet.

"Well...Don't just stand there you two!" Yelled Tandy. "Come on! We got to catch him! Isn't there something we can do to stop him!? He's going to get himself killed!"

Marlene shook her head. "No. When something involves his little sister, Alex goes into complete protection mode. There's no stopping him, that's why it doesn't surprise me that he was able to get past the police."

Turning to Cat, she smirked slightly. "Remember just a few days ago when you 'found' Jamie under your bed? Alex nearly broke some delinquent's hand off while looking for her."

But Cat didn't seem to think the joke was funny. "Marlene, this is serious. He's going after an escaped serial killer!"

"Yes, I know that..."

"So Tandy's right! We need to stop him somehow!"

"And what exactly do you plan on doing? He was able to get past a bunch of police officers and escape the fifth story of a hospital completely undetected."

Marlene turned away from the other two girls and faced her mother's bed. Her mother seemed to be asleep.

"...You think you can stop him, but you really don't know the first thing about him. Do you?"

Frowning, Cat lowered her head, almost bowing to Marlene. Tandy, on the other hand, nearly went berserk.

"And just what do YOU know about him that makes you so-!"

"Tandy!" Interrupted Cat. "That's enough."

Her goth friend opened her eyes slightly in surprise, but quietly closed her mouth refraining from yelling. Cat looked up at Marlene with a serious look on her face like a child confessing that she had broken her mother's favorite vase.

"...What are we supposed to do then, Marlene?"

"In truth? I don't know. But I will tell you this, Alex won't accept any help. If he had wanted help, he'd have told one of us about it. He doesn't want to get you or me involved with this."

"So...We wait?"

Marlene nodded. "His sister means the world to him. I trust Alex, he'll be fine."

"What do you mean just wait!? He could get killed out there and-!" Yelled Tandy.

"Tandy please..." Whispered Cat. "If you think that's what we should do Marlene then..."

All eyes were on Cat now. She took a deep breath and finished her decision.

"...Then I trust you."

There could not have been two more opposite reactions; Tandy's jaw was hanging on a hinge while Marlene smiled at Cat with respect and gratitude. Cat was actually trusting Marlene.

"Let's speak to the police chief and get a ride home..."

Tandy tried to piece together some sort of comeback to this shocking change of events, thinking of nothing she slumped her shoulders and followed Cat down the hallway. Marlene lingered in her mother's hospital room, still smiling yet somewhat depressed. She sighed and took a look at her mother before turning to leave.

"...You have good friends, dear." Came a voice from inside the room.

Marlene's eye shot open, she turned to look at her mother. She was pretending to still be asleep, snoring slightly. Marlene smiled again.

~

Alex had been waiting in the old shop for hours now, he checked his watch. It was five minutes to midnight. He huffed to himself, time went fast when a lot was on your mind.

Though he had been there awhile, he hadn't given himself the chance to look around much. Everything was exactly the same as when they left it, if only more damaged and dusty. In the back room of the store were still the three cots he and his siblings would use to sleep on, they were probably moth ridden now judging by the overall disrepair of the place. Anything of value had long since been cleaned out by themselves and any other homeless person who came in over the years looking for shelter.

With time to still kill, Alex sighed and stood up to take a look at one spot of the shop. His parent's room. During his childhood, they had inhabited the changing rooms of the store, though the doors were all ripped off the hinges now. His parents had cleared out all the stalls to make room for a thrown out queen sized mattress which laid on the floor.

Even though their room was only ten feet away from his back in the day, Alex and his brother never went in there. Thinking about it, this was probably only his third time standing in here. And the last time he was in here...Well...A big red stain on the floor next to the mattress explained what had happened then. Alex shuddered.

"Feeling sentimental?" Came a chilling monotone voice from behind him.

Alex glared at the darkness of the store. There was someone about his size standing in the shadows with a trench coat and old fashion hat on. He knew immediately who it was by his voice.

"Where's Jamie!?"

"Is that anyway to speak to your brother after years of him being in a mental institution?"

Alex rolled up the sleeves of his Kenshin costume. "Don't play games with me Max! Where. Is. She!?"

"Still the vigilant older brother...She's fine my dear sibling, you'd think I'd mistreat her after we went through so much effort to protect her from our abusive guardians? Give me more credit then that."

Maxwell shifted along the debris of dirt and bricks. "Jamie is safe and sound in our hideout. Waiting for you."

"Tell me where that is then." Alex cracked his knuckles.

"Don't act so tough little brother, we both know who would win in a fight."

Alex snapped and rushed at his brother. Maxwell gave no indication of stopping him as Alex grabbed him around the neck hole and shoved him into a nearby wall.

"...You." Finished Maxwell.

"...What?"

"I've spent the last few years lazing about in a correction facility with little exercise. You on the other hand have probably been training and practicing regularly."

Max smiled. "You're stronger then me, Alex."

"Then you'll tell me where she is..."

"Ah, well I wouldn't come here unarmed and alone without some sort of ace in the hole..."

"Max-!"

"You kill me and you never find where she is."

Alex growled but slowly loosened his grip. He released Maxwell's collar in a huff.

"Now then. I've actually come here to give you a warning mostly. You being my brother and all it only seems fair."

"What warning?" Spat Alex.

Maxwell grinned evilly. "Be prepared to suffer a fate worse then death."

"What!?"

But Maxwell just checked his own wristwatch. "Well then, it was nice to have a talk with you again brother. But we really must be going. Count on seeing me again soon."

Just then a larger man in a trench coat slammed the butt of a pistol into Alex's head. The Kenshin cosplayer collapsed on the ground, he completely blacked out.

Maxwell smacked the dust off his coat and waved a thank you hello to Jonny Vale. The giant of a man stepped over Alex and muttered.

"What exactly are you planning Leonard?"

"Revenge, my huge friend."
152111111111111111111111211111112111111.title: Brotherly Bonding.

choices: Alex is at school the next day.
Alex and Marlene are missing at school.
1521111111111111111111112111111121111111.content:
"Did we almost...You know..." Cat said to Alex, who was still in his Kenshin costume.

"...Kiss?" He asked.

Cat could feel her heartbeat quicken. "Y-yeah..."

Wait a moment. Hadn't she been here before? Where was she? Under the bleachers at the convention? It couldn't be, Cat remembered distinctly coming home to a dark empty house in the police patrol car and collapsing on her bed.

Alex was giving her that look again, he was going to try to kiss her soon. But for some reason Cat couldn't move on her own. Her body was acting on its own, the words that came out of her mouth were like the lyrics on a record player. Involuntarily, she brought her hand to her mouth.

"S-sorry...I shouldn't have a-asked...I-I mean..."

Like before, she attempted to return to the convention but Alex stopped her. "No...Wait."

This had to be a dream, another dream just like the ones before. After all, it didn't feel like the real thing. More like a movie, the way you'd expect to feel when your life flashed before your eyes.

Alex gently grabbed her hand and was pulling her in close.

"Alex..."

Now, Cat felt like she was in third person. That is to say, this was beginning to feel like an out of body experience. She wasn't looking at the moment through her eyes anymore, more like a camera lens just out of range. She could see all the little details of herself, her expressions and how she moved.

"Shhh." Whispered Alex as he got closer.

Something was different this time, her body wasn't pulling away. It was moving in closer as well. Cat focused on the point of contact between herself and Alex, the lips. They connected.

Half expecting some sort of fireworks to fire off in the background like in the movies, Cat turned away. She didn't want to see this, it felt embarrassing. The area around her began melt like it was made of soft warm clay. Even her body and Alex slowly began to dribble away into the floor below her. It formed a neat design of alternating black and white squares. Suddenly, Cat wasn't under the bleachers anymore at all. It was dark.

A bright spotlight shined off from in the distance at the floor, blinding Cat for a few brief seconds. Her eyes scanned the new area around her, it was just an endless void of the same black and white floor. Expect for one minor difference, there was a figure standing right in front of her.

Cat winced under the light which made just looking at the blur like staring into the sun.

"Who are you?"

The figure seemed to grin judging by how the light reflected off the area around its mouth.

"Isn't it obvious by now?"

All these dreams, the voices in her head, the cat coin. They all seemed to add up to this one figure. This single grinning shadow now right in front of her. It was a physical entity, not just a voice in her head that she couldn't shut out. Cat tightened her fingers together and angrily spat out.

"Who are you!?"

The lights dimmed, granting a feeling of relief in Cat's burning irises. She could make out the figure now, and it wasn't who Cat expected it to be. Her mouth hung open slightly.

"I don't understand...You can't be...You couldn't be..."

The figure was wearing the same black sleeveless leotard Cat had worn at the convention. The same ears...The same tail...The same face...The same eyes...Their only difference was that the person in front of her was completely covered in yellow-brown fur. She truly was a cat girl.

"You?" Smirked the figure.

Cat felt herself slowly walk towards the cat girl as she did the same. They were approaching each other almost symmetrically.

"What is it? Why do you have that look on your face? Are you...disappointed?"

"You're the one! You're the one who's been talking to me! Controlling me! Making me go out at night!"

There was an anger unlike anything else in Cat's eyes as she screamed. "Get out! Get out of my head!"

The clone laughed slightly, putting her hands around her waist. Cat felt herself do the same. "You think that it's that simple? That I merely a separate entity that's been pulling some puppet strings this whole time?"

They both continued to walk towards each other, Cat was dreading every step.

"Yes! You're using me! Changing me!"

Cat paused slightly, glaring her sharp teeth at the clone. "I HATE you!"

"You hate me, huh? That's a surprise. You've always hated me. From the beginning, I've done what you were too afraid to do. I've said things that you were too scared to say. I've acted in a manner that you'd never dare to act."

"Who are you!!!???"

The clone reached her hand out, Cat's arm did the same. They pressed against each other at an exact equal length. But something was off, the clone's fingers felt cold...solid. That's when Cat noticed that she wasn't touching a person, she was touching a flat surface. She was pressing her hand against a mirror.

"Cat, I AM you."

The crushing dread of realization momentarily suffocated Cat's lungs. She looked down at her arm, it too was completely covered in the same yellow-brown fur of the reflections. There was only one word that could sum up Cat's feelings at this point.

"No..."

"I am you." Repeated the reflection. "I am what you want to say. I am how you've always wanted to act. I am who you wanted to be."

The reflection grinned again. "No holds bar. I am the truth of your soul."

It was true. Tears welled up in Cat's eyes. Every word of the reflection was true. She couldn't deny it, but somehow the words still kept escaping her mouth.

"No...!"

"Sorry."

"No!"

"I am you."

"NO!"

"Wake up, Cat."

~

And Cat did wake up. In a cold sweat, on her mattress, in her room, alone. Just like all the dreams before...Vivid, realistic, believable. Cat breathed in and out, tears were rolling down her face even though she was no longer dreaming. Had she peed herself too? Or was that just the sweat dripping down her legs?

Braving the nagging doubts in her head, Cat looked down at herself. She was still in the leotard, still in costume, and...still covered in yellow-brown fur. The final change was complete. She shuddered and grabbed her knees, bringing herself in the fetal position.

The mirror...That reflection, her "other self"...Had that really happened? But there was no answer in the comforting darkness of her bedroom. And no wonder, when she looked over at her clock it read in big green letters "3:05 AM".

She was trying to compose herself, rocking gently back and forth and releasing waves of tears. After about fifteen minutes, she needed to tell someone. Hopefully Tandy would wake up at this hour. Cat pulled the covers over her head and quietly dialed her friend's number on her cellphone.

It rang three times, thankfully it picked up before the fourth ring, A tired voice mumbled a greeting on the other end.

"Hi...Uh...Tandy? Something...happened..."
1521111111111111111111112111111121111111.title: Self Aware.

1521111111111111111111112111111121111111.content:
Like most days in May within a lakeside mountain town, the rain was pouring down in buckets this early Monday morning. The houses were all still and silhouetted in the rain which blurred everything beyond a twenty foot distance in a sheet of water. There were no lights on, except for a single bedroom window light on the second floor of a rather plain looking white house at the corner of the street. Catherine Hill's house.

"Tell me again, one more time..." Muttered Tandy as she sipped her third cup of coffee. The first two had done little save take the edge off her foul early morning mood.

Cat sighed, her head was still under the covers. "I told you, when I got home I passed out immediately on the bed."

"Right...right...But what about the dream?"

Cat blushed slightly. "Well...I was thinking about something that happened between me and Alex yesterday...Only it happened differently..."

"You were dreaming about kissing him weren't you?"

"...It's that obvious?

"Afraid so. Anyway come on, get to the interesting part."

"...After...The kiss...Things started getting weird. I remember everything melting...Then darkness...Then a bright light and a figure standing in front of me smiling..."

Cat paused for just a moment, as if trying to re-visualize the scenario. Tandy was getting impatient though, it was only five in the morning after all.

"Yeah? And?"

Cat just shuddered and shook her head at the same time. "And the figure...It was...Me...Just like this now."

She pulled down the covers, completely revealing the final changes that occurred last night. Yellow-brown fur covered every inch of her body. She barely looked human now save for her body shape.

"I got angry at it...Started cursing at it. But we kept getting closer and closer together. I couldn't control myself. Then we touched, only it wasn't another person that looked like me. It was my...reflection in a mirror."

"Did the reflection say anything to you?"

"It said..."

The cat girl looked down then up, as if the words were being whispered into her ear. "...I am you."

Both girls looked at each other as thunder rumbled slightly in the distance. While Cat had an ominous feeling about the whole thing, Tandy laughed slightly.

"Sounds like you're mad."

"Tandy..."

"Cat, I honestly don't know what to make out of the dream. If it were anyone else, I'd say it was just a dream. But considering how previous dreams have been going for you..."

Cat recollected her nightly 'walks' and lied. She knew very well what the dream meant. "I...I don't know what to make of it either."

"Whatever the case, we have a bigger problem on our hands now."

"What's that?"

"It's Monday, the weekend is over."

The poisonous word every student hated to utter escaped Cat's lips. "School..."

"Good thing we went shopping this weekend for stuff to cover you up with. Right?"

"So, I'm supposed to dress up like I'm making a trip for the north pole in the middle of spring?"

"Have any better ideas?"

Cat groaned. It wasn't disguising herself for school that she was worried about. "I wonder what happened to Alex..."

Tandy huffed the surface of her coffee, creating a spray of hot brown liquid that splashed against Cat's face. "You are the most bipolar person I've ever met."

Cat could tell that Tandy definitely wasn't in the mood to be hearing her complaints, especially after she called her over at three in the morning.

"Sorry...I guess you don't want to hear about it..."

"Mmm." She mumbled through a sip out of her mug.

The rain continued to beat against the window, showing no signs of stopping for the remainder of the day. Even though it was late May, today felt slightly chilly, almost tickling Cat to the bone. This was not going to be a good day.

~

A large black overcoat, two dark mittens, an orange and black scarf, a black hat to cover her ears, a belt to secure her tail, a long midnight black skirt to cover the rest of her, and Cat was ready to go to school. Dressing her up surprisingly only took an hour, especially with Tandy falling asleep every ten seconds. The girls had a quick breakfast alone and left to walk to school.

"Funny." Said Tandy as they walked together in the rain. "I haven't seen your parents since you got the coin."

"Why does that strike you as funny?"

"I don't know, didn't you say it was your mom that gave it to you?"

"Yeah..." Said Cat, considering the fact that her parents might be practicing real druid magic.

"Well, doesn't that strike you as just a little bit odd?"

"I dunno. I don't want to really think about it."

Which was true, Cat had a lot on her mind. The fiasco at the convention yesterday, Alex running away, the conversation with herself in her dreams. The last thing she wanted to think about was her parent's unusual absence lately.

The rest of walk under the pouring rain was mostly quiet. Cat had never felt so exhausted and fully awaken at the same time before. Tandy's eyes were still half closed, she had drank seven cups of coffee at this point. The weather was doing its best depicting the mood between the two.

Of course, when they finally did return to school, soaking wet and tired, the unusual rat race began and Cat felt herself slipping back into the internal schedule her sub conscious had set for her Mondays. Her first class was study hall, which she wisely used to take a quick catnap.

People seemed to be taking her 'disguise' rather well, despite a few whispers that she was crazy to be walking around with that kind of heavy equipment even if it was a bit nippy today. Cat just prayed that no teacher would ask her to take her hat off.

She wouldn't see Tandy until lunch period, usually the same period she'd see Alex as well. This gave her plenty of time to do some quiet thinking to herself, vaguely paying attention to the lessons in class. Though she hadn't mentioned it to Tandy, the confrontation with the voice in her head had left Cat feeling very uncomfortable with herself. It felt like there was an animal being caged inside of her.

Plus all those things she had done in her sleep. She nearly attacked Tandy, she climbed along rooftops, even broke into Alex's apartment. Secretly, Cat felt she enjoyed doing all those things. It felt...refreshing. Like she really was letting the caged animal inside of her out for a change, to hell with the consequences.

Her morning classes breezed by, all Cat missed was turning in several homework assignments which she had neglected to do over the weekend. It was time for lunch, and thankfully Tandy seemed to be in a better mood since this morning.

"Hey Cat." Said the goth girl through two mouthfuls of tuna sandwich.

"Hey Tandy." She replied, taking a seat right next to her.

That was the extent of their conversation for the first brief minutes. Cat could still tell by looking at her friends face that she was under a lot of stress and sleep deprivation. She sighed.

"Listen...I'm sorry for this morning...And...Thanks for coming over. I really do appreciate it."

Tandy smirked. "You think I'm upset about that? I just found out I bombed a math test last Friday."

Cat laughed.

"But all the same Cat, thanks. For the thank you I mean."

"Mmm."

"Speaking of upset though, heads up. The bitch is coming over here."

Cat wondered who Tandy had meant until she looked up. Marlene, who had since combed her hair back down, was fast approaching the two with her lunch tray.

She smirked. "Hello Cat."

Cat returned the smile and nodded. Marlene's greeting to Tandy was somewhat strained.

"Tandy."

"Marlene."

"Do you mind if I sit here?"

Both Tandy and Cat gave replies at the same time, though each had a different answer.

"Not at all - Yes"

Tandy turned to Cat with the same expression a mother would give if her child told her that they wanted to be a ventriloquist when they grew up. Marlene laughed slightly, and sat down. Tandy sneered at the red head.

"The Sophomores not good enough to sit with anymore, Marlene?"

"Is there a problem with me being here, Tandy?"

Cat shot her friend a look. Tandy just sighed. "No, not at all."

"Alright then."

Lunch suddenly got even more awkward. Cat felt as if she were in the middle of an invisible between the two girls. Thinking quickly, she tried to come up with a topic of conversation.

"So, uh, Marlene. Have you seen Alex today?"

"Yeah, he's sitting alone over there."

She pointed to the table in the corner of the cafeteria. There he was, sitting in his usual polo shirt with a white bandage going around his head. But otherwise he seemed alright. Physically at least.

"And before you say anything else, I already tried talking to him. He won't say anything and demanded to be alone."

"Is...Is he alright?"

"I certainly hope so."
1521111111111111111111112111111121111111.title: Back to School.

choices: Something happens to Cat and Tandy on the way home.
Something happens to Alex and Marlene on the way home.
1521111111111111111111112111111121111111.content:
On the outskirts of Summerset, far across the lake from where Cat and the others were at school, there lived a decent forty year old man by the name of Thomas Montero. He was from Spain, he and his family had immigrated to America in the 1970's in search of better business. For Montero sold guns, he made them by hand and had perfected the craft over the years he spent in business in the United States. Truthfully, he never enjoyed making tools that killed, he'd always push it back into his mind by telling himself guns were meant to be protection. But that's another story.

Montero was married to his beautiful wife Sonia and had one child, Herman age fifteen. Montero slaved over his job that he hated to put his son into college, he'd be the first in the entire family to do so after all. He'd constantly pester Herman to study, unaware that Herman had no real ambition to go to school and instead wanted to become an artist. Fighting was a common thing at the Montero dinner table. Still, they pressed on with their passive aggressive lives.

It was already midday in the only gun shop of Summerset. Business was better than usual, often it was lucky if Montero sold even one gun to a customer, today he had managed to sell two before lunch. He sat at the counter, wiping bits of the roast-beef sandwich that his wife had lovingly made for him off his lips.

Just then, the front door bells ringed, signaling a new customer.

"Welcome sir!" Said Montero, with a slight Spanish accent. "How may I be helping today?"

The customer was rather short, at first Montero thought he was an underage kid trying to get away with buying a rifle to show off to his friends. But his choice in clothing, an overcoat with a fedora, suggested that he was older then his size let on. He spoke in a strange monotone voice.

"Thomas Montero, correct?"

"Yes sir, owner of Guns 'N Ammo. The best place for rifles in Summerset."

"So I've heard. I actually have a special request for you to fulfill."

The customer smiled, pulling out a dirty sheet of paper and placing it gently on the table for Montero to read. Montero picked it up and looked it over quickly. His face went pale.

"S-sir, I'm sorry to say but something like this would be illegal! You need a permit from the National Guard for this, and I can tell by your age that-"

"Montero. I really am not interested in your excuses." The customer pulled off his fedora.

Montero backed away from the counter, visibly shocked. "Y-you're-"

"It's of no concern to you who I am Montero. You're going to take my request, willingly or not."

It was police standard procedure to release information regarding escaped convicts to gun shops. The man before Montero was an escaped mental patient by the name of Maxwell Leonard. Montero slowly reached for the pistol hidden beneath the back shelf.

"Get out! Get out before I call the police!"

"You'll do no such thing."

Montero whipped out the pistol and aimed it straight at Leonard's head. "I'm warning you!"

Leonard just smirked and reached into his pocket. "Before you do anything foolish, perhaps you should take a look at this."

He pulled out what looked like a photograph and clicked it at the aimed gun shop owner. Montero slowly reached down for it but never took his eyes or gun off Leonard. His fear turned into rage.

"This is-!"

It was a photograph of his family, Herman and Sonia, both tied to a chair and blindfolded. They appeared to be bleeding from bullet holes in their legs. A gun was aimed at them by a man cut off in the photo.

"Kill me, and they die. You'll never find them and the blood loss will kill them if left untreated."

"You...!"

"I expect the order to be fulfilled in twenty four hours and placed in the dumpster at the corner of Fifty Second Street with extra ammunition and the remotes. If you call the cops before then, you'll find them both dead."

Leonard turned to leave the store.

"Wait you!"

"Tick tock, Montero." Came the reply.

Montero watched Leonard leave, he never stopped aiming his gun at him but there was nothing he could do. He didn't have much time.

~

If there was one class Cat enjoyed more then anything else, it was art. She proved to be quite the artist and was already in the Senior art class, in fact she had built up a little infamy for herself amongst the upperclassmen. Cat loved to paint during the class, it relaxed her and let her express herself in a way words and writing failed to. And after a somewhat stressful lunch, this was exactly what the doctor ordered.

Lunch proceeded in a way one would expect the outcome of telling two blood hounds to share the same piece of steak to end. Tandy and Marlene constantly got down each others throats the entire time, leaving few moments for pleasant conversation between the girls. Afterward, Tandy asked Cat why Marlene had even chosen to sit with them.

Cat had been wondering that herself. Maybe the talk she had with her yesterday really did change her. But she shrugged it off and continued her painting as Mr. Brushwood, the art teacher, walked by.

"Ah, Catherine! This is a lovely little painting, once again!" He said as he studied it.

"Thank you, sir."

"Very interesting...The girl is standing in front of a mirror and sees only a small cat...Why is that?"

"I was hoping you could tell me that, sir." Replied Cat, half jokingly.

"Being tight lipped, are we? Fair enough, every good artist always lets the audience decide for themselves. Hmm..." Brushwood held up the painting to take a closer look.

"You seem to be painting with a heavy brush, creating a very dark feel in the painting. The mirror means self reflection or awareness. And yet, the girl seems to be half turning away from it."

"So what does that mean then?"

"Well, if I had to guess, I'd say that the girl is ashamed of what she sees. You see, most of the time when we take a good look at ourselves, the reflection is never what we expect it to be. In this case, the girl clearly did not expect to see a cat. As to why you choose a cat...Well...I haven't the foggiest idea!"

Cat laughed slightly. "It's alright, I'm not sure why I choose it myself."

"Truly? Well then it's a mystery better left unsolved for now then. It's a good piece. By the way...Aren't you hot in all that winter equipment?"
