Underneath the layers of clothing, it felt like Cat was in a sauna all day. She couldn't wait to get home and rip off everything, but she lied. "No, I'm just cold is all."

"Maybe you're coming down with something then, you should go to the nurse."

"No, really. I'm fine."

"Well suit yourself."

The bell rang, school was finally over. "Ah, that's the bell! Remember class, bring your sketch pads tomorrow. We'll be doing figure drawing!"

Cat gathered her things and carefully placed the painting into her backpack, Mr. Brushwood turned to her before she left. "By the way Catherine. We should never be ashamed or afraid of who we are. Sometimes it's best if you just release the inner beast once in awhile."

She smiled slightly, but didn't quite get what he meant. "Thanks Mr. Brushwood."

~

"You sure took your sweet time." Said Tandy as Cat finally exited the school.

"Sorry, Brushwood held me back for just a moment with a critic on my painting."

"It's fine. I just figured you'd be in a hurry to get out of there. You know, with all the stuff on and all."

"Don't remind me please, let's just go home."

"Sure, want to come over to my place today?"

"Whatever works, let's just go. Fast."

Tandy looked over her shoulder. "Hey, there's Alex. He's walking home with Marlene. Boy, he doesn't look too happy."

Alex was crossing the street behind them, the look on his face was not a pleasant one. Marlene seemed to be trying to talk to him or cheer him up. He was ignoring her. Cat frowned.

"Let's just go."

"If you're sure Cat..."
1521111111111111111111112111111121111111.title: Hired.

1521111111111111111111112111111121111111.content:
As Cat and Tandy continued walking home in the opposite direction, Alex was focused on heading back to his apartment. Marlene continued to tag along in a vain attempt to put a smile on his face. It had been a rough day.

Aside from waking up in the hospital this morning, Alex had spent the beginning of his day barraged with questions from the police who were thoroughly concerned about his sudden disappearance yesterday. In fact, he was probably lucky didn't put him in a holding cell for his own protection. His missing sister never left his thoughts the entire day, she continually conflicted with his thoughts of Cat. It was complex and confusing. Like the two sides were competing for his attention. He didn't know which to turn to.

Cat...They almost kissed yesterday. Why did she turn away? Did she hate him? She must have surely hated him now. He was purposely ignoring her, but for good reason. His brother was constantly watching, Alex couldn't see him but he could feel him. He wouldn't let Maxwell hurt anyone, including Jamie and especially Cat. She couldn't get mixed up with this vendetta, this deadly brotherly squabble. But he didn't want Cat to hate him, he only wished she could understand. He wished he could tell her the whole story.

Alex and his girlfriend walked towards the downtown area. It was mid afternoon and the traffic on the streets was beginning to pick up, showing signs of the upcoming rush hour. A wide demography of people filled the sidewalks, bouncing and colliding off each other in a race to get to their respective destinations. Marlene had grabbed hold of his hand and was staying close to him, but Alex's eyes were straight ahead. It was a noisy mass pile up of human bodies, too loud to even hear yourself think.

Marlene had a thin red purse attached to her neck, which dangled at her side. She had probably never been pick-pocketed before, else she might have known better to keep it in such plain sight for any wandering hands.

A small figure rushed past her and violently tugged at the straps, which instantly came undone. Marlene made a wasted attempt to grab the thief, but the figure was already a good distance away.

"My purse!" She cried.

Alex's body had already begun to react.

~

Maxwell watched, with some amusement, as his brother chased after the little purse-snatcher he had hired. The two tore off into the crowds of people, gracefully bobbing and weaving between the gaps. The kid was a good runner, but Alex was certainly faster. Maxwell patiently drummed his fingers on the arm rest of the van.

"Kids these days are too expensive..." He muttered.

"What do you mean?" Asked Jonny Vale, as he polished a police shotgun in the backseat.

"When I was that brat's age, I would have happily done a gig like that for a few dollars. That kid wouldn't settle for less then a twenty."

"Times change."

"They do indeed."

Vale gently took apart the gun, taking extra care while dissembling every piece. "Why did you even need to hire the kid?"

"To gather information, I needed to see something."

"And you're not going to tell me what that is?"

Maxwell smirked. "No, I'll tell you. I need to get someone else that's close to my brother."

Vale was visibly confused. His scared face contorted. "Isn't the girl at the hideout enough?"

"She's necessary, but I need someone else too. I was hoping that the someone else would be my brother's girlfriend there."

"She's not close to your brother?"

Alex had finally caught the thief by the ring of his shirt. He was holding the kid up with one arm and took the purse away with his other. By now, Marlene had caught up to the pair as had a policeman who had been watching the entire time. Alex gave the kid a very annoyed look as he squirmed and tried to get away. Maxwell looked deep into Alex's eyes from the safety of the black tinted windows of the van.

"She is...But not in the way I require her to be."

"What's that supposed to mean?"

"It means my brother's an idiot. He's dating someone he doesn't really care that deeply for, when there's another person out there who truly matters to him. That's the person I need to go after."

"That doesn't answer the question about why we needed the brat."

Maxwell laughed. "Knowing Alex, if someone had stolen a simple purse from that person he cared for, he'd probably nearly beat them to death. My brother is very protective about the people that matter to him."

"So you used the kid to find out if that girlie was the one you're after? You're a cruel bastard..."

The police officer had begun taking the kid away, who was kicking and screaming. Alex handed the stolen purse back to Marlene who was overjoyed to have it back. Alex seemed completely indifferent, a smile curled on Maxwell's lips as he continued watching the two walk down the streets.

"It was worth a try. Besides, I'd figure my brother caught on to my plan when I left him alive last night. He's probably going to be hiding that precious person from me, even if they hate him for it. He's going to completely ignore them to save them from me. He's that kind of person."

Maxwell bit the tip of his thumb, a small drop of blood dripped down his finger. "That's fine by me brother, there are other ways to lure your secret lover out of hiding."
1521111111111111111111112111111121111111.title: Watched.

1521111111111111111111112111111121111111.content:
The apartment seemed to be in even more disrepair now that Jamie was gone. Alex paced around the floor, it was all he could do to relieve the tension. This was the third time he had tried to sit down and do homework but had to stop and think, too much was on his mind. He checked the clock again. Nine O'clock. Cat was probably still up, maybe finishing off any remaining homework or getting ready for bed. Jamie was probably alone in the dark somewhere, terrified and confused. The thought sickened him.

"God dammit!" He shouted all of a sudden, slamming his fist into a couch pillow.

Were they still watching him? Was his brother laughing at him as he paced the room around, tearing himself apart? Was this all part of his plan? Watching him suffer while Cat drifted further apart from him...

Alex cursed again and grabbed his coat. He couldn't take it anymore. He had to tell Cat, he had to know if she hated him for this.

~

For Cat, the rest of the day had gone by as a normal day usually would. Tandy decided to come over for a little bit again which was a nice distraction from the problems earlier at school, they both worked on homework before watching some new Anime after dinner. As usual her parents didn't show up again until they had finished dinner and by then Tandy had to leave. Overall, it was an uneventful evening.

Cat had just stepped out of the shower, she had to be careful now so that her parents didn't see their daughter as a soggy cat girl. Having all the fur proved to be quite the annoyance, she dripped all over the floor and it took three towels just to dry herself off.

After spending fifteen minutes blow drying her fur, she heard a tap at the window. Followed by another louder one. Someone was throwing rocks at her window. Cat quickly wrapped a towel around her head like a hood and looked outside. Alex was standing there, out of breath and looking nervous.

"Alex!?" Cat quickly opened the window. "Alex? Is that you?"

"Shh! Not so loud." The voice whispered back. "Can we talk?"

Cat looked around her room. She had a robe and could wear some slippers and a towel around her head, Alex probably wouldn't be able to notice her catty self in the dark.

"Okay, I'll be right down."

~

"Sorry, I didn't mean to bother you. I guess you just got out of the shower..."

"It's fine Alex, I could use some fresh air to dry off anyway."

Cat's parents were already asleep. She and Alex were both walking outside in the dark along the sidewalk, Cat had to be sure to stay out of the street lights as much as possible. But Alex didn't seem to be paying close attention to her too much. He seemed jumpy and jolted around at the slightest sound around them.

"Let's go to an dark alleyway..."

Cat blushed. "A-A d-dark alleyway?"

"W-wait, it's not what you think! C-crap that came out wrong! I mean..."

He bit his lip trying to find the right words. "I'd just prefer no one see us. I have something important to tell you but if anyone else heard..."

Cat blushed some more. Was he going to...confess to her? "O-okay..."

He couldn't have made that sound more awkward, Alex was also blushing slightly. He had to get her alone though, make sure that no one was watching them. He was already putting Cat at a huge risk doing this.

They picked a long dark spot between two tall houses, all that was around them was a few trashcans and liter. It was pitch black, but with her improved vision Cat could see Alex perfectly. She had never seen anyone look so tense in her life. He picked a spot against the wall and leaned against it, trying to compose himself. Cat just stood across from him, arms behind her back.

Silence. A few drops of water from the gutters was the only sound that could be heard. No cars were even out on the streets.

"Do you...Hate me?" Asked Alex at last.

"W-what?"

"Do you hate me?"

Unsure of where he was going with this Cat gave an instant reply. "Of course not! I mean, I don't really know you all that well. But I...I don't hate you Alex...Why would you think that?"

He gave a look of relief. "I just had to know...I've been acting unfriendly lately."

Another pause.

"Listen Cat, I think...You're in danger."

"What?"

"Remember how my brother escaped? How the police are after him?"

"Right."

"Well, he's after me now."

"Then why don't you tell the police!? They can protect you if-"

"Not like that. He isn't looking to physically harm me."

Alex sighed. "Something...Happened between us a long time ago. It ended with him going to jail and then the mental institution. He hasn't forgiven me since then. That's why he kidnapped Jamie, that's why..."

He stopped, not wanting to finish the sentence. "...That's why he's going to be looking for someone else I really care about. He wants to get to me through people that matter to me."

"...Isn't everyone you know in danger then? What about Marlene? She's your girlfriend, right? Isn't she in more danger than I am?"

Alex shook his head. "Okay...There's no easy way to say this..."

All Alex could see of Cat were her eyes shinning in the moonlight, the rest was covered in the darkness of the night. Cat could see him perfectly clearly though. Alex started fidgeting uncomfortably.

"I know this sounds...sudden....Hell it sounds completely retarded in retrospect. I mean, I've only really talked with you for a few days now. But the truth is..."

They both blushed at the same time.

"The truth is..."

It was like something was holding him back. A flare of doubt in his mind that was blocking the words from coming out of his mouth. He had to get this out. He felt like he was going to explode if he didn't.

"...You matter to me...A great deal...And...I don't know...I think I like you. A lot."

Cat was speechless.

"...I can't explain it...When I'm around you, I just feel whole. We've only really met for a few days and I can't stop thinking about the moments we're together. Even if it's just us talking. I don't know what it is...It eats me up inside. I've never felt this way about anyone, ever."

"...But what about Marlene?"

"I don't know. It's all confusing and not the same with her. She's a nice person, she's been a committed girlfriend too. But...She's not you."

Cat was having trouble taking in the sudden knowledge that her crush for an entire year had a crush on HER. She couldn't think of anything to say, her mouth mostly just hung open when she tried to speak.

"Look, the reason I'm telling you this is because...Well, it doesn't seem right that I ignore you without you knowing why. I want to protect you, I'd die to protect you. I won't let my brother harm you in anyway."

Cat's silence was making Alex nervous. "I must sound like an idiot don't I? Ungrateful to Marlene and interested in you in just a few days...But I swear on my life, I think I'm in love with you Catherine Hill."

"...love...you...too..." Mumbled Cat.

"Huh?"

"I-I-I s-said..." Cat gulped. "I love you too!"

Now it was Alex's turn to be speechless. Cat was starting to sweat from blushing so much. Did she really just say that out loud? Was that the wrong thing to say? Was he looking for another reply.

Then he laughed. It started slow and then grew louder, happier. Like he hadn't laughed in years.

"You have no idea...How happy it makes me feel to hear you say that." Said Alex, he wiped a few tears from his eyes. "I thought I was just being stupid..."

"N-no, I feel the same w-way about you...Since the start of the year, I-I've had a crush on you."

"Okay, now I really feel stupid for not knowing that..." Replied Alex, rubbing the back of his head.

"A-anyway..."

"Yeah..."

"So..."

They just looked at each other. It didn't feel wrong to stare at each other anymore. It didn't feel like stealing as it normally did. They felt obligated to, like if they turned away the other would vanish before they looked back.

"...Want me to walk you home?" Offered Alex.

"...Okay..."

He quietly grabbed her hand and lead her out of the alleyway.

"Are you wearing gloves? Your hands are padded."

"Y-yeah....It's cold out."

"Want to borrow my coat then?"

"No, it's a-alright..."

Cat looked up at the moon and smiled. "Everything's alright..."
1521111111111111111111112111111121111111.title: Under Cover of Darkness

1521111111111111111111112111111121111111.content:
Cat sat up in bed and stared at the alarm clock for the seventh time that night. In big green letters it read "3:17 AM", and as she had done the last six times she looked at the clock, Cat sighed and rolled over in her bed. It was going to be a sleepless night.

That was both a bad and a good thing, on one hand she didn't have to go around hiding in a ridiculously over-sized coat in the middle of spring but on the other she didn't get to see Alex. Her thoughts were still buzzing through what had just happened hours ago in the dark alley, she was trying to sort out all of her emotions before daybreak like a traveler trying to pack up for a flight that left in fifteen minutes.

Did she really just admit to Alex that she had a crush on him? Did he love her too? Had she just been dreaming the whole thing or was this all part of the mutation she had been going through? Perhaps she was losing her mind altogether...She wouldn't be surprised with all that had happened this past week, maybe the strain had gotten to her and she just snapped without even knowing it. Especially with that surreal dream she had just the other night involving the mirror. But then again, maybe this was karma. Maybe dreams did come true and finally things were going her way. She did wish into the coin to "win over" Alex after all.

But there was only one way to find out, wait until tomorrow. Cat groaned and sat up again. The clock read "3:24 AM".

~

"Christ, do you ever sleep Leonard? Even the little girl's out despite being blindfolded in the dark."

"You haven't been in maximum security prison before, have you Vale?"

"Nope, I had only been in the joint a few days until you busted me out."

Maxwell leaned back in the ratty armchair they had found behind in the alleyway. "Imagine a room completely lit up, like you were standing in the middle of an open field on sunny midday. Now imagine that, only it being three in the morning."

"Too bright?"

Maxwell laughed as he took off his fedora. "Nah, the brightness I could handle. When I was a kid we were lucky enough to even get light. No, it was the noise. The constant hum from the lights that burned on you. The sound that you can hear if you still your breathing long enough. It's enough to drive you insane."

"The noise from the lights kept you awake?"

"Essentially. But I didn't mind, I probably wouldn't have fallen asleep anyway. Too much planning to do. Too much on my mind...Since then though I haven't been able to have a decent night's sleep. My body wouldn't allow it until my mind has been put at ease."

Maxwell closed his eyes in thought then frowned. "What's your story anyway Vale? What were you in for?"

"I was involved in several muggings around town, I'm not some lunatic like you."

Maxwell ignored that last part. "Just the muggings? They don't throw you in the bin for a few simple muggings, speaking from one thief to another. You would have had to do something involving blood to get treated like a real criminal."

Jonny Vale sighed. "I...Killed a woman. I just wanted her purse. She screamed. She wouldn't shut up."

He closed his eyes as if trying to remember that moment in time. "Someone would have heard her. Someone would have caught me. I couldn't get caught then. Too much mattered and...God...She looked just like her..."

Vale stopped his tale for a brief moment, bringing a hand to his eyes. He choked slightly in a sob. "Nothing mattered though...After that I tried robbing another girl, she cut up my face." He motioned to his scar. "I'm going to kill that bitch...Because of her...She can't stand the sight of me..."

Maxwell smirked. "Tsk. It pains me to see a big man cry."

"Fuck off Leonard..."

"That's the spirit, why don't you get some rest? We got a fun job ahead of us tomorrow at the school, if you're still interested in tagging-along that is."

"Like I said, I'm after that bitch...And I have a feeling if I stick around with you I'm likely to see her sooner."

"Glad to hear it. Nightie night."

~

Cat groaned as she dragged her feet to her locker. Her mind didn't let her get a wink of sleep at all last night, and Tandy who usually had a cup of coffee that she might have been willing to share was nowhere to be seen this morning. She was probably just running late, but it certainly didn't help with Cat's mood. At least she could hide inside her coat and fall asleep without the teacher knowing it.

She could barely hold the weight of her textbooks she was feeling so out of it. Stumbling around, she made her way to her first class that day. Unknowingly she bumped right into...
1521111111111111111111112111111121111111.title: Waiting for Tomorrow.

choices: The news declares an incoming blizzard and that school is canceled.
1521112.content:
Cat realized she was thirsty... Very much so, and so she headed down to the kitchen.

Before she could stop herself, she had poured herself a bowl of milk, set the bowl on the ground, and had crouched down on all fours.

When she realized what she was doing, she stopped herself, before realizing she didn't actually have a problem with it.

Cat began lapping up the delicious liquid, using her flatter, longer tongue to scoop it into her mouth until the bowl was empty, and she had licked around her lips.

She turned the TV on, and watched the news as she waited for Tandy to arrive.
1521112.title: She experiences a craving for milk.

choices: She was the teacher was eyeing her during exercises, but she felt...Odd.
She was paired with a fat person as Gym Partner.
1522.content:
It was a sunny morning in Parthenon city, the first day of Carolyn Elson's Junior Year at High school.

Carolyn was a black haired girl with cerulean-gray eyes, svelte with an impressive bust she was easily the hottest 6 year old at her school. Carolyn was also a rather popular girl, mostly due to her status as a cheer leader. While she could be vapid at times she wasn't a rotten girl, but she could get bossy.

As she walked in, a clique of best friend wannabes and some old cheer leaders from last year said hi. Carolyn waved to them and smiled. She recalled that try outs were in a few weeks and that she'd be helping to pick those who did and didn't make it onto the team.

As she began to think about what kind of girls would be trying out this year when she bumped into an old friend of hers.

"Oh sorry there...Kim?" she said in shock. Kim was Carolyn's best friend since middle school. She had always been a tall, frizzy red headed girl with freckles peppering her face. Kim Sullivan also was in shape the last time Carolyn saw her, but this was no longer true. It was as if she had her body weight practically double. Kim now had a pudgy frame to put it lightly. Her entire body was caked in fat, and the large top she wore showed just a little bit of her massive belly, and showed signs of tightness. The large capris the girl wore must've been around size 46 at least.

"Oh hey Carry. Long time no see!" Kim said. "I missed you!"

"Hey Kim....What happened to you?"

"Well you know how my dad is a food connoisseur? Well during the summer he took me and my mom with him on the job and we got to eat at a lot of really good food from some five star restaurants. The people who worked at those places were so nice they even gave me free meals if I asked." Kim said in excitement, but a few moments later she looked embarrassed. "The thing is though I kinda noticed that I gained a few pounds..."

A few was putting it lightly, but Carolyn said nothing. "Well it's not that noticeable. I bet no one will say a thing."

"Really? That's good because I was thinking of trying out for the cheerleaders."

"You were?!" the raven haired teenager asked her friend. Kim nodded her plump head a few times.

"Yeah. We didn't get to hang out over the summer like we used to so I kinda wanted to use this as a make up. I've even practiced all the school cheers I saw you guys do at last years games."

"Well we were talking about changing the routines, so you may want to hold off..." Carolyn said, not wanting her friend to embarrass herself. Too bad Kim was never good at taking hints.

"That's okay. I can learn the new ones then." she said as the bell rang. "Oh that's the class. I'll talk to you later ok?"

"Alrighty. Bye Kim." Carolyn said waving before parting ways with her friend. Inside she felt a twinge of disgust and pity for her friend. To a girl like Carry her physical image was very important. If Kim hadn't eaten so much over the summer Carolyn would've thought her friend would be a shoo in for the squad, but because of her weight it was less than likely. The team already had it's heavy girls for the pyramid and other routines, but even they were barely pudgy.

'How could Kim have let herself go like that? the teen thought as she shuffled to class with the myriad of other students. She would rather die than be fat. She never really liked overweight people, more than likely because of her mother. Dianne Elson, to Carry there would be no one more embarrassing to have as a mother. Obese, divorced, and working a boring office job, she was everything Carolyn never wanted to be. Well maybe I can help Kim lose the weight...I won't let her get that bad.

With that he entered Mr. Hanse's class. She looked about and saw some familiar faces and some new ones. Among the old students here was David Parker, a handsome well built guy that Carolyn liked. He wasn't on any teams, but he did go to the games. So far he was single too. Maybe Carolyn would make her move after class.

The late bell rang and yet Mr. Hanse didn't show. The class began to talk idly, about the missing teacher, break ups, tv, and petty fights between classmates, when a young looking man came in and wrote his name on the board. He couldn't be more than five years older than the class.

"Good morning. My name is Mr. Edwin Garner." he said, "I'll be taking over Mr. Hanse's class."

"Excuse me Eddy." said a new boy.

"Mr. Garner."

"Uh yeah. Well what happened to Hanse?"

"Mr. Hanse retired all of a sudden. I was called in to take his place for the time being." Mr. Garner explained. This was odd considering Mr. Hanse was only in his forties. "In any case class lets begin our Physical Education class."

Despite the odd goings on Carry wasn't bothered until...
1522.title: A change in physique

choices: Carry grew extremely hungry, but she began to feel stronger the more she ate
She fell asleep and had an odd dream...One where she was fat.
15221.content:
Shortly after that the class headed to the locker rooms and changed. Since it was their first day Mr. Garner decided to have some fun with gym exercises. Of course Carolyn was wearing the school's signature blue and white shorts and shirt with a picture of a pelican on it. She seemed to be one of the few students wearing this ensemble as the others were in their own home brought clothes mostly.

Mr. Garner then walked out before the class and lead them through warm ups and other basic stretches. Carolyn found them simple enough, she had been used to it from cheerleading exercises. From there they went on to fitness tests.

"These exercises are to determine your general strength level and to see how I should pace the class." Mr. Garner explained. "We'll start with some sit ups and push ups and move to track and other events."

Carolyn was basically unperturbed by this, but moaned and groaned with the rest of her class.

When they started push ups she found it almost effortless. She managed to do sixty without even breathing heavily, her muscles feeling fine. No one seemed to notice except Mr. Garner who merely wrote on a clip board. A similar effect occurred with sit-ups, then when she ran the 500m dash she finished in school record time. This was the only thing that didn't go unnoticed.

"Jeeze!" said Leo, a track team member. "Steven Tyler didn't even go that fast. You ever think about joining the track team?"

Carolyn was a bit embarrassed. Steven Tyler was the school's top athlete, he was also a practical all star. Although she was flattered she was also embarrassed, cheerleaders weren't supposed to be that athletically gifted. Carolyn wasn't even muscular so she wondered how she had managed to do so much so easily.

She just felt so powerful, she had no idea why.

"You must have good genetics." Mr. Garner said to her from seemingly nowhere, bothering her. "Genetics are an odd thing. They give some of us the extra edge we need to succeed and survive, but they can also have negative effects. What we make into positives or negatives are entirely up to us."

The words he had said were still in Carry's brain as the class bell rang. Almost the entire rest of the day was uneventful, but during lunch she saw David sitting down at a table by himself. She decided to take a seat by him.

"Hey David," she said calmly as she came by, her heart fluttering. "Mind if I sit by you?"

"Not really." he said, not rudely or in a friendly tone. His voice just seemed blank.

"So...did you enjoy class earlier?" she asked as she ate some salad. The boy shrugged.

"It was fine, I think you did well though."

"Really?! That means a lot." she said, " I was worried you'd think I was a freak."

"Why should you care? Ultimately what makes you happy matters most, not someone else's opinion."

Yeah, but I still feel like I was on the spot. Especially the way that sub talked to me at the end."

David was about to say something back when Kim's voice rang out.

"Hey Carry!"

The heavy set ginger then waddled her way over to the table and sat down just as David was starting to open up. Carolyn was exasperated.

"Hi Kim..." she said.

"I saw you over here and thought I'd sit with you." she said, already eating the burger off of her tray and smiling. She then looked at David. "Oh hey David."

"Hey...Kim right?" he replied.

"Yeah." she confirmed. " It's been a long time."

"It has." he said before standing, "look I've got to go to the library. See you two later maybe."

"See you." Carolyn sighed. The 16 year old girl tried her best not to blame her friend.David was barely opening up, but he had at least spoken before Kim showed up. Carolyn was still annoyed as she heard her friend smack on food.

"So Carry, you and him seemed pretty friendly. You like him?"

"Well, kinda." Carolyn said blushing. she saw Kim use her old snicker whenever she was right. It was so odd seeing that obese version of her friend use it.

"I knew it. I must've totally killed the mood."

"Well maybe just a little." Carolyn admitted, her blue eyes consoling, "But just wait a bit next time ok?"

"Alright." Kim agreed as the girls shared a laugh, unbeknownst to either a few of the other popular girls saw this and came to the conclusion that Carolyn was pitying Kim.

Time passed and the school day ended. After a long bus ride home Carolyn arrived at her home. It was a boring suburban house that her mom struggled to pay for.

Getting out her house key Carry went in and saw that everything was neat, yet no one was home.

Looking down she saw a note.

Carry, I'm working late tonight. I made dinner for you, and there are snacks in case you are still hungry. I will call you when I get off.

Love, Mom

Carolyn sighed and just went to her room to get some of her books covered and other first day assignments in order.

Eventually though....
15221.title: Strange changes indeed

choices: She saw that she had grown fatter!
She saw some stranger in there!
152211.content:
As the day went on and Carolyn felt herself grow hungry. It felt as if she had never had lunch in the first place.

{i'}I guess I should have something to eat.' she thought to herself. She made her way into the kitchen and looked in the fridge and pulled out the other salad she had made. She quickly finished it, yet it did little to alleviate her hunger pangs. Even so she did her best to ignore them, but about an hour later she could hardly take the burning sensation any longer.

Looking to see what her mother had made she saw that there were six steaks, some mashed potatoes, and some green beans.

'Well I guess I can have one steak today.' she thought as she prepared a plate and ate. She was amazed by the flavor, it had been a long time since she had eaten anything her mother had made. It was refreshing after all of the cold uncooked vegetables and virtually bland pieces of cold cuts. She finished the meal and was quite pleased, yet she found herself wanting more. She walked over to get more, but it was so fast it seemed as if she was running. It hardly bothered her since she just wanted more steak for now. Carolyn also added more vegetables and potatoes to her plate and finished them in no time.

Thirty minutes later, after the process continued to repeat itself Carolyn had finished every bit of dinner, and had even eaten a few brownie snack cakes her mother had made. She felt nice and full, but at the same time guilty and surging with some unknown force.

Looking at the clock she saw that it was six, about time for her shower. She went up stairs, still moving faster tan normal, and found herself there at the door in no time. When she tried to open it though it started to compress under her grip.

"What the hell?!" she gasped. "Doorknob metal must be cheap."

Ignoring this she went inside and undressed, she was concerned about her bloated belly after the meal. It was quite large and for some reason there was extra flab around her midsection. It made no sense. Hours earlier her figure was trim and neat and yet flab had materialized out of nowhere. Now she was feeling self conscious.

'Damn it! Tomorrow I'll have to exercise a bit more. Still If I'm so athletic why do I have this fat on me?'

After that she took a quick shower and changed into her pajamas, which felt a little tighter than usual, only annoying her further and making her more determined to lose the weight, her stomach was even poking out against the material, and the bottoms were really snug on her backside for some reason.

After watching tv for an hour or so and writing the day's events in her private journal she went to bed.

All that night Carry felt odd. Her breathing pattern grew off and her clothes more constricting. For some reason she felt like she was going to burt out of her nightwear. Eventually she unconsciously tore them off, but that wasn't enough as her panties felt as if they were lodged into her backside and her bra was no longer intact, having burst mid-sleep. The only thing that made Carry bother to wake up was the need to relieve herself.

When she entered the bathroom...
152211.title: Might from a meal

choices: She began to change again during school and had to leave, but ran into trouble!
She tried to look into what caused her to change.
1522111.content:
While in the bathroom and looking in the mirror Carolyn saw herself in the mirror, but she was much more rubenesque to say the least.

Her entire body was covered in a thick layer of fat, so thick that it made Kim's size look minor.

Her cheeks were plump, as was the rest of her face, and she had double chin, bordering on a third. Her stomach was expansive, so much so that her top rode up and barely contained her impressiveli engorged mammaries.
In addition to these she had a huge pair of thunder thighs and a massive rear. All around she was fat, but it seemed proportioned. Still Carolyn was flabbergasted.

"What the hell?!" she yelled loudly, beyond appalled. This had to be a dream. Carolyn pinched herself to see if she could wake up, but she felt nothing but the squish of fat. There wasn't even a tickle. Still this obviously was NOT a dream.

'I've got to figure out what to do...But what can I do?!" she asked herself. She knew no one who could give her answers and had nothing that could fix her, plus she was tired.

'Maybe...I'll take a nap.' she yawned. 'I'll deal with this tomorrow.'

With that she walked with a slight waddle back to her room, when she opened the door though it nearly tore off the hinges. It shocked the now plus sized girl, but fortunately it'd pass for being useable.

She gingerly laid on her bed which now seemed small and creaked under her weight. After a while she was snoozing restfully.

The next morning Carolyn awoke groggily and saw herself back to normal. She blinked in surprise, but was relieved.

"It was a dream..." she began when she saw that her clothes were stretched and ripped in places, and her door was still in bad shape. "Or not."

She was still worried about what had gone on, but decided to worry about getting to school first...After she got some breakfast. Going through the fridge she saw little that was readily available, so she decided on a couple apples. She also had to prepare a salad.

Later on...
1522111.title: Carolyn's big problem!

choices: Mr. Garner, and he recognized her
A handsome guy who had a come out of a limousine
15221111.content:
Carolyn arrived at school not long after all of this went on. She was still disoriented from it all...Her incredible appetite, her newfound physical abilities, and now suddenly becoming fat last night. It was like some kind of surreal dream...She hardly believed that it had happened.

The day progressed as it had yesterday, but Carolyn didn't run into Kim and ate a large breakfast at school. This time no fat appeared on her body though after she ate, to her relief.

She started out on PE again for her starting class, which was merely a lesson on basic warm up exercises. Mr. Garner was still subbing and aside from that nothing interesting happened. After that she attended Geometry and towards the end of class she began to feel odd.

She then noticed that her clothes were becoming tighter and tighter, her flesh expanding and becoming flabbier.

'Oh not again! she thought. Her first impulse was to run somewhere and hide. Immediately she saw the Lost and Found area and went in. It was unattended. She heard a noise that signaled that her clothes were ripping. Quickly she stripped to preserve them and sighed when the changes were done, both from relief and exasperation. "Great. Well now what the hell am I gonna wear?"

A moment later she saw that the lost and found box was open. She was against taking clothes people had lost or discarded, but it was either that or go around nearly naked as she refused to stretch out her clothing.

Rummaging through them she found some jeans, mismatched shoes, old faded shirts, and a stained jacket before finding an acceptable outfit. She discovered a large black blouse with a pink heart on it and some large matching sweatpants. They were XXL sized and not very fashionable, but she still put them on. They were snug as well for some reason, but at the very least most of her body was covered.

Now that she had clothes she was considering going to her next class, but then she'd have to explain all of the changes in her body and no one would believe her.

'I better just leave for now...I'll just go out on town for now and tell everyone I was sick tomorrow.' she thought as she packed her things into her backpack.

She left the room and waddled uncomfortably as she exited the school, not many people paid attention to her, but the ones who did either didn't look too long or recognize her.

Once she was out she began to worry about what was happening to her.

'What if I just keep getting bigger and bigger until I can't move any more? Then how am I supposed to cheerlead?' she thought, before another thought struck her. If she was stuck like this she couldn't cheerlead because she would be kicked off the team. As she continued to worry she bumped into someone."

"Oops. Sorry...I didn't see you there." she said apologetically. She had bumped into a man who seemed to be in his twenties, he was medium build and looked less than pleased.

"I bet you can't see much over your fatass stomach bitch," he replied roughly looking her over. Despite his evident disdain there was something of an attracted look in his eyes (mostly evident after he eyed her breasts). "Still if you're so sorry you can pay me back a couple of ways...Starting with your wallet. I'll tell you what you can do from there."

"What? No way!" she told him angrily, after scowling the man drew a pocket knife and waved it.

"It wasn't a request. Now do it!"

Reacting from shock Carolyn automatically punched at the man. She heard a noise and felt the hit connect. The man was knocked onto his back groaning. The black haired girl was shocked, but relieved when she saw him get up, she was worried that he was seriously injured because of a crunching noise she heard.

The relief disappeared when she saw him stand shakily and cough up some blood, teeth coming out with it.

"The hell?!" he shouted clutching his mouth with his free hand. He looked at Carolyn and was torn between trying to retaliate from anger or run for safety. He chose the former and rushed her. "You freak! I'll make you pay!"

This time Carolyn had no reflex, but ran. The man chased her still, but within a minute she managed to get far away. When she stopped running she was near the city limits, before she was in the center of the city.

'Damn...That was scary...At least I got away from that asshole.' as she composed herself she discovered it was nearly the end of the school day, she had to get back there or she'd miss the bus. Still getting on still looking different would be awkward.

"How am I supposed to get back now?" she asked herself when a male voice spoke.

"Maybe I can offer you a ride home."

Turning around Carolyn saw...
15221111.title: A powerful lesson for Carolyn

choices: Hours later at home Carolyn thinks over this hero thing.
Carolyn discovers she is unable to change back at will, and is bothered
152211111.content:
It was Mr. Garner, what was he doing this far from the school? Being a sub it was possible that he clocked out early, but his talking to someone who was an apparent stranger.

"Well, do you need a ride or not Carolyn Elson? It would be no problem for you to run back like that, but it'd raise suspicion."

Carolyn was beyond shocked, this teacher had managed to recognize her very easily, and he wasn't even slightly surprised by her change in appearance.

"Wait, you can recognize me?" she asked pointing a plump finger at her bigger figure.

"Somewhat. It's not that difficult if you really look for key features in your face. You might want to go with a mask or something to hide part of your face."

"What? Why?!" Carolyn asked, getting more and more confused. "You're not making sense."

"I'll explain in a more private place." he said calmly, "I doubt you'll believe me at first, but it is the truth...That is if you care to hear it."

Slowly, Carolyn made her decision.

"Ok, I'll go with you." she said sighing and managing to squeeze into the vehicle. For a long time they rode in silence until Carolyn's stomach growled. She was mortified...Being overweight and driven around by a teacher she hardly knew didn't help things either.

"Here, eat this." the dark brown haired teacher said, handing her a triple layered bacon cheeseburger. It was still warm and fresh. "It should hold you for the moment."

"Thank you." she said gratefully. Normally she would automatically turn such a fatty food down, but she was too hungry to care. She quickly began eating it and spoke with her mouth semi-full. "So you know why I suddenly got so big?"

"Yes. It's a super power." Mr. Garner said calmly. The blue eyed girl had no such composure

"A what?!"

"Super power. Well the fat is a side effect. You see super powers do exist, and so do heroes and villains, but it's not exactly like the comics. Heroes are born through heredity. There are no aliens from dying planets or radioactive spiders who bite people and give them powers. You have to be born with it and it shows itself as the person nears adulthood. You're one of those lucky few."

"Yeah, some heroes can fly and read minds, I can just turn into a ball of lard. I'm super lucky." she replied sarcastically.

"It's only so you can keep your abilities running. When you activate your powers your physical abilities reach superhuman levels. If my estimations are right your strength and speed levels are ten times what a normal person in an adrenaline rush would have, and you have other increased physical abilities I can't figure out yet. Your body just needs a lot of energy to maintain that kind of strength so your body stores large amounts of fat which reveals itself when your powers activate."

"So because I'm so powerful I have this fat on me?"

"Yes, and an increased appetite. Still as you've expended some energy you've gotten thinner than you were before."

Looking at herself Carolyn did see that her new clothes were much looser than before despite her still being much larger than she previously was.

"Wow. But can I cut it on and off?"

"No idea yet, but I do know something." Mr. Garner said, finally they neared the school and he entered the parking lot. He put his car in the designated area and looked at her with his gentle green eyes. "As odd as it is, you have a gift. A gift you should use wisely. Your powers aren't anything to laugh at and you could do the world some good if you decided to use them to help mankind. Of course you aren't obligated to, but it's something to think about. Either way if you have questions I'm more than willing to answer them."

"Ok. Thank you Mr. Garner." Carolyn said gratefully. She was pretty overwhelmed by what he said, and slightly confused, but at least she had an idea of what was going on. "Say...How do you know so much about heroes anyway? And are there villains too if there are heroes?"

"Of course there are villains as well, but you're going to miss your bus."

"Yeah, but you didn't answer-"

"I will some other time." he said re-starting his car and backing it out. "Until then!"

With that he drove off, leaving Carolyn to her own devices.
152211111.title: Mr. Garner, and he recognized her

1522111111.content:
Time passed before Carolyn got back home. It had taken awhile but she finally managed to get back to normal, thank God, and make it back before her mom got worried. She was fortunate enough to get to the girl’s room and

When she returned though she did indeed see her heavyset mother, a woman of at least 320 lbs. She had the same cerulean eyes as Carolyn, and there was some facial similarity between them, hidden by layers of facial fat and four chins. She was holding her cell phone in her hand and looking worried.

“Oh Carolyn, thank goodness you’re home!” she said, “Where were you?”

“Uh…I had to finish a test after school.” Carolyn lied quickly, “Sorry I didn’t get a chance to call.”

Carolyn’s mom managed to waddle over and give her daughter a hug, but Carolyn hardly felt she needed it.

“You should’ve called. I thought you might’ve ran into trouble….Parthenon City has some shady people and I was worried that you got raped or something.”

“Mom! I was fine, nothing like that happened!” the teenager countered, not letting her mother know something of that nature nearly happened. “Anyway can you let me go? I have homework.”

“Alright. But be careful from now on sweetie.” Her mother said, sounding a bit wounded. “By the way I’m ordering pizza tonight. I know you probably don’t want any but on the one in a million chance you do what do you want on it?”

“Err…I’d actually like one whole one for myself. With everything on it please.” Carolyn said, her new hunger was making her want more and more food…Probably to store more calories for her power. “And a soda or two.”

“What? Aren’t you worried about ruining your figure?”

“Hey, even cheerleaders can splurge every now and again.” She countered, semi playfully. “Anyway I’m going to go now. Bye mom.”

“Bye.”

Slowly Carolyn trudged up to her room and laid in bed, worrying about her new issues.

She could just give her teachers a sick note and make her work up, but this whole being super strong, and super fat, deal was bugging her. She wouldn’t mind it so much if she could just be her regular self, but all that flab and fat surrounding her body when she really tried to use it…It was less than ideal.

‘I could just not use those powers…But that would be a waste.’ She thought, ‘Mr. Garner did say I could help people and I know I can, especially after the way I dealt with that jerk with the knife. I do have to learn more about Garner though, he didn’t answer my questions and he acts like a suspicious guy, even though he was nice earlier. Either way...I think I’ll give this thing a shot.’

Carolyn made her decision uneasily at first, but as time passed she became more confident with her choice. She knew she’d need a costume and a name to start off with before she gave this thing a try, but it would come to her in time.

“For now some channel surfing.” She said watching tv. She flipped through channel after channel until she stopped on a bra add.

He was completely caught off guard by the whole PMS thing. Talk about feeling like crap and along with bleeding to go with it. He was finally starting to get the hang of things, although he didn't become feminine he was a tomboy jeans, tops and hoodies are his thing not skirts or dresses.

The day came when he decided he was ready to work, I needed to have a job so he got a job in a shop. Fortunately the job wasn't that difficult for him to learn, since it dealt with mostly a cash register and hanging up clothes. It was nice that the people he worked with are welcoming. For the most part he is doing a good job and went home without much social interaction with his co-workers. Then he got invited out for a meal by a few co workers, It was a really fun night.

Now he has pretty much tackled everything that came his way since becoming a woman. From panties to PMS I was getting better at it everyday, but there was one thing that started to creep into my mind, and that one thing was sex. Now he hadn't even masturbated as a woman.

Alexander or Alexandra as it is now started thinking about it but just laughed at himself as he isn't interested in it right now...

Although he's sure a co-worker is interested in him...

Who is the co-worker?
